reviews.review: Great Night Out. I went to Happy Valley on the Wednesday night of a recent business trip. Entrance is only HK$10 at the public entrance and that is the only area you need. Minimum bets are HK$20 and there are lots of beer tents and food outlets. A good nights entertainment in HK.
Happy Wednesday. It isn't a trip to HK without a visit to Happy Valley races. Even if you aren't into horse racing it is well worth a look. Amazing location and atmosphere.

Unexpected surprise. My husband and I took the ding ding all the way to the end of the happy valley line and ended up here. You can use your octopus card to get in, fairly inexpensive, and have a blast drinking beer and eating juicy hot dogs and delicious curly fries.We didn't bet on the horses as we'd never been to a horse derby before, but there were many people that did and it was still super exciting to watch. Also, of note, casual dress is not a thing here. Many men were wearing suits and women hats and dresses.

Pleasure night out. Very nice vibe atmosphere. I enjoy night out with friends. The food is decent price, the service is quick with happy face, clean restrooms, well-dressed people, live entertainment and great way to get to know other expats. There are a lot of security guards and customer services ...No hooligans or violence drunkard here

Team night out. Great team night out after work. Bets start from hk $10 and its hk $10 to get in too (You can pay with octopus). Jugs of beer about $150Pretty bizarre to see a racetrack right in city centre. Apartments literally all around. Great atmosphere

Nice way to beat the weekday blues. Was in hongkong during Wednesday and went here to check what all the fuss is about. Huge gathering of people who are horse racing enthusiasts.The atmosphere gets pretty electric in here. Didn't bet anything as this was my first time in a racecourse but used free wifi to read about the game and almost tried my luck. You can go there for reasonably priced beers, electric atmospheres during races which happen after every half hour and good view of the skyline
FIrst visit. First time here, not for horse racing but the Oktoberfest. There is lots of fun, beers, snacks. It is fun participating in international events. Watching horse racing is fun too!

Nice party venue with great terrace! . The Millions is a nice venue with big terrace. The terrace is big enough to put a few round tables for dinner outside during cooler weather. Dining and overseeing the race course is quite an experience.

Goodluck. The Race course is hardly a tourist spot for us locals. First of all, there is a race per se to become a member for the right just to go in . Then, it is a place where fortunes are made or broken up. It is not the Jockey Club's policy to encourage gambling. But, Chinese are fond of gambling and most people don't see it as a high society activity. I wish you the best of luck!
Great fun and atmosphere!!. Went here Wednesday night, good vibe and lots of people having fun watching the races. Worth checking out!

Great night out.. This place must rake it in! It's huge, with thousands attending weekly and multiple opportunities to gamble and drink, all for only $10 entry. I first attended during their 'Oktoberfest' season and there were also lots of (mainly drinking) games to take part in too. They're even welcome to the huge sums I lost...all of $100.

You do not need to be a player to have fun here. Maybe it was the extra festive and lively when there's a Oktoberfest. Helpful clerks helped us novices to fill in betting vouchers.It's easy to get carried away for a newbie.
The beer is flowing, the environment is spectacular.Winners and losers seems equally hilarious.Expect no culinary experience, and interpretation of Bavarian cuisine was more than mediocre

Stable Bend - Great place to experience Happy Valley. Happy Valley is great fun, not matter if you are into horse racing or not. We visited Stable Bend, they serve a nice buffet and free float of beers and softdrinks. You can bet on the horses and has a great view, though you cannot see the finish line!

Great tourist attraction and a must do. What an atmosphere with thousand of local people cheering their favourite horse. Bets starting at HK$10 so always fun to punt on some of the horses and if lucky can get a decent return especially if you bet on the outsider horses.

A great night in a fantastic location.. This is a must for anyone visiting Hong Kong. HK$ 10 gets you in and the party atmosphere is great. At the trackside it's fast food and beer, soft drinks or wine. Prices are cheap, and staff are helpful, whether betting, eating or drinking. The horse racing spectacle is tremendous, with the surrounding hills and multi stories creating a natural amphitheatre. If you have a winning bet, it's a bonus on a great night out.
Top things to do in Hong Kong. We definitely had a blast! Few beers and a little betting! There was a lot of people but hey we're in Hong Kong!
Nice but. I went during Mid Autumn and they are closed. Be sure you check their calendar before you plan this. It is also easily accessible by tram.

Fantistic night at thr racers.. My husband and I had a wonderful night at Happy Valley.We were on a tour that included hotel transfers, dinner in the Jockey Club, Drinks, and a $30 betting Voucher.A most do while visiting Hong Kong.

"hidden" treasure in the middle of Hong Kong. We live in Kentucky, so we are pretty particular about our horse racing. ;) We went on a whim on a Wednesday night and it was a whopping $1 US to get in, we were able to get right up on the rail to watch, the food was decent and the beer was cold, the facility itself was clean and spacious. They even have people available to help you place your bet who are super helpful. Great way to spend a weeknight!

Fabulous! . We went for a planned trip organised via our hotel. Would highly recommend doing this. We were picked up and taken to the jockey club building. We we were shown to the restaurant with a private bar, betting boxes and fantastic views from our private terrace. Food was great and generous topping up of beer and wine through the night! Had a great night here. The highlight was we had the option to go down to the race course. Got to be up close to the horses before a race. Then we got to stand right opposite the finishing line!! Amazing. You gave to go! Good luck.

So much fun!. This is like the Kentucky Derby but you're surrounded pretty much by Hong Kongers
I didn't bet as I don't trust the horses, but everyone was screaming up and down and I joined in the fun
The lounge area was pretty interesting, and the food was pretty decent.

Worth a visit to get a feel of the horse racing habits of the locals. Worth a visit to get a feel of the horse racing habits of the locals. Just a few hours to experience the excitement of horse racing, even if you are not a horse better.
A great night out. The biggest racetrack I have ever been too, good atmosphere from the public stands, bands and plenty to keep you amused. Can use your octopus card to pay for entry.

World famous venue. We visited on a non-race today to see what it was like. It's very impressive even without horses. Well worth a look. While we were there other sports events were taking place-football, rugby and hockey, and there was lots of runners/joggers using the stadium as a course.

Great time, would go again!. We booked a table at Stable Bend Terrace, a smart casual venue. This provided a comfortable vantage point of the race track and nice BBQ buffet and free flow of beer, wine. Overall party like atmosphere throughout the race course. In general, there are a variety of ways to enjoy the races - general admission to members lounges and in between. Race nights only on Wednesdays. Placing bets as low as 7 USD just to give you something to root for.

Happy Wednesday!. We were lucky enough to have a catered package in the guests members area. This was due to our VRC membership having some reciprocal rights with the Hong Kong Jockey Club. After enjoying a very good meal we went to the lawn to meet some local friends. The atmosphere was buzzing with a friendly and eclectic group of people. Hong Kong knows the value of utilising their limited land and there was a game of soccer on the pitch in the middle of the course before the game! It was easy to get to and was one of the highlights of our trip.

Happy Wednesday . Hong Kong blew me away...but Happy Valley blasted me over the moon. Setting is historical, atmosphere breathtaking. In the middle of the high rise buildings lining the night sky..sits Happy Valley race course. What a party!!! Massive crowd puller to watch quality racing

Even if you have never visited the races before this is a must see in Hong Kong. A mid week race meeting at Happy Valley on a wet September night still saw the place with plenty of punters and others just enjoying the experience all for $10HK (approx. $1.50)
Fun evening activity. If you have never been to a horse race this is something to experience. Many people gamble on the races but I had fun just seeing the race up close.

Be prepared for your clothes to smell of cigarette smoke until they are washed. Great time and massive track. Easy to have a bet,but difficult to find a bar. Amazed that the locals sit under the stadium watching the races on TV, rather than walking outside to watch them run around.

A Must on Wednesday nights. Either you like to bet on the races or not, you will like the joyful young crowd on the open nights.Free access and beer stands will make sure for a funny night out, away from the up and downs of soho and central district.Some evening there's also live music and special cultural happenings.Keep an eye on the program..

More than just horse racing. One of the family members can access to the Happy Valley Racecourse clubhouse; there is a Racing Museum inside the Happy Valley Racecourse clubhouse. I was reading over some local blogger's about the Happy Valley Racecourse of the early 20th century and there were some facts about the Happy Valley, for example there was a huge fire in the late 1800s which caused more than 700 death.
superb exciting. This place is full of excitement. Not every day there is race. Whether you are betting or not, you must visit this place.

Great experience!!. If you like betting this the perfect place to go, with friends, or be ready to meet lovely people trying to bet as well with a large beer. Great atmosphere and ambiance, a must do in Hong Kong, even if you are not a big horse ridding fan.

Awesome Night out. Wednesday night was so much fun. Great vibe, beer not too expensive and themed Brazilian night.What a location!Tough to get taxi after, so visit a nearby pub until it quiets down.Staff there will also help you fill out betting slips! Fast!.
Great plan for a Wednesday evening!. I have been to the races a couple of times already, fun and cheap plan to do on a boring Wednesday evening! I recommend it.

Favorite part of HK. Happy Valley race course is my favorite attraction in HK. You don't need to be a horse racing aficionado to go to the track Wednesday night. You can bet small and the staff is quite helpful and patient with you while putting in a bet.
Wednesday night fun. Well worth a visit if you're in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night. Very casual, lots of entertainment - music, shows, food and of course gambling on the 10 races.
Sbeautifully kept.. This is a place to visit if your into your horse riding. Although on my visit the course was shut. But the jockey club is a good place to visit.
An evening at the races. Great fun. Especially if there are lots of you meeting up. Even better if you manage to win.The trams go right outside so easy to get to.

Good atmosphere but long waiting between races. This was my first experience in a horse race course, so i was not sure what to expect.The whole evening was well planned. There is live music, beers & food, as well as betting whenever you want.However, i found the time in between races to be rather long. That could be a norm in horse racing, but it was the only issue i had.

Exciting and fun. Happy Valley Racecourse is one of the icons in Hong Kong. It is located in Happy Valley near Causeway Bay so it's super convenient. Locals here love horse racing since the colonial period. Now it's more than a game to go but also a night of entertainments. Hong Kong Jockey Club often organises different events and food stalls etc for both gamblers and spectators. You can have close encounter with the horses and when you hear "tabdak tabdak" as the horse running on the track, your heart is beating faster and faster. It's the most exciting experience you can get. Both day race and night race are fun. You can check the schedules on Hong Kong Jockey Club website because the racecourse is only open when there are races.

A Hustling Place. This is a beautiful place to go for night races, its so well illuminated & properly organized & One can see the horses running at speed & the betting results in Seconds. You can bet even on Phone if you maintain an account with Jockey club & the winners get credited immediately.

Great experience. This iconic racecourse is surrounded by high rise buildings. The night races are held most weeks and tourists can get in cheaply if they show their passport. We paid top dollar to eat in the top floor buffet restaurant and had a great view down to the course. Loved it

Great way to spend a few hours on a sunny day. My husband and I were in Hong Kong in November and wanted catch a few races. It was super easy to get there and entrance was only 10HKD. The website has info on different experiences and entry levels but we were happy enough to hang with the commoners. I haven't been to many races, but this was probably the most fun I've had soaking in the scenery and surroundings and people watching. The icing on the cake was that we backed a winner on the a few of the races :)

Must visit while in Hong Kong. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Hong Kong on a wednesday. The entrance price is 10HKD. There is no need to gamble, but the exctiement is even greater if you hand in one of those coupons. Always good atmosphere and loads of people
sooo much fun.... Go to the races! Experience the horse-races, bet on your choice of horse and get a beer or 2! Maybe you win, maybe you loose - but it really is a great experience!
To feel the exciting race. Even you are not a gambler I still suggest all tourists to spend a great evening there. However, there is no any race during the hot summer season.

The Racecourse just in the middle of the city. It is a very nice place to visit in the evening, besides betting on the races, you can enjoy the beer garden with different kind of beer all over the world, delious Chinese and European food are also provided. Live musics and dancers created a nice atmosphere all night long. This is a program you shouldn't miss when you are in Hong Kong. Race meeting is on most of the Wednesday night from September to early July.

Green grass in a concrete jungle.. Coming from New Zealand this was always about comparisons. We were not here on a race day, so can't comment on the facilities.However the course is beautiful, with the centre space fully utilised for the general public.Although not all the stables are the same the space has been carefully used to provide ease of movement with the veterinary clinic in a central position. Very interesting was the positioning of the pharmacy in the clinic. We were lucky to be shown round by a Kiwi who is a very important part of the racing industry in Hong Kong and this made it much more personal. I loved seeing the lead horses in their stable - all those noble retired greys still with a worthwhile job to do. With a race meeting in progress this would be a very interesting way to spend a day.

Maybe the best part of the trip.. I was excited to read about this event and go. However, it was so much cooler than I expected! The track is huge and amazing! Loads of food and beer tents, plus a great crowd. Fantastic sporting event and one of the best parts of the trip.

Night out at Happy Valley racecourse, Hong Kong. We walked a short distance to the YMCA Hotel on a Wednesday where we were picked up by bus to go to Happy Valley racecourse. The buffet style food was nice and plentiful and the drinks were good. Service was ok but the staff were overwhelmed early on by the number of people attending. Very friendly table of people on holidays.
must do. Huge complex, good atmosphere, can enjoy good time with friends,drinks and bet on horses. nice wednesday activity

Great night out & lot of fun. Living in Hong Kong, I go once in a while to the race course to have a night out with friends. The place gives an amazing view on Happy Valley, you watch (kind of) the race and have some good cold beer. You HAVE to do it if you're in town a Wednesday night and I promise a good and fun night

When you get there, find a staff member who can show you how to place a bet.. The racecourse on Wednesday evenings is the place to be. And what a place it is: well-maintained grounds surrounded by gorgeous skyscrapers as handsome horses run past, you realize just how good you have it living in Hong Kong. Sure, you can place bets and hopefully win some cash. But I enjoy being more of a non-invested spectator who hangs out near the beer garden, soaking up the incredibly buzzy atmosphere. The best part? Admission is a nominal $10HKD and can be paid simply by swiping your Octopus card.

A great night out. We had this one on the bucket list. A visit to Happy Valley Racecourse. We were fortunate enough to be in Hong Kong for the Last race meeting of the season and what night. The track was packed with lots go people not just to gamble but to party. It was great the atmosphere was electric and the horse races were great to watch. $10HK to get in and min bet $20HK. We came out winning (Grinning). There is plenty go food and refreshment outlets including McDonald's to eat and drink at. Seating is sparse but you can find a seat if your patient. They had lots of entertainment off the field as was and it was one big party night. Would definitely recommend it to the party goer or gambler. Just check the dates of the races as the season stops between July and October.

Racecourse not only for Horse...... The course of course the main pupose for horse racing, but actually is also open for public daily. I and my friends like running here after work, 1 lap around 1.6K which a lot of local like to do it here. If really travel and eat too much, is a good work out place.

One great spot. What a nice combination of human wonder and nature. Being there lat fall or winter or early spring makes it earth paradise. Staying in a good standard hotel in the neighborhood would make it more convenient and splindead escape.

great place. great place to have fun and watch amazing horse race, we went on a Wednesday afternoon and it is amazing how both expats and locals gather here to have fun and enjoy a drink, they also have great music between race and nice food for sale, it is a little bit far from the subway station (we came out at causeway bay) apparently there is a closer subway station but when we went it was close, be aware that when you walk from right before reaching the racecourse there is a subway tunnel and there is a lot of homeless, they do not bother you or anything but they use the place also as restroom so it has a very bad smell, it is very sad to see how some people are struggling so much and few steps away you will get to see people betting millions and millions and getting to the place in their expensive car, be aware that the entrance fee is 10 HKD and the entrance for the public is E.

Fun Evening. A fun day at the track, quite a sideshow of food booths, and entertainment. My only regret was not purchasing the tourist entry, as the stands for the 10HK entrance weren't high enough to see the back stretch. However, it was a great way to spend a night. The scenery is awesome, and the excitement is palpable.

Great Evening Outing. Hong Kong residents know Happy Valley well, but tourists should make time to visit this racecourse for one of its Wednesday evening events. Happy Valley is a well-maintained racecourse, offering 55,000 seats on multiple levels. My colleagues and I chose wisely in watching each race at the rail, which makes watching more exciting (and still left us in close proximity to liquid refreshment). Note: If you're just visiting Hong Kong, don't wait for the end of the evening to find a taxi outside.)

What a spectacle!. Went to a Wednesday night meeting. As a racing participant in Australia I have never experienced anything like it. The facilities, the atmosphere and quality of racing was phenomenal. I was mesmerised by the size of the grandstands plus the fact it's in the middle of the city. The service they provide is second to none particularly the betting agents taking your bet, before handing over your ticket & taking the money they make sure you've made the correct selections by politely pointing out your selection & wager. Australia could learn a lot from the Hong Kong Jockey Club on how to conduct a race meeting. Everyone there was having a great night whether it be the expats meeting up for a night of fun or the local punters doing some serious punting! The whole atmosphere was electric.This is a must do when visiting Hong Kong!

Great Place and Get Fun. We went there to watch our first night race, and even trying to betbon the horse...Entrance for the normal gueat at the entrance G, paid 10$HKG, can pay by octopus card or just buy at the entrance there.It is fun, packed of people from youngster to old foks, from someone who wear nice clothes to someone half naked.l (because of hot weather).... Overall, we had a great day there.Betting for fun only...

Fantastic to visit night time racing in the middle of Hong Kong!. We went to Happy Valley races with another couple and were in a corporate box with dining. Fabulous experience of being so close to the racing. The box we were in was very well serviced and the buffet dinner was fabulous. Make sure you wear pants gents! It is not clear on the information (looks like women are not allowed to wear shorts - but actually, nobody can!)

The greatest show on earth!!!. You don't need to be into horse racing one bit to enjoy this delight. Just lots of like minded people of all nationalities out to have fun and be merry. Great atmosphere Remember those times rest of world?!!! Best to visit October- May avoid possible rain and humidity but it is always good anyway!!! Avoid if a stooge.

Historic venue now up to date. Happy Valley has tons of history. Site of the racecourse and its associated social amenities for the past century and a half, it was the social place to be for years.Today it still has that cachet, but is also the home of the Hong Kong Rugby club with its own fields in the infield and recently the development of additional multi purpose soccer, rugby and running areas making it a truly multidimensional jewel in the heart of the city.

Good walk and food. We went for a dinner on 6/F of the Racecourse building. Good facility for a dozen table or so. The buffet was quite good. Have been there a few times for reception or dinner. Reliable quality. But I think you need to be a member to book the facility there. Apart from the food, you can take a walk downstairs with a bit of greenery to enjoy.

Wednesday Night is an institution.. Wednesday night at the races is an ideal way to break up the week. You don't need to gamble much or at all, just enjoy the atmosphere in the Beer Garden. The food and drink is reasonable, and the mood fun. You also get up close to the horses and riders as they trot out.

World class horse racing and fun environment. I used to be involved in the horse racing industry in a small way but in a small city. Given that, this was awesome for me. Not only was I stepping into an enormous, world-famous venue, but I got to enjoy the side shows. There is a lot of action here in addition to the horses. There are the monied people, fully decked out for their dinners and private seats. There are the college kids down below drinking their way through the night and not even realizing that horses are racing. It was very fun.

Fun times! Your knees will decide your place!. As a racing enthusiast, this place has been on my bucket list for a long time, and I wasn't disappointed!We attended the bank holiday racing day, on Thursday 9th June, 10 races from 1pm through to 6pm! Normally it's a Wednesday evening with fewer races.There was a mix of tourists, locals and hardened gamblers mixing easily - beware that seats, corners and spaces are reserved early by people leaving their marked up newspapers (like a beach towel on a deck chair!), bags, food and drink and so on, as we found out when we sat down in the stand - but the locals were fairly easy going, so it's no biggie to find a space. And as I found as a taller westerner, there are plenty of great vantage points that allow one to overlook the locals and get a great view of the track.We had the choice of paying 10 HKD for general entrance (what would be similar to 'silver ring' in the UK), or entrance as a tourist. You pay more as a tourist - 130 HKD per person when we went - but you get to enter by gate E, in the members area.NOTE - if you are entering on a 'T' Tourist badge:- you need to take your passport (just the passport); and- gentlemen need to wear trousers or long shorts, covering the kneesMy host had short shorts, and there was a bit of commotion due to his 'offensive knees' but the management found him a pair of trousers to wear!If you go in as a tourist, you may also want to consider getting there early and going up to the second floor bar where you can bag a restaurant table overlooking the racetrack. There is a further 40 HKD walk in fee for that bar, so it adds up but it looked pretty comfy.We found that entering as a tourist gave us access to slightly less crowded facilities, you get better access to the parade/saddling areas, can get really close to the winning line - and as I found out, really close to the jockeys, connections and behind the scenes - probably too close as security gently ushered me away when I almost ended up in the jockeys dressing room trying to find my way back!!!The facilities in the members area were fairly good and there was food and drinks, but if you just want to go for cheap eats, beers and racing, then maybe the general area is for you.Betting is via a pool system at windows - it's bets to get a bet on in good time so you can get a good vantage point for the race. The staff had enough English to help even the relative novice to betting so just go to the window and ask for the bet you want and they should be able to help you. Use race card number, rather than the name of the horse.I managed to describe a reverse forecast which turns out to be a 'quinella' which you do as a place bet as well...there are all manner of exotic bets that I might look in to next time.Toward the end of the day's racing, we wandered (you can get back and forth on the tourist badge) in to the general area - there were plenty of covered seats, pop up bars, and music - so it was a great day out either way. You won't be disappointed if you just want to enter via the general entrance for a good days racing.I can't wait to go again!

A must for all punters. Fantastic atmosphere top location and a fun evening.night racing at Hong Kong is a must do,the trace looks great the crowd get excited and you feel like a big winner with the exchange rate from A$ to HK$minimum bet is $10HK and the dividends are for $10HK therefore you don't have to spend a lot to feel like a big winner

Amazing racetrack. And a must see at least once.. This site has changed massively over the years, it is a great day out, you will be amazed if you like a bet, the venue is outstanding, you will experience something different from any other racetracks in the world.

For atmosphere or for punters !. Every two weeks on wednesdays (check schedule in internet) you can enjoy a horserace show. Usually 8 races from 7pm to 10pm. Access to the grass is 10$ (cash or octopus) or by invitation or membership in the upper galleries. Bars & street food available downstairs, while restaurants and buffets are in the higher levels, lots of gambling counters everywhere. The ambiance just worth the visit. Pls note this place is forbidden for people below 18yo.

Night at the Track. Stayed for the first seven (of eight) races on a Wednesday night at Happy Valley. Fun and entertaining evening, with efficient electronic betting and okay food. Racetrack is conveniently located. Worth a visit, if you're feeling lucky.
Good night out. Not a gambler or racing fan but Happy Valley is a HK institution and good for an entertaining night out (plus a few $ flutter as long as you don't mind losing).
Night races. This is well worth a visit. Go on an organised tour on a Wednesday night.Reasonably priced, buffet dinner, drinks and you're collected and returned to your hotel.

Inevitably when you are taken as a guest into the Jockey Club enclosure and given Champagne and food for free the experi. What I can say it's that it's a crazy place, betting seems like a drug here and having experienced on many occasions Paddys Day at Cheltenham I thought I'd seen it all but this place makes Cheltenham look very tame.So Happy Valley racecourse sits in the middle of HK and is surrounded by high rise buildings and is a great place to visit for a night out whilst you are here.

Taken as a guest. Inevitably when you are taken as a guest into the Jockey Club enclosure and given Champagne and food for free the experience is excellent; so I have no idea of prices here.What I can say it's that it's a crazy place, betting seems like a drug here and having experienced on many occasions Paddys Day at Cheltenham I thought I'd seen it all but this place makes Cheltenham look very tame.So Happy Valley racecourse sits in the middle of HK and is surrounded by high rise buildings and is a great place to visit for a night out whilst you are here.

Loads of fun. This place is such a rarity--open green space surrounded by high rise concrete & steel monstrosities. Fun to take in the atmosphere even if you don't gamble. Lots of draught beer and food options on offer. The onsite gallery restaurant serves terrific western food--expensive though.

For racing enthusiasts. Happy Valley is so unbelievable, a racecourse in the middle of high rise flats! It's enormous beautiful and the racing is so good. I'm not really a flat racing person, much prefer the jumps but this is an experience not to be missed and to be repeated whenever possible.

Great Atmosphere for Night Racing. Terrific place to go even if you are not interested in racing.
Such a great night out. See the Hong Kong skyline in the background. Can get a little crowded at times but well worth the experience

It's a racecourse !. Even tihough it's 'just' a racecourse you do get a snapshot of a side of Hong Kong life which is different to most places. Gambling is allowed here - naturally - so it attracts big crowds. It's a few dollars to enter and the crowd is made up of the many different folk of HK. Locals and ex-pats, tourists and business folk. It's an entertaining night out in many ways...but don't go expecting Ascot!

A must for race-goers.... A must visit for all who love horse-racing...this is in the middle of hong kong island, and a looks so glamorous...esp when their is local racing ..i did get to see 2 races before i rushed off.....A must for all those horse racing fans...
Great place to spend time (adults only). World class race course. Staff are very well trained and they welcome visitors. Races are normally held on Wednesday evening. Try you luck and good luck!!

Wednesday Night Must . We booked the Stable View Terrace for 550KH$ per person which includes BBQ buffet and beers wines from 17.45 until 21.45 which was great value considering food and drink prices in HK. We had a fantastic view of the course and all 9 races on thr card. Service was first class and the food selection and quality was really good for a buffet. Fantastic evening out in HK and a must do and see experience in HK

The Thunder of Hooves...... What an atmosphere at night time horse racing. The course is mostly surrounded by tall grand stand and skyscrapers. The razzamatazz that surrounds the evening is great, with local HK celebs hanging around various sponsored stalls. Live a little, place a bet, HK$10 is roughly £1 (UK)/€0.80 (Euro)/$0.7 (USD). You never know, you may walk away with. We were HK$6 up at the end of the night.......enough for well, the MTR journey back to the hotel.Great fun.Check out the course at the weekend when there isn't a race planned and watch local field hockey or soccer games, as well as folks running. A great multi-purpose use of facilities.
Great fun on Wednesday. Race start at 0715p.m. only $10 access the public area. Excellent atmosphere and nice cool beer and food. Love it

Must see in Hong Kong !!. Happy Valley Race Course is really a must see in Hong Kong. I went on a Wednesday, but expect that it will be crowded even in de week days. Also a lot of European people are visiting this event. Foods and drinks can be bought here, there is even a Mac Donald's inside! Entree is 10 HK dollar.

Large party place with amazing view of the horses running. I must say it is one of the largest party place i have seen , where people of all ages are partying . More of a place to visit to see the horse race and drink beer. Good place and entry is only 10 HK dollars

Its situation alone is well worth a visit.....take the Ding Ding. We took the Ding Ding out to Happy Valley, which is great fun especially for kids and an incredibly cheap way to travel. We did not have time to go inside, its a lovely site from the outside anyhow, but we were liably informed that tours are available, and on race days for a small fee you can join the HK Jockey Club for a day to make your visit more exciting.

Great Wednesday night for 10HK dollars. Every Wednesday there is horse racing at the Happy Valley racecourse near Causeway Bay. It cost 10 dollars per person to get through the turnstiles (£1 each)! There is food and drink and a great atmosphere in there. You can put bets on or just watch the races. We were there for about 3 hours and saw 6 races. It was really humid that day so I would advise any time after April to dress for the heat on an evening. There is no dress code and the night we went, was a French theme. I got my face painted just for a laugh, and we drank French wines all evening.A great bonus evening that we just randomly heard about!

great atmosphere for a night out. meet some friends here and had a great night, it was hot & buzzing, kind of had an asian bond film setting vibe, lively and has a great HK city backdrop while you watch the racing, only on wednesday nights, you dont have to be into horses to enjoy, cost only 10 HK dollars for general entrance and starts at about 7pm ends about 11pm, if you leave at 11 then you will struggle to get a taxi

Great night out. Racing night is every Wednesday. We got the MTR and walked the short distance to the racecourse. It cost us £1 (HK$10) entry.The racecourse is an oasis of grass surrounded by imposing high rise buildings. The main grandstand on the finishing straight is impressive and when lit up at night it looks fantastic. There are lots of food sellers and you can buy a whole variety of international cuisine at a reasonable price. Plenty of beer stalls available and live entertainment apart from the racing. The card has 6 races and placing a bet can be confusing but there are numerous staff to help you fill out the betting slip and back your winner. This is a must do for any visitor and we had a great night. Get there early as it gets busier as the night goes on. We got a good view near to the finishing line and parade ring. If you do not fancy being in the betting ring then all hotels offer hospitality packages including a meal, transport and at table betting. Our hotel offered this but at £108 (HK$ 1080) we thought this a bit pricey and was glad we did our own thing. When all the flood lights are on and the place is full it's a tremendous sight and a great atmosphere.

Great atmosphere and worth a visit . If you are in HK on a Wednesday when the races are on its a must!The racecourse is easily accessible, only £1 entry and reasonable priced drinks (by HK standards anyway!)The atmosphere is electric the place is busy with live music too, but not overwhelming and you have enough space to enjoy the betting.We were staying in Wan Chai so just got a tram straight there for 25p, then a taxi back cost £3.50. Minimum bet is £2 and easy to do, or just have a drink and enjoy the night, would highly recommend it.
Conference function . Absolutely fabulous night out at the Happy Valley racecourse.Great food, great function facilities, on site tipsters and wonderful atmosphere.Recommend highly when in Hong Kong.

Partying in the Racecourse. I like horses very much and bet from time to time. Recently, I have installed an App of the Jockey Club, so that I can bet with my i-phone, After the installation, I got a gift and they send me free tickets to see the Happy Valley Racecourse (Wednesdays). It's so excited of seeing the horses so close. Also, they have different themes from time to time. While watching the races, you can enjoy the good foods and wines. Last month was Korean and this month is French May. There're performances and games as well. it's not just betting but likes partying. I usually left early (before the last race at 10:30 pm), as the traffic is very congested after the races.

if you love seeing races this is the place to be. it was unbelievable that such a big racecourse could exist in the middle of this city. they do have a dress code to follow (specially if you are accompanied by someone who have access to VIP lounges). theres ton of energy all around when people start to shout for their bet/horse. it is quite tricky to get back to the city when the races are done as the majority of the crowd will queue up for taxis. so its may be best to leave slightly earlier than they close. I enjoyed this very much. and also a great excuse to gamble a little.
Great fun. Exciting race with small course and great atmosphere. Enjoy cold beer and my beating. Great time with my friend.
Chasing the odds. Great night out if you like horse racing. Lots of colour and atmosphere. Drinks reasonably priced and betting stakes affordable!

The best thing in Hong Kong. This place is just amazing on Wednesday night.... And if you ask me the best thing in Hong Kong. The mood is great, watching the race take place is exciting and shows real Hong Kong. There are many expats aswell as locals. They have live music and different food joints. i would advice to go the normal public stand... Less posh and it gives a great vibe! This is for sure a must do when in hong Kong! At 10 HKD a real bargain as well.

Fun on a Wednesday night. I had a great time and a cold beer at the Happy Valley Racecourse and left dreaming to become a member of The Hongkong Jockey Club:) There is a long waiting list and the membership fee is very high.
There is food and drinks for the ordinary people and lots of fun too.
So Much Fun!. The night racing at Happy Valley is such a fun scene. Pitchers of beer and chicken McNuggets, and live entertainment in addition to the actual horse races.

Open to the Public at all times, wort a visit.. I stayed nearby , and like a lot of locals, used the mini running track every day for a jog. It's free of charge, and you also get to watch the local Football team etc. The stadium is a marvel, cocooned by sky-scrapers. The attached Museum is free and the is a restaurant.
Fantastic and great fun. Whether you enjoy horses or not, gambling or not this is a must see. 10.000 people come here every Wednesday and the place id so classic and cool.

Massive. We took our father as he is a racing fanatic and it was Wednesday evening so we thought its not going to be busy but by golly it was very busy, was hard to find the entrance but once their you can enjoy the atmosphere and the whole experience

Great night out at the races. Fun and easily accessible horse racing. $10 to get in and public area has some kind of food, beer stands etc around. The betting is relatively easy to understand. Good viewing area to see the horses and action. We went on a wednesday and made some money, boom!
Race night. Special function - very impressive location. Great night experienced with friends and colleagues, great location a real fun night.

Small but Perfectly Formed. HK Disneyland has all of the Disney charm, excitement and fun you expect from Disney but it is quite a bit smaller than the original Disneyland in LA. Even the Fantasyland Sleeping Beauty Castle is only about ¼ the size of the original. We have two teenage boys and they only had limited choice in rides which suited them (although their mother insisted they go on the Small, Small World ride much to their disgust). We went on a week day and had little or no queues and so we managed to get around the whole park in one day. It is still the great experience we expect from Disney.
Fantastic Arena. Vibrant, noisy, boozy and lots of fun. Inexpensive to enter but be prepared for a slow exit. Betting simple after a bit of trial and error

A remarkable experience - even if you don't bet!. Owned by the Hong Kong Jockey Club, this enormous facility was built on swampland in 1845. Races happen at about 7 every Wednesday night. You can get a hot dog and a beer and see the horses run on a turf track. Even if you are not a race fan, it is still worth dropping by for the experience.

Wednesday night . Happy Valley Racecourse is a choice for a different Wednesday night. The racecourse is located between Wan Chai and Causeway Bay and can be reached by either mtr, taxi, tin tin or on foot. The fee admission is either 10 HK dollars or sometimes it's free. During summer most of the races are suspended for hot weather. Races start at about 5:30 pm!

A day at the Races not too be missed at this HK Icon. Races are on Wednesdays during the Race season and even if you are not into Horses, this is a great night out. Surrounded by high rises, the racecourse looks magnificent under floodlights and tens of thousands of race fanatics betting to their hearts content. The atmosphere is electric and you will have a memorable experience to take away from.

Viewed from our hotel room and walked around the infield. a good area in which to exercise at what tempo you want .. we pushed our baby grandson in his buggy :)watched the Wednesday racing (in part) from our hotel room .. from a great height :)

Happy Valley Wednesday night race. Every Wednesday night from about 6:00-10:00 pm you can join the night horse races at Happy Valley Racecourse for only HK$10 (about £1) entrance fee. You do not have to bet if you do not want to! There are live shows, beer garden, food stalls and of course horse races. Fun and great atmosphere to spend the evening. We go there every time when we are visiting Hong Kong.

Must see the night races.. Was around to drop by and make some extra cash but..... An interesting place to visit even if not gambling, 20 HK dollars for admission and a plenty of entertainment in between the races.

Cracking place for a weeknight. The Wednesday night races are a great event and the atmosphere is completely unique. The surroundings are so unique to Hong Kong, I would recommend to anyone who is in Hong Kong and has the option to go. The staff are all really helpful and you can take it as seriously as you would like.
10's rugby. A great sporting venue both for the Horse racing and Rugby 10Many good facilities and nearby MTR station for easy travel.

Happy racing. Have been fortunate enough to visit Happy Valley racecourse many times over the last 17 years. Whether you visit in general admission or as a guest of a race horse owner ( I've done both) the experience is fantastic with the HK high rise blocks as a backdrop. No hesitation in recommending.

A Night at the Races. Booked through Splendid tours and had a great evening at Happy Valley race course. Normally meetings are at weekends and Wednesday evenings. Well organised pick up from selected hotel with a great view of the course from the dining room. Food was an excellent buffet with unlimited quantities of refreshments. The betting system was clearly explained and started from HK$10. The balcony gave good access to the course atmosphere with additional views of night time Hong Kong. We left before the last race, having seen 6 races, to avoid the traffic congestion. If you want this experience prices do vary according to the operator and could be booked the day before if you are in HK.
Nice night with plenty of atomsphere. There was a real buzz about the place and i have to say it looked pretty fantastic all lit up at night. Great way to speand a wednesday night!

A great night out for very little money. We went in the "cheap seats" - $10 to get in and the atmosphere was great - very busy and lots to see. The food was good and the beer was cheap - having never been to the races before, it was an experience and a half! It was very easy to place a bet and between four of us, we spent around £20 and won £4 which was a result as we had a great night.

Horse racing fans will enjoy this.. Little oasis in HK.As a local this is a welcome respite from the congestion and buildings. It is far from Hyde Park and Central Park, so perhaps only interesting for tourists when the horse racing is on during the racing season. Live once a week typically on a wednesday night. There is also a weekend race meet , but yu should check the schedule to determine the venue.For race fans this is a colourful unique event. There are several "big" meetings throughout the year when the pageantry, dresses and nerves are at fever pitch.

A fun thing to do in HK. Our friends who live in HK took us to Happy Valley races. It's cheap to get in 10 HKD which is about £1! We took a backpack in with our own beers (no one seemed to care) although you can buy it all there and food too.We only made very small bets but it was really fun and I would recommend this.

A fun night. We aren't into the horse scene, but this is a must do on a Wednesday night for the atmosphere alone.Cheap entry, bars, (limited) food outlets (although the snail pie was tasty!). Races every 30 mins, easy access for betting and friendly people around to explain what is happening where, how to bet and so forth.A lovely, relaxed fun night with a lovely buzz to it.

Good night out. Had an enjoyable evening at the races. Racing most Wednesday nights. Got tourist tickets for 20HKD. Relaxing time with a race every 30 mins. Even had 2 winners. Facilities to suit all tastes. Easy to walk to from Causeway Bay.

Good night out for the Racing Fan. As expected the Racecourse was very busy. We went to the outside Grandstand seating. Part of the deal was dinner & snacks which was a bonus. With the gap between races only 30 minutes then it helps to keep the night interesting. TV coverage was good and information on the horses, jockeys, trainers, odds was easily accessible.Inside the Grandstand were the keen punters however i could not see where the social groups were being entertained. Everyone was able to see the race from the Grandstand or various tv monitors around the course. There was music from time to time & no dealt other entertainment on the lower levels. We had a good night except for the transport delay trying to get back to the Hotel. Certainly worth the visit

Stable Bend Terrace . We had a great time at the races in the stable bend terrace restaurant. It is a bbq buffet with free flow beer and wine for 580 hkd. We had our own table quite high up looking down to the winning line. We were given a free english racecard and all the race previews and commentary were in english . Lots of large screen tvs to watch the racing. food was great. 2 types of soup, barbecued steak ,chicken, and fish lots of other stuff and desserts including hagen dazs ice creams. Service was good and in the end they just gave us full bottles of wine instead of topping up our glasses. Great value for money at Hong-Kong prices.
Iconic. What a great night out, the crowds, the skyscrapers overlooking the track and the 10s of thousands of racegoers.Make sure your trip includes a night race at Happy Valley!

Happy Night at Happy Valley. A party of 5 of us went on the 'all inclusive' package, great food, and a wonderfull view of the races, service was good and the staff kept our glassses well topped up. A great night out.

must do!. Went here with ex pat family, what a night, cheap entrance , pitchers of beer , any local will explain the betting slips, atmosphere amazing , and what a view from the racecourse of all the skyscrapers around, mainly residential!

We had a blast. You can't quite believe that amongst the sky scrapers is a race course! A couple of dollars to get in using your octopus card. Plenty of places to get drinks and the queues were very quick. People help with the betting. Lots of space to get good view. A great evening and highly recommended.
Lost my Bet but was interesting!. was fun. nothing crazy. just betting on horses. but was a good experience. would probably go again just for fun!
Go number 5, go!!!!. You can't say you've been to Hong Kong if you haven't done at least one "Happy Wednesday" night of horse races at Happy Valley Racecourse! A must, also if you don't like to bet!

Great evenings entertainment . We paid $10HK and we were right next to the track and parade circle. The atmosphere was electric and we had great fun watching both the races and the locals cheer on their bets. If you are in Hong Kong whilst the races are on you should go.

Fantastic Night. A great night at the races. $10 HK Dollors entry. Inside the food and beer are reasonable prices. A great atmosphere. Helpful friendly staff in the betting hall who explained how to fill in the betting slips. All in all all a great way to spend an evening. And we won on a few races !!!
Greeeaaattt!!. Cheap to enter - $10 each. Great value. We only drank and placed bets. Bar tender was great and the Jockey Club officials helped us navigate a complicated race card. Great night.

Great entertainment. Went to evening races, great atmosphere, great landscape, short walk to get to just follow the crowds, deals on beer and wine, well worth the effort even if you are not the gambling type, ask the assistants in the betting hall hoe to fill in the slips and you are away! Trams take you baqck to town in 10 mins, would go again if in HK.

If you're in Hong Kong on a Wednesday, don't miss this!. The atmosphere, the beer garden, the horse racing. This is just plain fun, and you don't need to gamble to enjoy, although I'd recommend spending 100HKD to make the races a bit more exciting. Great place to start your night, then head back to LKF or straight to Wan Chai to continue the party.

Fun and exciting!. We were here on the night race and we had a really fun night here. We are not any gambler but this was really a great experience for us. The whole atmosphere was like a carnival, with food and drink stalls around, performance during the interval, cheering and horse racing, really exciting! I would say it is a must go if you ever be in Hong Kong on a race day.

Not too be missed. If you are lucky enough to be in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night when the racing is on you must go.My partner and I had a fantastic night.What more could you want good food excellent entertainment the fun of the race and all for next to nothing,we had a great night.

Great fun - horse lovers' paradise :). Every Wednesday night and on special occasions. Tradition left by British, excellent horses and real fun! We went there by MTR tram, paid the entrance fee 10 HKD by Octopus card at the entrance. We were with some friends and remained nearby the track. (However there are different options to get up to one of the booth among the VIP if you have a Jockey Club member friend to take you in or you are willing to pay ca. 500 HKD.) Even if you go as a tourist you will find a lots of expacts to have a conversation - we did run into Hungarain visitors after 15 minutes already ;) Do gamble a little and cheer your selected horse! The minimum bet is 10 HKD, bet for 'Place' meaning you bet the horse is going to be within the first three. Get the magazine to read special information and tips on horses in English. You can get beer and good food for a reasonable price. You wish to dress pretty, afterall this is a night out! :)

Great mid-week experience. It was my first time here after been to HK many times. Loved the whole atmosphere - the cheering, the races, the food and drinks... Very accessible and for the experience, the HK $10 was really worth it. Great night out, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone going to HK.

Better if you go with friends. Our second visit to Happy Valley Racecourse. We had a good evening and got chatting to a couple of people. It is great fun for a group. Advise you go in the 'cheap seats' with the locals. Much more interesting.

A really fun evening.. The backdrop of the skyscrapers of Hong Kong adds to the fabulous bustling atmosphere. Getting in is easy with the Octopus card HK$10, or free if you come after the first few races. Getting trackside is easy too to watch the horses thunder by. There is entertainment, beer stalls and lots of excitement. Bets can only be placed at the official Jockey Club booths, but having a flutter is easy and there's no need to wager high roller stakes, so the amount you spend is entirely up to you. Watch the race from trackside to get a feel for the power and speed of the horses or from the elevated seating to see the whole of the race unfold; and don't forget to shout encouragement to your horse and rider, everybody else will be cheering for theirs!

Wednesday night racing. we joined the locals and the expats at the race track. Had a good night out - you can get in for just a few pounds. there is plenty of food and drink along with the great atmosphere.

Wednesday Races a must do. Check the dates to ensure they are on but coming to happy valley horse racing is a must do if in Hong Kong. The Hong Kong Jockey Club is a rare open space in Hong Kong, spectacularly hemmed in by high rise buildings. It is an evening of entertainment with live bands, racing and drinking! Well attended by both expats and locals alike, it is almost like a large beer garden with a race course next to it.

Completely Unexpected. On the evening of my first day in Asia, a friend took me to dinner and drinks in a reserved box at this centuries-old racetrack. Situated in the heart of high-rise Hong Kong, everything about this experience was unexpected. The buffet dinner was excellent; the set-up for betting was easy and fun. Wednesdays only!

An alternative event for HK tourist. An alternative event for HK tourist. Race usually takes place on Wednesday night, but there are special times they take place on Saturday night or Sunday afternoon (instead of the bigger race course in Sha Tin).TIP: If your friends or family members are a member of the HK Jockey Club, you will be able to get to the upper floors and have a better view of the race course.

Good fun. Something a bit different in the centre of town.Unlike other race nights I've been to in various cities, the entry fee, food and drinks were all reasonably priced. The only real expense is how much you're prepared to bet.
Amazing place in Hong Kong!. We passed by this racecourse during our bus tour to the Peak. It was situated in the downtown area among many tall condos. Very impressive!

Have a flutter. Even if you do not really gamble, it is worth visiting this racecourse. Open on Wednesdy ad Saturday nights, it is colourful and in a wonderful setting surrounded by the high rise flats around the course. There is a tourist ticket that lets you into a particular enclosure. Food and drink available but make sure you take a walk down to the grass level for a close look at the horses. A fun night.

Great Wednesday night entertainment. Cold beer and fast ponies make for a fun time. Standing at the rail you can really get a feel for the power of these magnificent animals. The fact that the track is right in the middle of the city makes even neater. Betting is simplified by the attentive and knowledgeable staff inside. Fortunately for me, they speak good English too. After the races, you can always participate in Wan Chai Wednesday!

Great fun and thrilling too!. Wednesday evenings are race nights at Happy Valley race course. It is accessible from Causeway Bay area via Trams which is a great experience in itself. The Races are easy to follow with big screens and good seating arrangements and betting is also easy to do.I even backed some winners the time we went. For a great evening out go racing. There are lots of types of food suppliers or you can eat in their great Buffet experience.

Great fun. If you are lucky enough to be in HK on race day do go. Access is easy via tram. Entry is cheap and it is a great party atmosphere. Dress is casual ,food and drink stalls everywhere. The setting for a race course is quite unique and has to be seen

Stable Bend Terrace. Visited on a Wednesday night in February 2016, Stable Bend Terrace in particular, a casual yet somewhat classy buffet with spectacular views over the track, infact looking directly down the straight from a high vantage point after the winning post. Had a great night and was well worth the 580 HKD per person, my only gripe was the red wine, a cheap Chilian that wasn't up to the standard of everything else.
very nice place. The Hong Kong Happy Valley racecourse is very nice. It is a place for gambling and fun. the races are on Wednesday.

Quality!. Me and my girlfriend were lucky enough to arrive into Hong Kong on a Wednesday afternoon so after dropping our bags off at the hostel we headed to the track. Causeway bay is the nearest metro station, although it's about a 15 minute walk it's worth it to take in the views of time square on the way! Entry into the ground was 10 dollars (91p). I didn't put any bets on myself as not a gambler but heard that the minimum bet you can put on isn't much. Really good beer and food options inside also which are reasonably priced considering the location. A must visit in Hong Kong id say, what an introduction to this amazing city!

A quick look on our tour. Had to visit Happy Valley as a racing enthusiast it was on my bucket list of things to do in HK unfortunately no racing but worth a look whilst spending 4 days in Hong Kong BigBus tour dropped of and picked up a great way to see the city

The name Happy Valley is a great description!. Our group enjoyed a great night out at the Happy Valley Races. We caught the star ferry over to central then hopped on a Happy Valley tram. It took us through the city right to the racecourse. The tram was a lot of fun as most on it were heading to the races. We could use our Octapus card for the tram and the races. Very cheap to get there. The races themselves had an exciting atmosphere and lots of world traveller and locals turned up for the night.There seemed like hundreds of people. There was plenty of food stalls and a wine show. Or you could pay a lot more and be up in the stands. We enjoyed mixing with the locals and travellers on the ground level. Was a great night! We caught a taxi back to our hotel and it was very cheap.
Good Fun. great value as long as you can stick to plan and not get too carried away! worth a visit just to see the course and at £1 to enter you cant complain.

Splendid Tour..... Happy Valley race night .. We did the Splendid Tour 02/03/2016....Come Horseracing Classic Tour.....What a fantastic night!!! We were picked up at our hotel, taken to the track, and looked after like the brochure explained....treated like VIP. For just over $200 AUD you get beer, wine or soft drinks all night, buffet dinner, book, $30HKD betting voucher, a tour of the parade ring and absolutely looked after. I would highly recommend this tour.

Not just for horse lovers. No matter if you like horses or betting on them, Happy Valley Racecourse is a great experience on race days which are on Wednesdays. The racecourse is located in Happy Valley, very close to Causeway Bay at HK Island. There is no dress code required.The atmosphere is thrilling and there's always something to see and discover.

A great night out. This attraction is really well organised, whether you are a horse-racing fan or not. The best part of it was the excellent programme in English or Chinese, which gives a clear and easy-to- understand rating of the horses running. Our group, who're not really into horses, had several winners!

Unique and fun evening out. Happy Valley only has live (versus televised) racing on Wednesday nights so traffic was pretty crazy. I tried one taxi and the driver just said "No" and drove off so it was a long walk from Tsim Sha Tsui but we probably got there faster walking than if we had taken a taxi. When we were almost to Happy Valley we discovered we could have caught a bus or tram.It only cost 10 HKD to enter and you can use your Octopus card.My son and I had never been to a horse race before so this was a very new and fun experience for us. It had quite a festive atmosphere - food booths, a live band and a real mix of people milling about, along the fence and in the stands. Inside (where you place your bets) there are monitors and other food concessions - though we didn't get why so many guys wanted to sit inside watching the race on the monitors instead of outside watching the actual race. We made a few 20 HKD bets (I think that is the smallest you can make) - we knew nothing about horse racing, we just picked names that we liked. My husband showed us how to fill out betting form and the cashier helped as well. My son's horse did place second so he won 17.50 HKD which is about $2 USD. So you can have fun without breaking the bank.The starting gate was moved around so sometimes the race started on the far side of the track (away from the viewing stands) and sometimes the starting gate was right in front of the viewing stand which was a LOT of fun to see. I wish I had brought a small pair of binoculars.I think the first race was at 6:15 and went every half hour. The last race was at 10:15 or 10:45pm, not sure as we left after the 9:45pm race. Fun evening. We caught a tram outside the gate (a little ways down the street) to get back to our hotel.

Happy Valley won us over. We're not gamblers and have only visited racecourses a few times in Europe but last night we really enjoyed our trip to Happy Valley. It's a stunning bowl of light surrounded on 360 degrees by sentinel high rise. Best thing was the friendly assistants who guided these novices through the betting process. No queues, lots of seats, easy to watch at track or higher levels. We played two, lost two and made a modest profit!Take your passport to member's main entrance (E) and pay a modest entry fee.
great atmosphere!. like we celebrate football in europe they do it with horse races!even if u have no idea about it, u can be a part of it and bet or have some beers and burgers!

Bet you will enjoy Happy Valley. I am no race goer nor am I a betting man but if you get the chance to go to the Happy Valley Races in Hong Kong go. It is a fun night if you are there with friends, we were very lucky to get into one of the Stand boxes. Great night! Good food and drink. Great view of the races. However won nothing. Still had a great time.

Happy Valley Raceway. Well its a tram ride from the Admiralty at the harbour of about 25 mins. Unfortunately there was no racing when I was there but if you could get to be there when the races are on it would be amazing. Apparently if you show a British passport you can go into the special members area free of charge. Even though there was no racing when I went there was still many people there betting on races in other parts on a big screen.

Great night at Happy Valley Races. We visited Hong Kong in September 2015 and were lucky enough to attend the first night racing eventof the current calendar. What a fabulous experience. We chose to go as part of a group which we met at The Peninsula Hotel Kowloon. The cost was about $200 AUD per person but was certainly worth it. We were taken by air conditioned coach to HK Island where the Happy Valley course is situated. The guide, Ivan made sure that we were totally informed about the evening and the whereabouts of everything. Dinner was served in a fantastic viewing room which provided a panoramic outlook of the course and surrounds. Betting was also available in that area. Happy Valley is a unique venue for horse racing and well worth a visit. Tickets for the tour package are available through the hotel consierge.

Fun night out. Went to the Wednesday night races. Had a great night out found someone to help me fill the form out this is the only trouble I had but got used to it. There is a lot to choose from in the food and drink department . Great night out and about

Amazing Atmosphere. We went to the races at Happy Valley on the evening of the 3rd February. Admittedly, it was just coming up to the Chinese New Year, but the atmosphere was amazing - there was a live rock band, lion dancers, entertainment and loads and loads of excited punters. Add to that that the back drop to the race course is stunning - what a location. It made for a thrilling and very memorable night out.NB If you're not in a hurry, I would recommend the tram ride from Central to the Race Course - it's a great way to see Hong Kong at night and very convenient for getting to the race course.

This is Fun Fun Fun!. The crowd resembles that at an English Point-to-Point. Casual and for the expats a roving cocktail party. The backdrop of the skyscrapers is amazing and the atmosphere amazing - a must see!

Huge fun evening and great value. This unique racecourse really gets it right at every level.The racing is exciting on a testing track,the crowd is exuberant and there is the best range of bars and restaurants of any racecourse in the world.If you are in Hong Kong when they are racing on a wednesday night you must not miss it.You might even run into racing's legendary pundit Wally Pyrah if you are lucky.This is a great lace for all the family.

Great cheap night out!. It's strange to think of gambling as a cheap night out, but it applies here. I wish we'd gone on a night with better weather. They race most Wednesday nights (I think are off in the height of the summer). You pay HKD10 for an unreserved spot, then just hang out outside and drink beer and watch the horses. You can bet for almost nothing, and it's fun to come up with creative bets. The place can be busy later, but if you go when they first open it's slow and you can figure out the betting system while it's not too crazy. Fun night out.

Exciting. Open 7.00pm nearly every Tuesday night only, weather you bet or not the location and atmosphere is fantastic, the rain didn't even send us home. Best way to get there is by the fantastic trams (slower of course) or bus or taxi all very cheap.

Easy to get to by tram. I'm not a gambler so this was probably never going to top my list of must sees in HK. That said, you can see numerous races in a short period of time. We stayed for about three races, which was fun. The horses come out in the general admission area to parade around before the race, which is a great way to pick your horse you want to bet on. Within 15 minutes the race is underway.

A really fun and surreal thing to do when in Hongkong. if you are in a box or on the stands this is going to be a very fun evening ! its very well organized and you feel in a very special place .Surrounded by tall apartment buildings and lights everywhere makes it one in a lifetime experience. easy to bet and look at the horses up close , no dressing up required all casual on the stands and so much fun !!

Good night out.. Great Wednesday night out. Got a Tourist pass which allowed us to access the Members area. 7 races every half hour starting at 7:15pm. You can bet of you want to make it more interesting. Close up to the Parade ring as well as the race course near the finish line. Well worth it and great if you are with a group. Food and beer stalls. Suggest leaving before the penultimate race to get a taxi before the hordes.
Jockery club. A friend of our is a member and invited us to lunch here. We could see the racecourse in the resturant. Food is delicious here. The deserts are outstanding .

Fun and cheap night out. A great way to spend a Wednesday night - if you're keen on working this in to your Hong Kong visit make sure you check whether the race is on during your stay. Entry fee of $10 (£1) is a bargain, and beer/ food is reasonably priced. Excellent facilities and a lovely atmosphere, along with helpful staff to explain the bet slips if you are unsure. We got there early and secured a spot on the balcony of the bar to watch the races as it was raining; it's advisable to get there at 6:30ish to familiarise yourself with the betting, grab a drink and get a decent place to watch the action. A must-do if you're there on a Wednesday

10 HKD entry - Wednesday night fun. This is a GREAT place for people watchers to feel like a local. It's so lovely, the way it's nestled in among all the skyscrapers! Plus, with the currency exchange, placing a bet is fun not stressful, once you realize a $20HKD bet isn't too much for the experience. You just might win if you bet "to place!"

The Best. Wednesday evening at Happy Valley is a wonderful experience, even if you're not a fan of horse racing. With an entry fee to trackside on the finishing straight of less than a £1 it is a piece of HK life not to be missed.For serious racing fans, pre-book the 4th floor Leading Edge grandstand overlooking the home straight. For HK$180 you get a reserved seat, a rice / noodle dish and access to the hot buffet. The betting windows and bars are only a few yards away.

Race day. My husband and i did the tour here ,Cost us $200 Australian each but this was our luxury tour of our trip.Was picked up from hotel ,taken to race track ,take to members box ,We had buffet dinner looking down on track beautiful view ,Food was nice and drinks were free also recdived a $30 Hong Kong betting voucher ,Or you can just just go into pubic area which i think was $10 Hong Kong ,i know its a big difference in price but as i said this was our bit of luxuary on our trip

Big Racecourse experience just ok. We went to happy valley racecourse for their Wednesday night meeting. I was expecting great things and I was a little disappointed. Yes the racecourse is big and impressive but the facilities for general admission are average. A number of levels in the grandstand but they all have the same on them, a number of betting windows and nothing else. There is no atmosphere. For those who have been to a big race meeting in Australia, happy valley does not offer any more. Would I go again, probably not.

Must see, place to be on Wednesday night. I've never been to a horserace track but apparently this is the place to be on Wednesday night for the locals. As I approach the track, I can see how packed it is. Once you get inside, the atmosphere is lively and is the perfect place to people watch. Of course we had to bet on some horses, luckily on the main floor, they have people help explain how to bet for each race. Of course none of us won, but it was a great experience.

Nice view from my hotelnroom. We got higher floor room with a view ofvthe race course.. It's rush green feel so fresk ans spacy. No tall building against the glorious morning sun. A very wonderful sight to wake up to in the morning.

One of the World's Classics. Amazingly large in a densely packed city, the racecourse seems to be increasingly encroached on by apartments. We were there as part of a business meeting, and the HK locals were justifiably proud of this jewel. Top tip: betting is easy at the many, friendly booths. Always more fun if one has some "skin in the game"!

Enjoy at the Public Enclosure. Do not repeat my misstake of going to the Jockely Club - you are only allowed in to a very restricted area, and nothing happens there - the only benefit is a better view of the horses. Go to the Public Enclousure - and experience the local life. It is much better - and much cheaper. Well worth a visit on a wednesday afternoon

Must love racing. If you're not a Jockey Club member, it's in the stands for you. The turf is supposedly wonderful, but the experience was the same for me as any other track. Consider going early to figure out exactly how to bet--some of the window attendants only grudgingly speak English so it's best to go in armed with knowledge.

A Cut Above!. The most beautiful race course I have ever seen and with the best facilities! There was a tropical downpour the night we went, but the racing still proceeded, as the course has synthetic turf and amazing drainage. We had a table overlooking the racecourse. The food was first class and the scenery magical. There was large screens everywhere and great betting facilities. Puts the best Australian racecourses to shame!!Loved it!

Wednesday Night. I visited Happy Valley on the popular Wednesday night festivities.I sat in the regular grandstands and had a lot of fun. Even if you are not a gambler, it's a really cool spectacle to take in. There are several tents selling good food and drinks as well as live music between races. I suggest you get involved in the betting as the betting minimums are very low. They sell programs if you are familiar with how to read them. If you have no idea what you are doing, just put a couple bucks on a horse with good odds to place (finish in the top 3). You won't win much, but you'll have a high percentage play. This is a much better way to spend an evening than at the nightclubs and bars --- it basically is one on Wednesday nights anyway.

Wednesday night activities. If you are visiting HK and plan to spend Wednesday night try the horse race at Happy Valley Racecourse. Every one and his brothers in town try their luck hoping to strike big at the race course. The Hong Kong Jockey Club donate most of the racing revenue to charitable organisations after dividend pay out.
Punters Paradice!!. Fantastic venue great food and great racing right on your doorstep.If you enjoy night racing this is the place.

Great experience!. When you travel to Hong Kong, you have to go here on wednesday night. Great place with a cheap entrance (10HD) , there you can enjoy for a horse riding and gambling if you want.I really enjoyed the time there :)
great fun evening. we enjoyed a great fun evening at the very efficient racecourse, the beer and food was good value and excellent and you can bet small amounts if you want

Fun evening at the races. We ventured to the races on a rainy Wednesday evening, it was an international race night. After getting to grips with the betting system (helped by a very kind Chinese man) we were well away. The view, the atmosphere and the racing was fantastic. Would recommend to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Off the cuff visit. We went thinking we would be watching live race horsing however it was on the screen and we only ended up staying for 4 races as a result. Need to check in detail what they are offering on the day you visit!!!!

Good fun. I don't gamble normally but came with some friends to have a "flutter" on the horses. It was easy to place a bet-pick the amount and the horse and there you are. The whole place is bif enough that you can easily find a spot to stand and watch the horses close up or by the stands. They don't seem to do much food so eat before or after. They do however had lots of places to buy drinks which is standard for race courses I think.

Great views from the Trams. If you don't get time to go to a live race you should grab a front seat upstairs on a Happy Valley tram. You get a good feel for the magnificent track as you trundle round it. Not much of a tram detour 20 mins max to take it in.

Great experience - bet a bit!. I heard that this racecourse makes more money in a day then all racecourses of Germany together in a year and that made me curious. And it is indeed a huge crowed of people coming here. No need to dress up super fancy with a hat :-) But definitely use the occasion to take some bets! Without it is probably a bit boring.

Fun night out. A must do in Hong Kong. Cheap drinks, cheap entry (can use your octopus card to get in) and great atmosphere. Bit of a walk from the metro station but easily doable. Entry through gate G. Don't overdress for General Admission though... most attendees are in very casual clothing.
Amazing!. Even though I had researched Happy Valley and was familiar with it through horse racing I was blown away by its size, crowd and vibe. A MUST for a wednesday night in Hong Kong.

Exciting racing but not easy to get a cab back to mainland. We were invited to meet an ex-student at the races as his family had a horse running. We met at the members only Craigevan Cricket Club for dinner (see another review) and then walked to the stadium. He has obviously done wel for himself!!We got up close at the enclosure to choose our nags, then a quick $100 bet and hey presto, a winner. His family horse let us down but we moved upstairs to the members bar where the view of the enormous crowd was brilliant. Three more races (two winners, one loser) and we broke even. The food in this bar looked delicious but we stuck with cocktails. It was a fantastic experience and is not expensive to do; much mor atmosphere than most UK racecourses. BUT, we were refused a taxi from HK Island to our hotel in Monkok by more than fifty drivers whose reaction to us was as if we had asked to be taken to the end of the world!! We could have gone by public transport but wanted to finish off in style. Eventually we persuaded a driver to take us and he commented that the traffic was not as bad as expected; in fact it cost us less than going.
Racing. We visited for the first time in October, great experience a real buzz about the place. The food in the Gallery restaurant was good leading to a very enjoyable evening

GOOD FUN. Cannot think of a better way to spend a Wednesday evening with friends. Great atmosphere, easy access to booze and food. And plenty of opportunity to have a punt and go wild as your horse races past to victory.
A must do. If you are in HK on a Wednesday eve between Sept and March you must go racing. A great atmosphere and only $20 HK dollars to get in.

An excellent HK experience. . Someone recommended heading to the race course on a Wednesday Night and I am so glad they did. I had so much fun. Bands, racing, beers and lots of people there to have a great time. Also the race course is in the centre HK island so the look out over the course is beautiful. Tickets are $10 gates open at 5.15pm racing starts at 7.15.
