Fun Wednesday Night!. Only $2 to get in on Wednesdays. A lot of vendors setup selling reasonable priced beer and food. We went and saw one race and had a beer. It was really cool inside, the track is on grass which is unique too. Could be a fun night for a group of friends.
Fun trip, must see. Fun night out on Wednesdays. Drink are rather expensive and food is of very bad quality. No 'healthy' options available.

Happy Wednesday. Whether you love horse or not, whether you do betting or not, it doesn't matter at all. This is the place where you have to be on Wednesday evening. You may not find this in top 10 attractions of Hong Kong, but once you here, you will say it is one of the best Hong Kong attractions.Hong Kong Jockey Club organize horse racing every Wednesday at Happy Valley Racecourse which starts around 7 PM and ends by 10:30. This is the place people come for betting, food, drink, socializing. They always have some theme for the day which continue upto next week also. I am doing project for Jockey Club, so for me most of the Wednesday evening ends at race course with drink, food, betting and meeting friends. The best part is the entry is only 10 HKD and they accept octopus card also.

Great Wednesday Evening in HK. Initially when we arrived I had no idea how to work out the betting system used. Its a little different from the "yea £5 each way on number 4 please" at the local Point to Point!. Got there in the end though. Tickets are really cheap but drinks and food are quite expensive

Not wrapt. Unfortunately it poured rain which certainly affected our night. It was ok, we were too far from the action in the dining room allotted, the food was good and drinks plentiful. Sha Tin is far better

A special night out. What a remarkable setting. Horse racing under lights has it's own allure but add in the high-rise buildings at Happy Valley and this place is unique. The beer garden is always 'rocking' and there are many, many options to watch, dive and have a flutter. Stable Bend is my pick. Al fresco dining at its best!

I am not a massive horse. Racing fan. But the course and set up here is spectacular. The skyline is amazing and everybody who's everybody in Hong Kong turn out. I was lucky to be in the members lounge. I can honestly say some of the food served was the best I have eaten in years. Shame it was raining the night I visited, perfect otherwise.

A MUST If You Love Horses - Betting Is Fun Too. We spent the evening of December 2, 2015 at the races at the Happy Valley Racecourse. The fun and excitement was apparent from the moment we walked in. The facility is huge and quite a lot to take in. We were fortunate to be hosted by a member of the Hong Kong Jockey Club which afforded us the opportunity to partake in a splendid dinner during the races. The restaurant served delicious entrees while the rest of the meal was buffet style. Enjoying the entire experience in an air conditioned space with TV monitors providing data on the horses, races, odds, etc. was great fun. The member’s restaurant has an outdoor balcony from which the real thrill of horse racing can be experienced: the up-close-and personal thudding of twelve thoroughbreds roaring past…very exciting. Betting is easy – just fill out a simple form with details of the particular race, take it to the counter where it is processed, pay your money, get your stub, and then hope for the best. Minimum bets are only $10 HKD which, at the time of our visit, amounted to only about $1.30 USD at the time of our visit. If one isn’t able to use the members facilities, general admission is also available but without the amenities and dress code. Given Hong Kong’s racing history and the Asian tradition of enjoying gambling, a visit to Happy Valley Racecourse is a must if there is racing on the date of your visit. Check the website for racing schedules to avoid disappointment.

Worth having a look. Decided to visit Happy Valley Racecourse on a wednesday night and was amazed at the experience. It was on $10 to get onto the course. Its just like a British race course with plenty of bard and food areas. There is a place you can listen to English commentary. There was a band playing in between races. The only difference is all the betting is controlled by the Jockey Club(like the tote in UK).......worth going even if you dont bet or like racing just to experience it

Giddy-up at Happy Valley. Every Wednesday night is race night. Get your passport, buy a tourist ticket, grab the credit card and game on. My partner was getting a spa treatment for 2 hours, so what is a solo guy to do on a Wednesday night in Hong Kong. That's it, go for a punt on the horses. Great atmosphere in the beer garden, stunning track views from the stands. Taxi drop off right at the gate. Food, beer, horse racing. Had a great night. Back at the Hotel in just over 2 hours.

They're off! surrounded by skyscrapers.. Wednesday nights are usually race nights, the before/during/post-race commentary is in English, the track is green, the betting is brisk, the food is what you'd expect at a racetrack. Get the racing form from the South China Post the day of the race and have fun!

Great fun. HV has zillions of warm reviews; it seems almost pointless to add another! I go racing a lot; I went with a friend who does not, and we enjoyed it in equal measure. Everything good that you have read about it is true. But a special mention for the staff, they were so helpful, and polite that words fail me in their praise. Don't be scared to go...you will be so well looked after...and have a great time. I wish i were going again tomorrow!
A Night at the Races. Something different. A great night out at the Happy Valley Races. Wonderful staff everybody was very helpful and friendly. Great food.

night at the races. lovely racecourse good atmosphere friendly , cheap entrance a very pleasing experiance plenty quite easy to get a drink or snack ;a queue to put a bet on but not to bad would deffinately go again

Got to go. You don't have to be a gambler, its still a good night out. We use the inside walking track for morning exercise and its rather neat to see a race track in the middle of a high rise filled city.$2 AUD to get in not like the big courses in Australia--Get on the MTR and experience Sha Tin races not a bad "little" course for out in the country.

A cheap and good evening out with friends. I've only been to the races once, but I had a hoot with my friends. The beer is very cheap by HK standards, and the atmosphere is incredible. Really fun thing to do with a big group.

Good fun evening out. Always enjoy times at the races, with the atmosphere, the drinks, the betting and the excitement of the races all combine to make a great time with friends. A very modest entry fee.Allow time to reach there as many roads are closed, likewise the return journey.
Bring your money, bet and win!. There is a legend: if you're beting for first time in Horse Racing, you're going to win. I bet 20 HK $, I won 258$. Go for it!

Like tennis in Wimbledon. Wow, I didn't expect this! I thought of it as a simple race track with some creepy betters like in the movies. But it couldn't be far from that. It's an institution in HK. It's a big event like going to soccer in Germany. People eat there, meet with friends and have fun. Expect an astonishing location and an incredible atmosphere. And if you are new to horse races try the aspect of gambling (and like us the way to find out how).

Fun experience. It was amazing. Fun and exciting. We came on Nov 01, preparing to pay HK$10 for entrance but it was free. The first race started at noon, and last race was around 6PM.My mum and I have fun betting on horse and learning the gambling culture which I have seen on TVB drama since I was young.Good day!!

Don't Miss. Great evening out even if you're not keen on horseracing. Only 10 hk dollars entry to the grandstand where there are good views of the starting gates and finish line. Plenty of food and drink stations with other entertainment going on in between races. Around a crowd of 20'000 made the atmosphere one to remember. Racing starts around 1830 and ends around 2300. Easy to get there, well signed on the streets from the underground system.

Very good experience. Its very typical the hong kongers and expats to go there every Wed. It was my first time experience. Locals are real gamblers. For expats its more like a social event. Many people go there just to hang out and have a drink. if you are not beting its getting a little boring int 2 hours

Fun & festive Wednesday night. Wednesday evening low cost event, great people watching, betting a little difficult but posible. Was there on Oktoberfest night which was funny as I have German heritage. Not a gambler but still a great evening after a hot day.

Worth a visit. Although I visited on a non racing day, it worth a visit. It also has a museum giving the history and evolution of Horse racing in Hong Kong.
The best way to reach in a tram which has the last stop at Happy Valley Race course. Would recommend a visit on race day though to see the race.

The best. Went to Hong Kong as husband enjoys the races. What an experience, caught the MTR walked from causeway bay, not far 10-15 mins. Bought a members tourist day pass for about AUD 28 this allowed us access to a few balconies and better seated areas. Meals available there were tasty, beer, wine and soft drink also available. Had a win the first race and loved the atmosphere, just a magnificent view. Do yourself a favour and experience horse racing at its finest in the delightful city.

My First Races!. My first races, and what an experience! The site itself is overwhelming, I couldn't begin to contemplate how many people could fit in to the vicinity! The staff are happy to explain how their betting slips work, there are plenty of stalls to grab a few pints from, plenty of areas to sit, or to get up close to the race! I believe the races are held every Wednesday night from around 7.00pm. Get there on time to get all your bets in! I went on a Thursday because the Wednesday had been a public holiday. I found that there were lots of people from all over the world and all walks of life here, a great social event and place to meet new people.
Nice place for horse rides. I went to Sunday races at day time, nice way to spend an evening. Excellent location and entrance fee is affordable.
Beautiful Centrally located. Enjoyed a lovely afternoon and lunch at the Happy Valley Racecourse. It is beautiful and elegant, though we did not see any races that day.
Amazing. Fantastic evening out with the locals. Eat drink and bet in a fantastic atmospher amongst the crowds.

Great Fun. Great experience, although the better quality thoroughbreds mainly compere at Sha Tin, I liked the Happy Valley experience. Maybe the horses running are not as good, but the crowd is great fun. Also putting a few HKD on a researched bet after scanning the SCMP is good fun no matter what the quality of equines participating; plus the location is more convenient.

A different night out. we have spent several Wednesday evenings at the Happy Valley races - sometimes in the general public area (HK$10 admission) and others in the grandstand suites. Whichever you are able to do you will enjoy the experience. all betting is on a tote system - the minimum stake was HK$10 (this may have changed) and is easy to understand. You will be amazed at some the sums being wagered by local Hong Kongers. Overall a relatively inexpensive fun night out.
Happy Valley. A good place to go even if you're not into horse racing - like me! Great atmosphere and only $10 to get in.
Cheap and extremely cheerful. Join the islanders for an amazing experience at Happy Valley. You can really get into the great adventure of this place, without burning a hole in your pocket.
Betting on the horses. Easy to get to via tram or cab the races on a wed. Night are a treat ,affordable food and drink u can bet or just take in the fun atmosphere for a mere entrence fee of had 10

Went in 1998...... ....wanted to go again on our return this year but unfortunately the Chinese don't allow anyone under the age of 18.Such a shame as this was our favourite experience of HK in 1998. We had a fabulous time; booked through the Hong Kong Jockey Club which included a dinner in their seventh floor restaurant with viewing balcony, binoculars on hand - we first thought it was dog racing we were so far up! We also went down to the ring to see the horses walk round. A fabulous evening and we've recommended it many times over to friends and colleagues.Such a shame we couldn't take our teenage children this year whilst we were there for a return trip.

An Historical interesting racecourse. We thought this would be a highlite of our stay and we stayed in a hotel across the road and had easy access on Wednesday night through the subway from the hotel. We read that buying a tourist badge was the best option. The ticket box people had very poor English and we were not given any brochure or program which would give better information about where Tourist Badge people were allowed to go. The cost was a lot more than in the $12 public area which is not upmarket. We went to eat in a part where our tourist badge allowed and sat at a table by the windows overlooking the course which did not have a "reserved" ticket on the table, only to be told after starting to eat that we were not allowed to sit there! It was very embarrassing and we gulped down our meal out on a little stand up bar table! We then went to find a seat in the stand as the races were starting and discovered that the "locals" place sheets of newspaper over the seat next to themselves just to save it for their bags etc, and very few seats left for visitors. The Happy Valley Races do not offer a welcome to overseas visitors. Would not waste my money again or if we did go again it would be in the public area where you do get value for money!
Crazy. First time ever to a race course, the staff are more than willing to help you place your bets. Get there early to get the best seats in the stands, better at the back, in case it rains.

Fantastic way to spend a Wednesday night in Hong Kong. We jumped on a tram at Causeway Bay for 2.3 dollars around 20p! Took 5 minutes before the stunning floodlight main stands came into view. Only cost 10 dollars to access the public area of the track. Once in there were a plethora of beer stations, fast food outlets etc.A real buzz about the place and while we did not bet had a great evening for around a £1

So much fun on a Wednesday night!. Having never been to any kind of horse racing I wasn't really sure what to expect, and I was in a really bad mood on the night we visited so of course I was sure that I would have a dreadful time, but the night actually ended up being the most fun I'd had in ages! I'd liken it a bit to the bingo with horses, each race is really short so you have a bit of time to place your bets and then have a drink or some fast food in between races, there's plenty of room to stand around so that you can see at least some of the races, and of course it's thrilling when your horse does well!A thoroughly good time to be had, the races are well organised, betting is easy, and the little booklets they give you with all of the information are easy to read- good even for a first time gambler like me!

Exciting. Horse racing at its most exciting. The setting is spectacular worth a visit just to look. Easy to get to by tram or taxi but it can be congested on race night which is a Wednesday. So much fun even if you don't want to place a bet.

Great Fun. Wednesday night is great fun and extremely busy you can get plenty of drink and food here, there were 10 races throughout the evening ur be prepared to que up for some time to place your bets as its soooo busy. Good night out for everyone

Interesting Experience and Worth a Short Visit. Simply visiting a horse race was a new experience for me, so I had a pretty good time. The facility is amazing and the backdrop of skyscrapers is pretty impressive. The races were exciting but they were spaced out by 30 minutes of so. I was travelling my by self, so there was not much to do other than mill around and check out the track. I wanted to place a small bet, but I couldn't figure out how to fill out the form (Didn't try very hard though). I suspect that if you were there, drinking with friends, between races you would have a great evening. Going solo, it was still interesting and I had a good time for the 1 hour that I was there.

Fun and interesting.. It was my first time at a horse racing establishment, and we actually had VIP passes, however, my brother and I were not let into the VIP section because we were wearing shorts. So we decided to go to the general admission. The place is very big and we decided to gamble a little while we were there. It was fun learning how the horse gambling system works, however, as total newbies we lost a bit of money. Would definitely go again but would want to see how the VIP section differs.

brilliant night out. If visiting Hong Kong make a visit to happy valley races for a fantastic night.The price of entry is about ninety pence programs are free.It is a amazing track to sit under flood lights,food and drink is available , , brilliant,We visited on Wednesday night start time 7.30 finishes about 10.45, then catch taxi in town five minutes walk away.
peek into the horse races. take a 10 dollar entry fee and enjoy the races which happen mostly on Tuesdays. Awesome experience. and excellent crowd.
worth a visit. Held on a Wednesday night, entry is only $10 HKD. Even if you are not a gambler the view of the racecourse amid the high rises is worth it.

great night out. best night out ! cheap as chips. exciting and great fun. even if you don't like racing the sight is out of this world. huge racecourse in middle of the city ! great views and perfect for people watching. from locals to tourists. easy to place bet staff are unbelievably helpful. nothing to be scared of there at all... so easy.

Wow! What A Sensory Overload Experience!. Essential part of the Hong Kong experience. Wednesday night races are a bucket list event. The architecture of the racetrack is a sight to behold. Tourists -- take your passport to the track and pay 13 Hong Kong Dollars for the tourist pass ticket to gain access to the member seats and filed level. Purchase at the "member's entrance"

Great Night!. We had a great night at the races. We booked a table by the finish line. The food was really good and as much wine or beer as you can drink.The staff are really attentive and your glass is never empty.Well worth the money.
Watch the Races. We had so much fun going on a Wednesday night. It's super cheap and it seems like they always have some kind of event going on on Wednesdays. We happened to be there for Octoberfest!
Good place. Went during off season, but inside the view was spectacular, tall skyscrappers. It was just a minute walk from Cosmo hotel I stayed

Fun Wednesday night. Happy valley racecourse is a must have experience if you have time. Joined in on the gambling and won! Drank a couple of beers, afterwards to Wan Chai for ladies night. Ask in your hotel for a coupon, got tickets and ride there for free!

FAST AND FUN. Most ordinary punters will go through the basic turnstile entry which is the furthest from main entrance. Walk all along the outside. You need a 10 HKD piece per person to go through and staff give change if needed. We never found anyone to explain the betting but you collect little slips from the a/c rooms underneath the stands and complete with the race number horse number and type of bet plus amount. We handed this in and it seemed to work. Staff are very patient. The side shows area annoying because they are allowed to go right in front of the track and obstruct the view which is stupid, they should all be moved back nearer the stands. Macdonalds, drinks, a very efficient fast food outlet sells hot dogs and chips and Chinese food. Pricey and poor but just what you'd expect. There is a huge screen to watch the racing on. Lots of people brought their own food and drink.Some English tannoy would help, all the commentary is in Chinese.It was fun, very hot and very busy.

Worth a visit, especially if you are interested in the races!. During the days when there are not races, there is a museum that showcases the history of the racecourse and surrounding Happy Valley. Its a good museum if you are interested in things such as this. Its only a short walk from Time Square when you visiting Causeway Bay. Its not worth going out of your way though. On Wednesday nights, the races occur at Happy Valley and it is a very nice venue and the atmosphere is very good. The public stands are vibrant, filled with gamblers and party goers alike, the beer does start flowing. The restaurants available to members are all very good as well. I think its a worthy visit after dinner in Causeway bay on Wednesdays if you don't have plans. Just remember that its closed in the heights of Summer so do check the schedule before you go.

Awesome experience. That was our first time at the race and we enjoyed this experience. The place is not only about the races but the networking. The atmosphere was great, lots of Europeans, Australians, few people from Asia. Food, drinks (though quite expensive), animation in the breaks. Great emotions when you guess the winning horse! This is the perfect place to spend the Wednesday night in Hong Kong.

Good Night Out!!!. It is really a nice place. If you don't like to gamble just go for the view alone. The back drop is just stunning. We went on a Wednesday and the place was packed. They have live music and food and drinks.

An evening to remember!. Have a great evening and take a punt. I'd never been to a race meeting before, or wished to, but this is a must. Soak up the atmosphere surrounded by the skyscrapers and enjoy the company.

Off to the races in style. On the 6th floor enjoying a fine dinner and drinks looking down at the racetrack and up at the panoramic Hong Kong night lights is a must for all punters when visiting Hong Kong..

horse track. entry fee is 10HKD, about £1. for that you get enjtry to an exciting evening of races. lots of other things between the races, beer tents, food and people watching.gambling is easy, go to the cashier, give them some money and hope you win. all friendly and helpful

Guests at the races. Went as members of the New Zealand Society. We're not gamblers, but given that this is a must-do for visitors to Hong Kong we went along very happily. The evening included a generous buffet dinner with some fascinating dishes - mix of western and asian dishes - and drinks included. The lounge had access to an outdoor balcony frpm which the entire track was visible, though most of us watched there and then dashed back inside to watch the replay on tv! A great evening's entertainment, even if you're not a gambler and don't know too much about horses; betting is not compulsory!

Happy Valley no so Happy. It was a bit disappointing, :( We went there at the beginning to the season, we were so excited to see the races, but it turned out the races is in another race track, waaahhh, so we end up putting our bets and watching it on big screen. waaahh, the experience was okay in the end. we won once! :)

Must go on a Wednesday night. Every Wednesday night, there are live band music and lots of people heading over for a beer and a bet. You wouldn't expect that it is actually a place for people to have party! Everyone is just having fun and the place sells food and drink in outdoor area, the price is a bit high but it wort the price as the entry ticket is so cheap!

Happy Valley Rececourse, Public Running Track, Jockey Club and Museum. OK here we go racing recommenced about three weeks ago and will stop when months are really hot.Originally racecourse was never high on my list but it should have been.Now it should be high on your list.In geographic walking order head to the Jockey offices at northern end of complex.You can enter reception hall see some murals and get a feel for members only and staff areas of the offices.Outside a nice bronze horse at full gallop.Walking past numerous fibreglass statues of horses in colours one first approaches a car park entry.What few people know is that on non race days the public can enter here for free and run on the 1km perimeter track. It is off limits and used for traffic and ambulances during racedays on Saturday and Wednesday. But at other times from early in morning you can run this great 1km track and feel like royalty.The views at night are to die for.About another 30m south from car park one enters the Jockey Museum and if feel like it take your special lady or man to a swanky restaurant just opposite.Exiting and following wall of grandstands south one rounds to the southern end and cheap exit for public at $HK10.Other entries one passes are for members and annual ticket holders which may use higher boxes. The $Hk10 entrance can use Octopus Card.Inside on racedays races are about every 30 minutes with around 12 horses per race doing 1 track.Good luck looking at form guide because races are only one lap there is usually a photo finish of about 4 or more horses.So your horse can be going good until last 100m but you never really know if it did good at end because it is full on finish. Myself I bet a place bet for $HK10 and go for reasonable odds and hope it comes in first 1-4.For betting go up steps and you will find plenty of blue coats to help you fill in a form.But suggest waiting for the odds about 10 minutes before race.There is also a saying that if racecourse is doing badly that the long shot in last race will win.In between races there are stage performances, freebies, food and of course beer.One can see horses parade before start of race at end and lots of pretty ladies promoting things.Take a souvenir from the shop.In the centre of Happy Valley racecourse is property of adjacent Football Club and it has full on services from Restaurants,playing fields and presentation of all sports and is currently under reconstruction.

Horse Racing in Hong Kong "Alive and well". It was a lively racetrack from the ones I have been to in Alberta, Canada. It was an inexpensive but fun night. The racetrack and facility was in amazing condition. I was surprised at the distance the horses ran and they ran the opposite way from North American tracks. The food and drinks were a bit higher than average. Entertainment was good. The minimum bet was reasonable. And I broke even with winnings versus expenses so that is a good night.

Nicest race course I have ever seen. If you know Hong Kong you know there's not a lot of green space, but you forget that once you walk in, the grass is greener than any golf course you'll see. They have a great clubhouse with really good food.

A fun evening in Hong Kong!. We love the races so going to this racecourse while in Hong Kong was at the top of our list of things to do. it was a rainy evening but we were under cover and the races were fun. There were a lot of people there but getting in and out was well organized.

This town still loves their horses!. If you visit HK, watching the horses run on a warm wednesday evening at the Hong Kong Jockey Club Happy Valley Racecourse is a must at least once. Actually twice. Visit and enjoy an evening in the public pit area with the masses and bask in the energy, excitement and flowing beer. Then get a Jockey Club member to take you to the members area where you can enjoy slightly better food and watch the races from the balcony members area right in front of the finish line. Unless you are a hardcore gambler, you will have more fun with a bigger crowd. It's not the Kentucky Derby but still pretty special.

Cheapest, most fun night out in hong kong. Wednesday night racing at Happy Zvalley is a must see. 6 races on the card, 10$HK to get in, 10$ minimum bet. But just go to watch the groundlings. Buy a jug of beer, watch the yuppies straight from work. Sit in the terraces and watch the serious followers of form. Have a flutter. It's got to be done.There's food if you want. Might want to miss the last race to get a taxi. But, in the season, it's not to be missed.
Great Honk Kong attraction. atmospheric,exciting,one of the worlds great racecourses. Well woth a visit, cheap entry,food and drinks

Great evening . I am not a derby expert, in fact this was my first visit to a racecourse - so I found the environment exhilarating. All the betting, drinking and eating was fun too. Beer was flowing through as it was happy Wednesday :) the racecourse is small but beautifully maintained. Lots of drinking options on the grounds . Had a great time

An average running track. This race course's running track is on average, people needed to climb over the fence in order to reach the playground and the football pitch inside. It is near Happy Valley, where traffic is always congested there, because of the tunnel outside. Overall the environment is so so but the venue isn't that good enough. It's best to reach there by taxi or private car, so you could be earlier to reach the place, as MTR is not assessable there, and the bus takes a longer time to reach there.
Inner City excitement. If you like the Horses,then a night out at Happy Valley,takes some beating. Mayhem and Madness,with a chance of a winner or two. Great fun

Nice evening out in HK. Betting on horses is the only gambling allowed in HK and as they like a bit of a flutter it is absolute mayhem during racesGetting to and from can be a challenge Acceptable snacks and even a McDI dread to think what the beer consumption amounts to on a race eveningThoroughly enjoyable and worth a visit and a flutter

Brilliant night out. We went to the last of the seasons night races, very enjoyable night. Brilliant backdrop of the city, about £1(UK) entry fee although alcohol is about £5 a drink. I recommend taking the lift up to the 7th floor, you get a brilliant view of the racecourse. Very busy but that gives it plenty of atmosphere, food was ok for a racecourse and reasonable price.
Excellent racecourse. If you are not invited by a friend to the private boxes the 10 dollar entrance fee to the public course is excellent.great value and wonderful atmosphere.

A different place for a function to a hotel. We held a function there, the staff were attentive, friendly and very helpful. The food was simply delicious and the view at night is so Hong Kong with lights and more lights. Highly recommend for a function (to finish by 8pm however) members lounge

Choose your weeks.. They have moved the horse races to a track out further in the New Territories and you can only see the races here now and then. Such a shame! We wondered why they were so welcoming, they could not get us in the door fast enough and plastered a big VIP sticker on our chests. All we could do was buy beer in plastic caps and watch the races on a screen!
An Oasis of Sport. A great evening at the races. There are plenty of other things to see during the week including rugby and football matches.
living in Hong Kong. Happy valley racing is a must for all visitors to Hong Kong. Savour the atmosphere of the racing under floodlights also the betting by the locals, enjoy a beer between races

fantastic night. We had 2 seperate nights here 1 at a coorperate suite inc meal , this was excellent. we enjoyed it so much we went again and mixed in with the locals etc in the main arena , beer fest was going on at the time it was a fantastic night. bets are easy to understand and queues are lng but move quickly. A must do in Hong Kong
Amazing, great races & facility. Absolutely amazing facility, one of the best racecourses in the world. Even if you arent into horse racing it is worth to check out, amazing beer garden and view!

Happy Valley Racecourse. I could get a glimpse to the Happy Valley Racecourse from my hotel room and post enquiries with friends I made it as a point to visit there. In the very next week three of us visited there and it was fun. I would say it is a good place to hangout which is well maintained and clean. Also you can try your chances on betting, if you would like to do so
Top Ten HK attractions.. Should be a must do for both locals and tourists alike.A lot of fun - a horse race lover or not. What a shame kids aren't allowed in.

Great time with Family, Fun Night. Ok our Clan went to Happy Valley on a Wednesday Night. What a Blast!! Older Kids, (late Teens, Early 20's ) Had a blast learning how the horse races worked, the atmosphere at the track was great, crowded but fun and packed with excitment. This should be a "must do" on your visit to Hong Kong!
Try it once !. Nice and lively venue, you can either hang out with friends, play actively on all the races, everything is well organized for you to enjoy your evening.
Cathay Special Box was awsome. The place is well organize and clean. It was very easy to make a bet and claimed your win. We went here with a group of friends which even made us more fun

Happy Day at Happy Valley. The races at Happy Valley are worth a visit. It is crawling with Westerners and promises a good time. I went there a few weeks ago to watch the races and managed to watch from the sixth floor which had magnificent views. The food and beers was well priced too. Give it a try!

Great party atmosphere in the heart of the city. Amazing to have an internationally famous race course right in the middle of the city! The night racing is perfect to enjoy the backdrop of HK's famous skyscrapers. The atmosphere is electric every Wednesday night with fun entertainment in between the races. Beware in Summer months, as humidity can be really high and not much fun outside. Best months are before May and after September

Probably the best thing to do on a Wednesday night.. Happy Valley is great fun.It is open on Wednesday Evenings and sometimes the occasional weekend. At only $HKD10 entry it is great value.The easiest way to get there is to take the MTR to Causeway bay and walk. Take the Times Square exit. Race evenings make the area very very busy.Beer is reasonable priced and the atmosphere electric. Much more fun than many of the race courses that I have been to in the rest of the world. Hong Kong people love to gamble and many of the people bet on Number 8 which is the Chinese lucky number, even if number 8 has three legs people will bet on it.Number 4 is unlucky number, so even if the horse is the best in the race, it will not always show the tightest odds.

The place to be. If you're attending a sport event... this vast space of what otherwise be a concrete jungle of Hong Kong is a sheer bliss. Space is a premium at the city center. This place offer the chance for the claustrophobias to breath a sigh of relief

Great Night Time on the Punt. Follow the money and have a bet and enjoy all around you. At the races you get to see all the highrises around the track and the loudness of the punters is one to be a part of.

Mid week horse racing!. You don't have to be 'horsey' to enjoy the races at Happy Valley! Mid week racing is great fun with superb ambience, occasional live music & of course a flutter on the horses. Incredibly cheap entrance fee and good value drinks- food is ok varying from local noodles to hot dogs, burgers. If you go with a member , the food is better and you are away from the crowds but you definitely lose some of the buzzy atmosphere. Definitely recommended.

Always a great night out.. If you like horses and racing, this is the place to be. It's an up close and personal experience. Betting is easy too and it's just "fun" being there. It gets crowded at times, however. The venue is amazing.

A Great Evening Out!. Horse racing in HK is an institution. It's not only about the gambling, but also the ambiance created by the thousands of horse racing enthusiasts.
In addition, the location is in the city and is usually held on a weekday evening. There is a great beer hall which is outdoors with a panoramic view of the race course.
Try to go with a member. Going with a member and enjoying dinner is a fabulous experience. I am not really a fan of the races but love going at night when in Hong Kong.

My first races. This was the first racecourse I have been to and we came with friends from Hong Kong. It was a fun experience and we won on a race which always helps. Apparently it was the last race night of the season which we believe drew a few extras. I enjoyed the relaxed dress code, the jugs of beer and it was interesting to see how packed McDonald's was.Certainly worth checking out for the HKD10 entry fee you can use your octopus card for. Don't think we will be going back though.

Fantastic back drop to a racecourse. We wanted to sample racing Hong Kong style and we are glad we did. Betting was a little different but easily picked up, a smokers delight - people lighting up everywhere which my husband was very happy with!! Being VRC members we went in the members area which was very comfortable but it looked like they were having much more fun in the outer; music, beer tents, dancing and I am sure the odd bet here and there lol. Very accessible by tram and I am sure other public transport, taxis aren't all that expensive either if you are staying on Hong Kong Island. If you enjoying racing definately worth a visit on a Wednesday night.

Horse racing. If you like local color, a fever-pitch atmosphere and people-watching, go to the horse races at Happy Valley (this venue being centrally located on Hong Kong Island is more easily accessible than the Shatin Racecourse in the New Territories). Entrance to the General Stand is HK$10 payable at the entrance. For HK$100 and upon presentation of your passport, you can get a one-day Member's Badge that allows you to watch the races in the Members' Area. You can also take the Horseracing Tour if you are a foreign passport holder and willing to pay more. The extra fee covers transportation to and from the racecourse, a buffet lunch/dinner and a drink, a HK$30 voucher for betting, access to the Members' Boxes and the betting halls, and a tour of the parade ground and winning post between races. A friend who is a member of the Jockey Club invited me to have supper with her and her family at the Happy Valley Jockey Club Moon Koon Restaurant on a racenight. There, we watched the races in a very pleasant environment as we enjoyed fine Cantonese cuisine. Check the race schedule beforehand. The horseracing season is from September to June or early July. Check out the Hong Kong Racing Museum (it is now closed but will be re-opened in September 2015).

Smoker's Paradise. Beautiful setting at night and easy to access by transit. Lots of ATM's and the cashiers are pretty good about assisting with bets. However, unless you LOVE to smoke or inhale second hand smoke, best to keep your money and head somewhere else.
Fun on a Wednesday night!. A little hard to find where the entrance is but once you get in, it is fun to watch the horses and jockeys.
Simply Great!. You should experience a horse race at night. You will be stunned by this tremendous course and the matchless atmosphere of the stadium.

RACECOURSE tO AMAZE. This racecourse is in the middle of all the tall buildings it is a sight to see they have used every inch of land and because they love there racing so much it is fantastic. So well kept.. Enjoy your winnings.

Fun Night Out. It is a great way to see another way of life in Hong Kong if you are a tourist. The money that is spent is amazing. Can be a cheap night out on the rails or a great and expensive night out in the stands. Having managed to get an invite to a box it is hard to go back down to the rails :-)

Amazing party atmosphere and horse races.. Wednesday nights in Happy Valley are just plain fun. I usually just go to the beer garden to watch the live music and the races. It's mostly expats, and it's an energetic, young crowd. Also, it's only $10 Hong Kong dollars. Once I made the mistake of getting a ticket in the stands, and it was depressing. Low energy gamblers chain smoking.
Exciting to visit. Even though they run backwards (other direction from US) :-) it is a great area and super races. Only gambling we like.

Always a great night. Go every year when I'm in HK on business, it's amazing to go to the races surrounded by sky scrapers and when the sun sets with the flood lights on it's even more special.We always use Grayline Tours and I think when you can go some places and pay £20 for a pink in HK that spending £90 on this tour with entry, a free bet and food and drink included it's one of the best deals in HK.Would recommend this to anyone going to HK.

Fantastic atmosphere, with live action and great food. I was invited to go to Happy Valley Racecourse to watch the horse racing by a member and to sample the delicious buffet meal. At each table there is a large screen to see the racing action and the odds for each race. You can then go out to place your bet with the cashiers. When the racing starts you can either watch it on the screen by your table or go out on the balcony and with a great view of the track watch the action live out in the fresh air. The most exciting part is when you win and you can collect your winnings! You really get the thrill of the race here.

It was a good experience on a Night out for Horse Race. The Racecourse could be crowded on Wednesday night race. Sometimes on Sunday. It was a good experience even I don't know much about Horse Race. It was fun.

Nice hide out! (But not on the raceday). This is where the locals and the living expat spent their afternoon on weekends. Either you want to have some good sport or sitting around and drink beers or just want to be lucky to meet someone. Happy Valley is the place. Don't leave Hong Kong before you visit Happy Valley!

A must place to visit. The Hong Kong Jockey Club pulls out all the stops to ensure locals and tourists enjoy THE "sport" of choice for the people. Of equal importance, the Hong Kong Jockey Club funnels the money back into society. A winner from A to Z.
Go if you get the chance. We were lucky to catch the last meet until sept.and it was a brilliant spectacle,seeing the locals having fun.Admission is dirt cheap and the cost of food was reasonable

Best Experience!. Its a wonderful experience being here on a raceday which is generally a wednesday. Races start around 7 in the evening and continue upto 11 PM after which the crowds head up to Wanchai and LKF for night long fun. The atmosphere at Happy Valley is electric. The green turf along the backdrop of Hong Kong skyscrapers provide a spectacular scene. The stands are great while the scroreboard is huge. Top that with good music, lively crowd and snacks, its a fun .

Exciting Experience, Party and Horses. an exciting combination of experiencing horse race atmosphere, party (bands, shows between the races). Unlike Race courses in other parts of the world, no dress code (unless you go to the VIP rooms), so flip-flops and shorts are totally fine. Shows between the races are usually themed differently every week (i.e. french week, bollywood etc.)

Head there on Wednesday night for a great night. This is just mad! In the middle of this crazy city of skyscrapers you have Happy Valley, the old colonial racecourse. HK Chinese and ex-pats rub shoulders and bet their dollars on a series of races. Lots of extra entertainment and plenty of drinks stands to keep you cool in the sweltering heat.

Happy times at Happy Valley. A Wednesday night in Happy Valley is always a good time. Beer is rather cheap (compared to the rest of the city) and the atmosphere is great down by the rails. I would recommend all to check it out if you are in HK for a Wednesday night. Good luck!

Happy Wednesday is great!. Even i'm a local in HK, I only been to the race course two times in my entire life! It's easily walkable from Causeway bay MTR, and the Happy Wednesday is really fun. I went during June when there's Bollywood night. You get to dress up in Indian culture dresses and take photos, while drinking beer/wine and maybe bet on horses ( haha never done it before).

Fun wednesday evening ... beer, food and races. Happy Valley is more about the party than the races but betting on the horses is also fun. The racetrack is right in the middle of the city and is a very nice facility. There are main tickets that can be purchased with an octopus card (local card used for MTR and other transportation) or you can purchase tickets ahead if you would like a better view (higher in the stands). It is a great location for a work outing, night with a group or couples night.

Horse Racing must see. Take the tram (ding ding) to the end of the line at Happy Valley and spend the day walking around the racecourse if there is not a race. The central park/part of the racecourse is open to the public.It was the only piece of land flat and large enough in HK where the colonizers could build a horse racing course where they could gamble. Behind the main spectator building are interesting graveyards of those original inhabitants of HK, if you like that kind of stuff. That is why it is called Happy Valley. In the 1890's and 00's when you died you were buried in the Happy Valley. There is a famous hospital and ritzy apartments and fine restaurants. The underground walkways though may be haunted and is lived in by some of the homeless of HK.The HK Jockey Club has become one of the iconic institutions in HK. They control the lotteries, gambling, golf courses, and the clubby atmosphere that is so typical HK, legally. Come on race day and win some money. But it gets busy. Hope springs eternal.
A night at the races. A night at Happy Valley races is a must do during the racing season. The amount of money that passes hands for both the rich and poor is a sight to behold
Brilliant night out. Well organised, good fun, costs virtually nothing to get inExcellent races as alwaysGood food and drinkHighly recommended
Exciting entertainment. Although I do not promote betting/gambling, I still found it very interesting to participate in an evening race event.Don't go in the hot season (race is off anyway).

An evening's entertainment. If you visit Hong Kong then you should try to get along to the racecourse for a night's entertainment. Having a flutter is fun and yu can then sit back and watch the racing and the people. Enjoyable pasttime in the evening. Places to eat and drink available as well.
Good Infrastructure facilty. Very good managed . Maintenance is very good . Enjoyed Morning walk for couple of days . Surprised to see such a big space for sports in Hongkong .

Another must do Hong Kong experience. Betting is part of the hong kong experience. In the racecourse you get in the belly of the beast. Hong Kong Jockey Club is the largest tax payer in the city involved in many foundation. All strata of Society participate in the betting. A network of betting shop all over hong kong centralises the betting. Race day is Wednesday.

The best place to see the horse races.. The original racetrack is this one! It is the farthest end on the Hong Kong Island away from the Central District. It is world famous, and busy all the time when it is not too hot.

The Best Night in Hong Kong. If you are visiting Hong Kong and its not the Summer season when the races are closed, (even if you don't like racing or horses) I would really recommend Happy Valley night-time race every Wednesday night.Its such a vibrant and exciting venue, that even you dont have a flutter on the horses, the beer, wine and food will keep you entertained.

but where to get in. We had a really exciting evening. Bets start at HK$10 (about £1) - and lots of helpful staff available to show you how to fill in the slips. Amazing atmosphere - floodlit arena with tower blocks surrounding - creates a real buzz.

Worth a visit. The best night to go is Wednesday when it is very bustling. Tourists can buy a tourist ticket which is quite cheap and the atmosphere is great. The back drop to the race course is amazing at night time.

Best colour to win!. Great family night out. One doesn't need to spend a lot on bets but it makes it more fun if you do all place a few! The drinks are priced about Honk Kong rates, but the food isn't much to write about! Eat before or after.

Nice and fun evening. Went with friends to feel the vibe from this fantastic place and drink beer buckets and loose some cash for fun, realy nice evening and full of happy people havin a good evening.It is a must go place if you have the chance.Have a few big cold beers and enjoy the vibe and people.
Fantastic Night. Fantastic night spent at the races. We paid a little extra and booked a table on the balcony with a buffet dinner. It is a must on any travellers list.
Great time. Went here on a weekday and it was packed! lots of stuff to see and do. Really fun atmosphere. Was fun to bet on horses even though I didn't win.

very interesting place. It was interesting for my wife and I because we come from a suburb called Happy Valley. This race course is located in the middle of tall buildings and apartment blocks. It's hard to get a good look at it unless you go up the hills to the lookouts. We were unable to get into the course on the day we were there as there was some security thing happening. But I think it would be worth a visit.

Star Ferries. In over 30 years of traveling to Hong Kong, the Star Ferry is still a highlight. Old boats, such a variety of people, the hustle and bustle the views, a must do for anyone that goes to Hong Kong.

Great Fun Night at Happy Valley. Decided to go to the night races at Happy Valley while we were recently visiting Hong Kong and I loved it. If you take your passport along with you for HK130 (about AUD$20) you can gain admittance to the Members area which was really good. We also crossed over to the General Admission area during the evening and had great fun down right on the fence. To be up close and personal with the horses on a warm and balmy night with lit up skyscrapers and people filled stands was an amazing sight. Just loved it.

Wednesday night flutter. Whilst on a business trip we had some free time so ventured here. It is really popular on a Wednesday night and has a great atmosphere and is just 10 Hong Kong dollars to get in - basically a quid! Then it is up to what you spend. There is a lot of take away style food available. I had chicken and rice but it was more like bones and rice. The pork and rice option looked good though. Definitely worth a visit if you get the chance. Travel afterwards is tricky and you might need to wait or walk for taxi unless you are clued up on the trams waiting outside.
Best Atmosphere. Wednesday night races have the best atmosphere, lots of people, plenty of beers and food and of course some great horse racing. Punter or not you will love this place.
Wednesday night fun experience. If you're looking for a fun night out and you're in Hong Kong on a Wednesday check out Happy Valley. It was a fun experience and there were a lot of westerners.

A must during race season on Wednesday. I must admit that I have never been interested in horse races but then I moved to Hong Kong and a friend of mine took me there. Since then I was amazed by this catchy atmosphere you experience on this Wednesday night evening event. If you are a tourist in Hong Kong avoid the expensive Jockey Club entrance. Use the public entrance which is costing much less. What I personally like is that you will meet any kind of person on Wednesday night at the race course. From taxi driver, expat, local white collar worker, tourist, rich and famous everybody is there to bet on horses and have a good time with his friends. After the races I recommend to move over to Wan Chai. Especially it is worth a trial, as on Wednesdays it is ladies night in many bars and selected drinks are for free! If you visit Hong Kong you should have experienced this special atmosphere at least once.

Great night out. We purchased members tickets and were right next to the winning post. We had a great night, fantastic views of the track and the food was also excellent. We chatted to some locals and had a thoroughly enjoyable time.

Fun at the course. We went to Happy Valley for the first time this trip - not big punters, but wanted the experience. It is an amazing track right in the middle of all of the high rise buildings. Lots to see and very cheap to get in. We had a great time.

Great experience. Was here twice on a Wednesday race night with business association (big group). The food and the atmosphere is amazing and all in all a great experience. The view from the balcony is just amazing and it's really a special atmosphere with all these skyscrapers around you can this big track in the middle. The staff is great and friendly and very helpful... will try to come again
Looks beautiful and is huge. Looks beautiful and is huge , I personally didn't know Hong Kong was so big in equestrian sports ! There's football, hockey and other stadiums too in the same complex.
Enjoy the atmosphere. Great atmosphere on race day as many locals like to watch the game especially the ones on Sunday. Lots of shouting and good for people watch.

Great Night Out. IMHO a must do in HK. Unique race track right in the heart of down town. Very accessible and absurdly cheap compared to racing in the UK. Great atmosphere with lots of locals and ex-pats. Also standard of racing is very high and first timer or novices well accommodated as its very easy to understand and to bet and so on. Again unlike UK racing which is overly complicated and designed around people that make there living from this.

Hot and humid day at HVR. Had a good time here despite the muggy weather in May! For more details of my experience at HPV racecourse, check out my blog: http://hongkonghong.com/2015/06/19/happy-valley-racecourse/

Amazing night at the races. A great evening and the stadium and high rise skyscraper background is awesome. A must when in HK! We got tickets for a set meal in one of the restaurants which was an experience!

wednesday evening races. Its only 10 dollars to get in. You are handed betting slips by smartly dressed young ladies, who explain how you can place bets, and they even give you a rating slip fro the horses running. The beer and wine is not badly priced either. A great evening out

Running around the racecourse!. The Happy Valley Racecourse is open to all visitors for free (two entry/exit points) so you see classes from nearby schools exercising and plenty of runners on the track around the inner circle of the field. If you start early there is even chance for some shade, and the views of the Causeway Bay skyline are stunning. The entire course is about 1.6 km for one round. Worth a try for all traveling runners!

Quite an experience in the middle of HK !!. Went there with some friends, had a blast !The atmosphere there is just unique, a big melting pot in the middle of HK !You can have a drink, eat something, bet on some horses, very atypical night in the city !
Fun. Amazing view of track from grandstand. I f you show them you passport you will get a cheap entry into grandstand. It is amazing to sit there and see all the apartments surrounding the track

A great social outing. I have now been to the races in Hong Kong a half a dozen times. I have been to both happy Valley and Sha Tin courses, always with an organized tour which includes a buffet lunch or dinner in an air conditioned function room on the upper floor of the grand stands. The view of the course is exceptional, the food excellent and the betting facilities actually in the same room. A wonderful way to meet people, have a great meal and watch the races.

Greatr for a night at the Races. Situated in the heart of Hong Kong it has a unique setting. The stands along oneside only give an excellent view of the track with electronic screems showing the betting and the racing at the back of the course. If you are onin a box the views are great and the box areas have balconies. A great night out
Great night out.. Easy for a newcomer to enjoy. Atmosphere is happy and excited. Entertainment apart form the nags, seems to be provided. Races every 30 mins.

Don't miss this. This really is a must do for Hong Kong - you'll never have seen a race track like it - what an amazing setting. No need to go on an organised visit, use public transport and go through the public turnstiles (you can get in with your Octopus Card) mingle with the locals and see them enjoying their betting, have a bet yourself, it's easy but if you're not sure how to do it the staff there will help, you certainly get close to the track & it's a really fun and very cheap evening out

Great night out. Went here the night we arrived in HK - couldn't decide if we should do the sensible thing and go to sleep after travelling for around 20 hours- so glad we didn't! Met up with friends who live in HK and had a great night out. Cost for tourists to get in was just HK$ 10 or less than £1 - crazy - just remember and take your passport along - great atmosphere with thousands of people and various entertainment
Just go. A visit to HK is not complete without spending a night at Happy Valley. Book at HKJC web site for Stable Bend dining - great food, fantastic experience.
Excited activity . Very excited horse racing! Everybody is shouting when the race started. Everyone is very high! the atmosphere in here is very good.

Night at the Races. Now this was fun. We were upstairs on the executive floors. Nice food buffet and plenty to drink. An amazing view of the racecourse as you could really see how the whole race progressed without needing TV screen. I really enjoyed this night out at the races - a must if you visit Hong Kong.

Amazing experience. Loved the whole experience. Tremendous atmosphere - absolutely buzzing. Easy to place a bet. Lots of food options. Visibility great. And a ride home on a tram absolutely necessary to complete the experience.
Wednesday Nights. We went on a Wednesday and the races were awesome! With the skyline in the back and a clean venue, there wasn't much not to like! Get there early if you want a spot on the rail.

Scenery, sport, beer, what's not to like?. Weds night is race night. No kids (unfortunately, would be perfect for them). When we went they were handing out flyers for free entry. Fantastic atmosphere. Highlight of Hong Kong. Min bet was small, easy to understand instructions. I recommend.
Horse Racing. Probably one of the best race tracks in the world. State of the art and an amazing view from the pavillion... Watch a horse race if its on every evening at Happy Valley.....

exciting. I'm not a gambler. And I have never been to a horse racing before but this was exciting. At first the crowd is quiet but as the jockeys and horses come into the last corner then the yelling and shouting begins. It is truly a climax that ends when they cross the finishing line. I like this racecourse because it is for everyone. Not only the rich people. Where women do not necessarily wear hats. No, this is much more my kind of attraction.Enjoyed some good food and drinks and relaxed. Next time in HK I will visit Happy Valley again.

A Fun night out. This is a cheap and fun night out in Hong Kong. The races are normally held on a Wednesday night. It costs about HK$10 to enter, food and drinks are available inside and you can take a few bets on the horses if you wish or just watch the races. It is a very local attraction and well worth doing when in Hong Kong.

Happiest Place in Hong Kong After Disneyland.. For a great Wednesday night out, go to the Happy Valley races whilst in Hong Kong. It is always crowded with lots of ex-pat locals and tourists having a great time. Down on the concourse next to the track is the best place to be. There are beer tents there for a drink or tow, along with a live band playing between races. Oh and have a bet or two to add to the enjoyment and maybe win a few dollars.A great night out and definitely a must when visiting Hong Kong. You will not be disappointed!!

A night betting on the horses. We made an evening of it at the Happy Valley Racecourse where we pre-booked the meal option.It is an amazing sight seeing the very modern racecourse surrounded by skyscrapers especially at night - surreal !!The food was "OK" with some items not to our liking but part of the experience. This was followed by some fun betting on the horses - we won less than we bet but it was still great fun placing your bet and then going out to the grandstand to watch the race - great atmosphere and well worth a visit.Only downside is the long walk to the nearest MTR station - we couldn't find a taxi rank near the racecourse, but may have been looking in the wrong section. We eventually managed to flag down a taxi to take us to the best MTR station to help us complete our journey home.

The only way to go to the races.. We booked a dinning package in the Members on the sixth floor through the Hong Kong Jockey Club.The food from the buffet and the service was great and made the night very enjoyable.
Lots of fun for everyone!. Unique setting, lots of atmosphere. Recommend the night races, even in the pouring rain!! Felt clean, good facilities, easily accessible

A unique location. Happy Valley racecourse is a unique place surrounded by high rise buildings on all sides and with a sports ground complex in the middle. Most racing here is on Wednesday nights - check out the beer garden!

Easy access entertainment.. Races on Wednesday evenings from 7pm except in the hot summer months. HK$10 to get in (swipe in if you have an Octopus card). There is a wide choice of takeaway food and drinks stands inside. If you wish to study the form, get a copy of the South China Morning Post during the day. Otherwise pick one with a funny name!

A mandatory experience.. If you're in HK on a Wednesday when there's a race on you must attend. It's an institution. An iconic event and location. Surely there is no other race track in the world nestling among tower blocks?

Great Night Out. This was a great night out, we were in Hong Kong with friends and they mentioned the races, so off we went. The place is big, biggest crowd I've seen at a race track, but you can have a bet, drink and something to eat with out a hassle. The track is very different to tracks in Australia as you watch them go around, all of a sudden you can't see them, the track goes up and down. It's a great night out, a must see.

Not worth the tourist bade. For the price and the descriptions of being in the Members area we were very disappointed. In effect confined to a long betting hall with second rate food from only one venue (except a snack bar). We actually asked if this was best on offer. It was. There must have been better but your tourist badge doesn't get you entry. Save your money and go to the public area. The racing and food is as good without the extra price tag.

Wednesday night racing. Join Hong Kongers betting on the ponies. The track is a bit lopsided but the racing is real, and fast. The high rise buildings around the track are amazing. You'll not see another race track like this one.
Excellent. Excellent way to pass an evening, racing was good, but the Happy Wednesday, French theme night was a bit naff

Wednesday Night Racing. Had a fantastic Wednesday night at the Happy Valley Races! Caught the tram out then walked with the crowds. We were in the restaurant on the second floor at the football club end (sorry can't remember the name) and had a great view. The staff were all very helpful explaining their different tote system, and despite the tens of thousands of HKD those around us were punting, they were happy to encourage our little $10 bets! If you like racing, sport, or just a great night's entertainment, this is a must do as there is no other race track in the world like it surrounded by the skyscrapers.

Different to the Melbourne Cup!!. Not what I expected, but on definitely worth a visit to experience it. It's an experience worth trying especially if you love the races. I'm glad I tried it, possibly better if you go with a larger group but enjoyed it all the same. No dress code either, if you want to get closer to the race track you will have to stay there and man your spot as it will be taken very quickly.

A blast!. Hong Kong folks love their ponies and I'm hooked! Easy to get to, cheap to enter, and lots to see and do. Beautiful track with various levels for all levels of society. I stayed on the general admission area around the beer garden which was great. Everyone in a good mood, friendly and just a great night out. Plenty of help if needed with betting. Every Wednesday, take the MTR to Causeway Bay and stroll up. Lots of restaurants in the area.

More than meets the eye. Happy Valley Racecourse has a lot to offer.Visit Reception only area of Jockey Club Offices, then Museum with lead into a restaurant to impress.One unknown to most travellers is that the centre of the racecourse is home to The Football Club and contains restaurants, football pitches,tennis,bowling etc etc.But best of all for those who like running this is 10 times better than Victoria Park.A running track exists between the grassed horse racing area and central football grounds wide enough for traffic and is open to public except on race times which are Wednesday night and Sat I think.It is open until very late at least 10pm but check.Enter through car park on way to museum and take a look at running track and view from inside.Racenight entry is cheapest at $HK10 from northern area.Can get Happy Valley Tram and walk back to cheapest entrance.Walk down to Happy Valley from Peak along Blacks Trail from Wanchai Gap Police Museum - couple hours.Opposite Happy Valley Racecourse is St Michael's Cemetary with history back to 1840's many seaman from ships recorded at Maritime Museum can be found here and soldiers from all wars.Next door is a Parsee Cemetary dedicated to Indian soldiers who perhaps died during Boxer Rebellions but also date to early days.I ask all to be extremely respectful and well dressed especially in latter it is not a tourist attraction but tranquil, beautiful with gardens/flowers and place of respect.
Brilliant Night out. Great night out for a massive entrance fee of £1, try taking the tram to get there, but leave plenty of time.

Must see. Just beeing there, feeling the atmosphere, watching there people beeing cought up in the races ... was amazing. This is the place were locals and expats get together to watch the races, chat, drink or/and eat together. It is quite cheap.Admission costs only 10 HKD for tourists/public and such and drink and food don't cost too much either.
Great fun. Very well set up and a lot of fun.Great atmosphere whether you have a flutter or not.We went down to the track side outside and enjoyed a cold beer and enjoyed watching the races!
Fun Wednesday night . Place I often take tourists in town on a Wednesday. It's a very casual night with cheap beer and at times what feels like every expat in town.

Great night out. 10 HK dollars to get in, plenty of food and drink choice, entertainment between races and a fun atmosphere.
As the night goes on the atmosphere builds but be careful if you stay till the end as you will get caught in the crowd.

More than we expected. Guided tour, approx. $160 AUD. dress smart, suit not required ,the brochure is misleading stating not to take mobile phones, we didn't,everyone else did, plenty of time for bets, food & alcohol to have, guide ok but not very personal, collected from pick up point & returned as stated, it was about the only guided tour that was on time. Late afternoon to at least 11pm

Night racing. Loved the atmosphere at the races. Only $10 HKD each to get in. No room to stand on the fence so just got a seat in the grandstand. Great view of the race either live or on the big screen. Live music and other distractions if betting does not. Do it for you. Taxi's very hard to obtain after the races. Prepare yourself for a wait organise public transport

Must do Wednesday night. if you are in Hong Kong on a Wednesday, this is the place. it is loud , hectic and fun. get your bets on early so u don't have to line up , then pick your beer and get on it. The only downside is trying to get transport after the races, not easy but be patient, don't turn left like we did.

Good Environment. I have been to there when there was horse-riding a few months ago. In fact, it is a really convenient place whereas people can go there by either MTR or bus. The environment is humorous and friendly. People is very enthusiastic on horse-riding campaign. I love the mood and environment there.
Good night out if you like the races. Good fun. Able to get into the members on presentation of your passport. #0 minutes between races means continual action. Food is cheap and ok.

Get among the locals on the infield. It is several years ago now (not June 2014) that I did this but one midweek evening after our training course had finished I caught a bus/trolly down to Happy Valley Racecourse. I decided not to take up the tourist offer of access to the grandstand and lounges but head into the general public area. From memory the admission was something like $2 and, dressed in a suit, I was yelling with the locals to encourage our favoured horses around the track. One mistake I made was to carry my camera (taking of photos wasn't allowed) but security just gestured for me to keep it under my jacket, rather than surrender it, and not take photos. I still have fond memories of this experience and feel it was the better for mixing with the locals rather than the corporate experience.

A fun evening. Taking the tram to the racecourse, sitting on the stands and eating hot dogs whilst watching the people and the horses is really good fun. A must if you have time and haven't done it before.
JA JA IN HONG KONG. Full of energy----HK loves their horses. Arrived late----no admission fee. So I bet on one race and lose big. I will not return!!!

In luck or out of it. If you take a tram either from Kennedy Town or from Shaukiwan, Happy Valley is your final destination. Horse racing is usually held on Wednesday night in Happy Valley while the others are on Saturday or Sunday afternoon in Shatin. The events are operated by Hong Kong Jockey Club, and there are two different locations to make a bet, one is for members, the other is for public. Gambling is permitted publicly here, therefore there is no need to worry about illegal betting.

Like a carnival!. It's an interesting place to visit when in Hong Kong city, The atmosphere is very lively, like a carnival. It's just HKD10 to enter the racecourse, payable with Octopus card.https://www.facebook.com/monkeygoplaces

Happy Wednesday_Happy Valley Racecourse. There are two racecourses in Hong Kong (Sha Tin and Happy Valley). Recently I like going to Happy Valley Racecourse which is located near Causeway Bay (MTR Exit A), as the organizer of Happy Valley provides everybody to enjoy the event “Digital Nights at Happy Wednesday”. I joined few times, there were many amazing attractions e.g. Magic Show, Dancing Show, Beers Counter, 3D Painting for photo taking, etc. During the event, everyone can join the horse racing which is the only legal form of gambling in Hong Kong. During the horse racing, I really can feel the amazing atmosphere.
A great fun night out. If you are in town on a Wednesday. Head to the races. It is really good fun and you can get beers and hot dogs around the track. I will be back

What a great way to spend a Wednesday night. Best value evening in Hong Kong. Easy and cheap to get there, entry fee not worth mentioning, beer and food basic but efficiently dispensed. Help with betting and a great atmosphere. If you can, take in the experience. Racing itself something slightly peripheral!

You've got to do it. This is a great night out. Dress up or dress down. $10HKD to enter but you can book entry to other areas before you go or pay a bit extra to go into the Beer Garden area. The general admission area is fun too. It seems like lots of expats get to the races along with loads of locals.

Run like a horse. I like to jog, and I like to jog especially in my vacation. It's a spacial way for me to "visit" and "sight-seeing". When I found out that I could do my daily run at Happy Valley Racecourse, I was so excited and can't wait for that.Happy Valley Racecourse provides a great training trail for runners. According to web info, it's about 1370m for one lap, its well-paved flat path (next to the racetrack), and is perfect for travelers who are tired of running track-mill. Changing room, toilet and lockers are available at the building in the middle of the sports ground. And the best part is, the field is open to public except on a race day. I went there for my morning jog. It's so good when I found out that I was running like a local there, we run together, and say hi to each other. Besides runners, there are many old folks were doing there "Tai-Chi" or daily exercise, while a group of kids were playing football there. It is truly a relax and wonderful morning for me in a hustle bustle city like Hong Kong.

a must visit attraction. Just outside hong kong this race course was something i wanted to see and it did not disappoint. Surrounded by sky scrapers it must be a amazing site when the racing was on as i visited out of season. 12% of all hong kongs revenue is spent at this place and to see it in the flesh having seen it on TV was amazing

The only was to go to the races. We booked a tour to the Happy Valley Races, included a meal and some funds for betting. The meal was outstanding and the service made you feel like a King.. We left with a profit after we made out "wages" bet so i would recommend it to all
Wednesday Night Racing!. Such a good night, amazing atmosphere and full of people! easily accessible on the tram - definitely a good night out whether you're a gambler or not.

racing museum with a view. okay horse racing isnt every ones cup of tea and certainly isnt mine. this is a pretty good museum tho and is interesting enough for the old photos of the area and shatin before the mass development bounded in on the areas. the museum also gives you a view of the track at the exit of the turn. there is some interesting exhibits from yester year before electronic modernization of betting.this place is worth a visit if the weather is looking bad and its best not to waste your holiday sitting on a hotel room. i would safely assume that any visitor would find something of interest and if your a rare one not to, at least enjoy the view.
A must on a Wednesday night. fantastic racing,get there if you can!always lots of entertainment going on bands,drinking competitions,as well as about 12 races,

Great fun on a Wednesday night in Happy Valley. Exciting place to be on a Wednesday night: Thoroughbred horse racing, fine dining, beer garden if you want to stay casual. The horses gallop very close to you. you can hear the sound of their hooves, thrilling! and you can bet and make money too!

Such a fun night for the not so serious gamblers. Great night for not serious gamblers - the alcohol and food tents are great in the public area. No need to go into the paid areas as they really are nothing more, everything you need is in the main area! Definitely the more commercial of the two racecourses available in Hong Kong. The Happy Valley Racecourse definitely caters more to ex-pats and tourists than locals and serious gamblers. Very fun night out! and the skyline surrounding the Racecourse is something only Hong Kong would provide....

Bit scruffy but what an atmosphere. Used a tram to get therel next to jockey club. Note taxi drivers do not want to know getting there but plentiful coming out. Fantastic atmosphere, tourists pay 10 dollars to get in. Food drink plentiful, place a bit tired but atmosphere great especially under floodlight.

Great night. What a great night out if in Hong Kong on a Wednesday don't miss it. For $10HK (you can use Octopus card) you can spend a very pleasant evening at the racers. If you would like to place a bet there are plenty of people to show you how. The food was reasonably priced and tasty. The atmosphere is fantastic. A definite highlight of our HK holiday

A different expereince. We did the tourist option in the members, I would not do this again. It did lack a little ambiance. We found a spot on a terrace and watched from there. The night racing with the skyline is beautiful. I would go again

A must for anyone into horseracing. We booked a table in one of the hospitality lounges. The food was served buffet style and was very good. Drinks in the bar were a little pricey but ok. I would definitely recommend a visit if you have the time.

My first Racecourse experience. Oh ! It was absolutely thrilling and lovely. We had a private dining room with super view of the races......awesome food spread. Betted for the first time on horses and didn't win much....but the entire experience was amazing....had a great time.

A must see. If you love horse racing it is obvious. If you like to see a little of local colour and fun, then go. If you just like horses go they are amazing. if you want the top shelf approach, book a suite visit through your concierge, or go to the open stands and see HK up close and personal. Who knows , a chance to win shopping money!

Great night out. Fast paced and very busy and a lot of fun. We bet small amounts and lost it all! A good evenings entertainment but avoid the MacDonalds stall as they don't sell anything remotely edible!

A great Night Out. Spent a Wednesday night at Happy Valley races last week. For $10HK admission price (payable by way of Octupus Card) you gain entry to the main concourse area. There are plenty of bars and food outlets and races every 30 minutes. Betting is pretty easy to catch on to, and if you mess up the ticket there are plenty of customer service representatives to assist. A great night out in Hong Kong

Night Racing in Hong Kong. We arrived in Hong Kong early evening. Our accommodation was a stones throw from Happy Valley and the race meeting was on. We walked across to the Racecourse and paid $10.00 entry fee. It was quite thrilling to see the horses and jockeys under lights. Placing a bet was easy, the ticket sellers being very friendly and helpful. We bought a couple of beers and found a spot in the stand to watch the race. Very exciting! In between races, dancing competitions were held (this would never happen at Royal Randwick!) there was a lot of activity happening all over the course. Unfortunately, it was a rainy evening so we only stayed for three races. However, it was a fund way to spend the evening and I would recommend it.
Just use your octopus card. I was impressed that I could just swipe my octopus card to get into the horse races. Good beer and tables right by the track. A very fun, unexpected detour in my week.
So fun and worth going. I have friends who lived in the area so we spent a lot of time at the HK Football Club and race track. Worth going for the horseracing experience.. in another country.

Take a flyer on the ponies!. Happy Valley Racecourse is pretty much in the middle of downtown Hong Kong and races are held on Wednesday evenings.
