Very high quality racing, great crowds, nice areas for eating/drinking. They had live entertainment the evening we attended as well as a wine tasting tent. Easy to get there by taxi.

Hell of a night!. Happy Valley Racecourse is a Hong Kong Institution, and you can easily understand why. The atmosphere is amazing. A racecourse surrounded by huge stands and massive skyscrapers. Thousands of racegoers, half keen for a punt, and half keen for a good time, make it a heady mix. Grab a jug of beer, and squeeze your way to the rails to watch the horses thunder past. You'll love it.
1st Time to Racecourse. This is the first time for me to go to Happy Valley Racecourse. This is very excited when you see the horse near to terminal point! Everybody is very high.

Great experience. nice window into local culture. The jockey club is an integral part of hong kong, since they are important donors in non-profits, as well as the biggest taxpayers. The economy is perhaps disproportionately dependent on this institution. The atmosphere at the Wednesday night races was bigger than Del Mar (California) but similar to that. Atmosphere was fun and exciting.
Special. Main town CWB with this very nice racecourseQuite, fresh air and feel sooooooo relaxdrink a coffee there, feel your relaxing tea time

Great fun. Make time to go to Happy Valley on a Wednesday night, if you are in Hong Kong, it's a great atmosphere, even if you don't bet, it's still great fun. Can be very very hot inside, so take some cool bottles of water with you.

125th celebrations. We went with a large party celebrating the Hong Kong G C 125th celebrations. We had a private box which initially was hard to find but once in it was a memorable experience. The buffet food was outstanding. Placing a bet was easy and you can watch the races on television or from the large patio outside. Because it was evening it made it all the more exciting!!
good fun wt friends. wanna have some beers on a Wednesday night, head over to the race course in Happy Valley. Racing goes on till late and betting is a must try ;-)

Start of tour. Our chinese highlights tour started here overlooking race course. Love hong kong but been years since visited didn't let me down. We were there when students were having their sit in there was no probs from students other than getting around hong kong took a little bit longer. We did all the sites and had a brilliant time would love to return, we didn't feel let down at all. Took all bus trips and visited all sites had a wonderful time. Would def return.

"Night Out". Great night out at the track, cheap enough to get in can get busy as there was a beer festival on when we went, can recommend leaving before the end as the demand for taxis out weigh the taxis out side, but well worth it for the experience of Happy Valley race track.
Do it.. if you don't like to gamble, consider your losses an entertainment tax. Great atmosphere. Starts slow and gets packed by the last races on Wed night.

Haven't been to the racecourse?. If you spend few days in HK and happen that one of them is Wednesday!! well you can't miss this opportunity, fantastic atmosphere, locals and expats all together, some to have a good time and some just to BET!! yes this is a serious business!!!Why not to put 100 Honkies and pick a horse number, might be your lucky night, I had a really good time during October, they celebrate oktoberfest!!!Enjoy

Racing in Hong Kong. Went on Come Racing Tour to both Happy Valley and Sha Tin. Efficient transfers good food with unlimited alcohol and soft drinks. The table at both race courses gave a great view. The staff provided a fabulous service. Worth going

Go with the masses. The private members grandstand area is fantastic for its view of the track, the food and the service (you can get member's guest tickets if you ask around) but for the best experence join the masses on the flat. Go in shorts and a T-shirt. Enjoy a couple of beers and have a flutter on the horses. Back the Australian jockeys.

Go on the organised tour. Push the boat out and go on an organised trip which includes a buffet meal in the Members restaurant with all drinks included, you also get a high marvrllous view of the floodlit course and surrounding area, as well as a tour of the paddock and winners enclosure. Not a cheap night out but EXCELLENT!
Value. If you are in Hong Kong on a Wednesday evening then go to the Happy Valley Racecourse. Great atmosphere and excellent value for money.
A racy afternoon. This is for those who love racing and all that goes with it. There is a very good museum which gives the history of the sport.
If you spend Wednesday in Hong Kong this is a must!. The atmosphere in the race is amazing and you can bet with small amounts of money! Absolutely a place to visit Wednesday evening!

Out of this world. Perhaps the most extraordinary theatre I'll ever visit. Go at nighttime. The green, the white, the energy, fantastic!This is a racecourse. In the middle of a city. 'In the middle', did I say that?Stand by the rail and look around at the thousands of lit windows in the apartments that surround you. It is quite the most extraordinary thing and quite astonishing.
Fantastic night out. Pay the local rate and go through the local gates to stand by the track ..,.. MUCH better than the hospitality nights

Nuber 1 Must Do Hong Kong experience. This is a must do evening, usually on Wednesday Nights, terrific value, show your passport and get in for $10 (HK) for a fabulous evening, if you want to get away from the crowds and mix with the locals pay $180 (HK) for the balcony view with reserved seat including nice food and soft drinks, tea and coffee and you can still wander back and forth to the main arena

Horse racing in the center of the city. It's worth the trip over to Happy Valley to see the Jockey Club's race track. It's hard to believe in that city of towering skyscrapers a racetrack sits in the middle of all of that. The grounds are well kept, and you can feel the excitment from a city that loves to bet on their horses.

Happy Valley worth the trip. a very different type of evening. Use the public enclosure and be guided By the staff on how to place your bets. We had a maximum spend and ended up a few bucks up! Great night.

Fun night with friends costs $10. Yes, it costs $10 to get in and you can stand next to the race track to cheer for the whole night. Of course you can add on top beer and gamble money ($10 per bet) which also costs minimum.

Great night out. Catch a taxi to Happy Valley and get in the public area trackside near the beer tents. A lot of tourists and ex pats, it is party central. Have a flutter, have a beer, have a great night. To get a taxi away, walk to the Cosmopolitan hotel, they will get you a taxi, that will go under the tunnel if you are staying on Kowloon. Check the Hong Kong Jockey Club website for dates and times. On most Wednesday nights, except for late wet season. A must do highlight in Hong Kong.

Crazy Happy Valley Racecourse. This is racing with a party twist, everyone is here to have fun, dance and be merry, jugs of beer, live bands and party people make for an excellent night out. Entry is only 10HK$, you will need a ten dollar coin or scan your Metro Octopus card to get through the turnstiles. The racing is great fun, bets are easy to place and the atmosphere is great, some dress up, hen nights in fancy dress is common and many come straight from work in their suits but its hot so don't wear too much! Air conditioning inside is bliss but the toilets are not fancy or big, and after a while not particularly clean either. You can grab a hot dog trackside or visit the cafes and bars inside. Plan ahead as its location is in a busy part of Hong Kong and timing on a Wednesday night makes it hard to get to in a hurry, several trams stop nearby and the Metro is a short walk. Taxi's are perfect on a hot night as they are air conditioned but leave plenty of time as you will no doubt be stuck in traffic. There are many themed nights throughout the season but as it gets too hot for the horses the racing stops, usually around late June. You can still visit HV for a great night out but sadly no racing.
Fun and casual !. If you want to spend good time with your friends drinking beers and gambling, you should go there wednesday night ! I promise you it will be amazing and fun !

Excellent. Wonderful atmosphere and well worth going. We took MTR to Causeway Bay, Exit A, and followed signpost. Can use the travel Octopus card at the turnstiles to get in (HK$10). Plenty of food and drink stalls. Check website for race nights. Chinese commentary at far end and English nearer the turnstiles.

Good fun and cheaper than expected.. I have never been to the races before, but this was a very fun and informal night. Only $10HKD to get in and even if you don't back the winner, there is a great atmosphere and the track is worth seeing for itself anyway.

HK Jockey Club. Stayed at the Jockey Club for several days while in HK. Nice rooms. Ate at the buffet for breakfast - very nice - they had both Western and Chinese items provided; so I went for all the Chinese food since I can get Western breakfast food anytime at home. It was very delicious. Then went to the racetrack for about an hour before going for a tour of HK. Nice facilities.
Don't like racing but enjoyed myself here. There is so much energy that it is contagious I had been away from English speakers for a while so this was nice to be with foreigners.

Fun night out . We went as part of an organised trip by the hostel we are staying at, and I am glad we did! It's the first time I have been to a racecourse, this one was set in a beautiful spot. The grandstand overlooks a residential area of sky scrapers so you can take in the view between races. At 10hkd to get in (about £1), it's a bargain night out as you only have to place 10hkd bets, if you bet at all! Great group night out, I'd thoroughly recommend it.

Happy Valley - Happy Wednesdays. Not a racing fan, but we went for the fun of it on WEdnesday evening as we were told entry was 10HKD (£1!) Actually we were let in for free as it was later in the evening. It was very busy - thousands of folks there, but good entertainment between races. Food a bit pricey. Fun evening.

What a blast! Fun activity for a change of pace.. Huge racetrack. Full, lively crowd during week of Chinese New Year. Entertainment, beer tents, concessions with limited food items. $10 Hong Kong admission (octopus pass can be used for entry fee). Early in evening very lively atmosphere, largely attended by Westerners. As the night goes on the place morphs into a night club vibe. Cheap night out! Fun on a nice evening to be outdoors.

Smokers' paradise. We paid for entry to the members area, then found that we were limited in where we could go. Anywhere you could see the races was just a fog of cigarette smoke. Make no mistake, this is a place for serious gamblers and it appears to be compulsory to smoke as well. The place is certainly spectacular, and a night at the races there is certainly an interesting night. But for me the whole thing was ruined by the stink of the ever present fog of cigarette smoke.

Have a punt. Surrounded by tall residential buildings, it creates an amazing atmosphere.
Great fun and only HKD 10 (less than a pound) for entry. Races every Wed night except in Summer.
A good night out for all and doesn't have the uptight feel most race courses do.

Great fun. This was great fun, we got the tram there and back ,it's floodlit and only £10 to get in. What an atmosphere ! There's bars and music between the races and they parade the horses round before the races . It's a real fun night not to be missed .
Good fun. Have a very good night, spending a bit of money and drinking beer :-) It cost only 10 $ to get in and the atmosphere is very friendly. My advise , bet on the horse with a name you like

A racecourse like no other. (Happy Valley, Wednesday's, 3 times a month, no races during summer)Located in the middle of skyscrappers, the view is just unbelievableThe ambiance is really great, not uptight at all, accessible to anyoneYou will drink your pint while admiring the horses and be able to bet starting at 1eur!The crowd is a melting pot of hk citizens: local and foreignersLove it
Even if you dont like Horse racing. Wednesday night at Happy Valley is wonderful. Amazing stands, amazing views and great entertainment. And yes there is horse racing as well.

Best part of Happy valley. My first time at a race course. Very good experience. There are some models of white horse which are very finely done. One place not to miss, if you are staying in Happy valley.

HAPPY VALLEY. Happy Valley. Excellent package including transport, fantastic food and drinks and top viewing area at the track. Visit Happy Valley on their Wednesday night card. Great entertainment along with great racing in a great location, atmosphere was brilliant.

Go there !. While we are not racegoers this is a must, the atmosphere is electric, we went on an organised tour, everything was catered for, transport, admission, private function room, food and beverages, don't miss it and while you are there listen to the HK Jockey Club "concierges" who host people in the room. They will steer you to a winner in betting field !

Racing with a difference. This is one of the best bargains for an evening out you can find. only $10 entry to this fun and exciting evening event is a most enjoyable way to share an evening with friends

Best race meeting ever. We have been to the Melbourne Cup, Caulfield Cup and just about every major racetrack in Australia but nothing prepared us for Happy Valley.Excellent package including transport, fantastic food and drinks and top viewing area at the track.Hubbies birthday a few days earlier and someone told Management so out came a cake and a room full of strangers singing Happy Birthday and a husband who had the best birthday celebration ever. Going again this year and would recommend the night to anyone even if you do not have a bet, the food alone is worth the trip, all booked through the Hotel (Grand Kowlooon).
Stunning racecourse in the heart of Hong Kong. If you can, visit Happy Valley on their Wednesday night card. Great entertainment along with great racing in a great location, atmosphere was brilliant.
fun atmosphere. Even if you don't enjoy horseracing, the atmosphere is fun and upbeat. It's also a fun place to meet new people or hang out with your friends!

Go even if you don't like horse racing!. This is such a spectacle: a race course downtown! It's only £1 (approx 11HK$) to enter: drink and food is cheap and cheerful; the races are exciting (you can stand right next to the track) and the atmosphere is great!

Another way to experience Happy Valley. Many people know Happy Valley Racecourse of its gambling excitement. I would like to introduce another way of experiencing it. A night time tram ride to Happy Valley Racecourse, it brings you to travel to another dimension of the city.Take the ride after 9:00 p.m. when the tram is no more mass public transportation but a tourist transport. Tram is Hong Kong traditional transport. It allows you riding with fresh air, trees are along the side of Wong Nai Chung Road. If you are lucky enough, the tram stops at the Broadwood Road station, you can have a glance of the St Margaret Mary's Catholic Church on the left hand side on a hill slope. And there is less traffic during night time, you can feel the speed and shaky of riding on a tram. It is so much fun and relaxing.It costs HK$2.3 for a tram ride. No matter you take the eastward tram or westward tram, you can get on a tram with Happy Valley as terminus.

Great night out!!. Really a place to visit if you ever visit Hong Kong. With races almost every Wednesday during racing season. Quite a crowd in the stadium but not too much. Betting starts at 20HKD and pitchers of 2l beer are around 150/170HKD.We had 1 of our best nights here! Come on time though, the regular entrance is a bit of a walk from the metro.

Fun night out. A visit to Happy Valley is a fun night out in HK. It wasn't too crowded, we got great seats to view a few races in the Stand & also to stand right next to the track. Even got a high five from the winning jockey on his way back for weigh in!
I'll Be Back!!. Most fun you can have with your clothes on, the size off the grandstand is wild,live music check it out every Wednesday night

A great night out. Whilst I am a racing fan anyway, I would strongly recommend this to any visitor with an evening spare. There is no other race track like it that I know of, with the Hong Kong skyline surrounding it and the biggest stand I have seen. Options for snacks or a sit down meal and well managed tills with helpful staff so you can have a little flutter.And all for just 10 HKD ... £1 .... 1.50USD !

a must do. don't even think twice....this is a must do night out when in HK. Occurs just about every wednesday night, and always a great way to catch up with friends or work colleagues. Just do general admission and park yourself by the Heineken tent.
Fantastic atmosphere. Huge crowds, good cheap local food, amazing atmos, a few winning bets, would and will go back every year if they let me!

Hard to access...but part of HK life. Like so much in HK it was really difficult to access. Numerous crossings and an underpass required.....but worth the effort. Only HK$10 entrance. A real spectacle of HK life. Food and drink expensive. The racing begins at about 7.15 pm most (but not all) Wednesdays.

If you like races. The Chinese are known to be great gamblers and you will see it happening here at this old iconic race course . Its a beautiful course and well maintained . Many international jockeys working here and races are run regularly.

A great night out. We found Happy Valley an easy track to get to. It is like a football stadium it is so big. We had to just about circumnavigate the outside of the building from our tram stop to get to our door entrance it is so big. We enjoyed a buffet dinner at one of the boxes and although it wasn't on the winning post line we could see well enough. We enjoyed the food at the buffet which inlcuded a huge Australian beef that was replaced many times, vegetables, soups, curry, rice, fish and the usual other buffet foods. Wines were from Chile and they served a lovely white wine. Lots of smokers outside though.

Horse racing in Hong Kong. Of course there are area's for those that are club members etc, but so many seats are available to watch the race. We sat near the start of the race and we were able to see them bringing out each horse. Several food area's to buy, several drinks both alcoholic and non alcoholic.

Fun way to experience HK culture. Hong Kong locals love horse-racing, so this is a great way to experience something that they enjoy doing often. Also, the Jockey Club is a huge organization that sponsors many events, buildings and foundations throughout HK, so it's interesting to see the home base for this organization.

A must do . We really enjoyed our evening at happy valley. We paid the $10 tourist entry although 7th floor was closed and we paid the additional $20 for seats in the stand on 2nd floor. The seats were good plenty of room and lots to see but we preferred being along side the paddock and track. Real mixture of people but a very relaxed and fun atmosphere would definitely go back . Loved it although nothing like races in UK.

Great Night Out. As a racing fan I was keen to see racing in HK. We booked a Tourist Package including Buffet/Drinks/Tour of track. Everything was absolutely first class. Food was outstanding. Great atmosphere and a night out not to be missed even for non racing people.

Great fun. Wow, blown away by this experience. wine tastings, gourmet food, cheap bets and a very busy wednesday eevning complete with horse racing and live entertainment. Happy valley is now on my HK must visit, especially the wednesday night fun nights.
Surprise!. I felt a light mood looking down from a high rise office window into the valley. It is a surprise recreational feature in the middle of a heavy business traffic area.
Festive. Off grid for the usual tourists. Lan Kwai Fong with horses. Total evening enjoyment. Only on Wednesdays. Walk back to Causeway bay is a bit tiring though, especially after a couple of beers.

Glad I went, wouldn't bother again!. Well if you like a bet it's great - more of a fair like atmosphere than what you expect at a UK flat race meeting. It was very noisy and very busy and as someone who goes racing to see the horses rather than have a bet it wasn't really for me - races are on an oval track, under bright spotlights at night and how the horses deal with the noise is amazing. Had a good night as went with friends who live in HK but doubt I'd bother again - it was though, very cheap to get in - think it was 1HK$!

Just for fun. Even if you are not fanatic about horse racing, this event is really fun to attend. It only costs 10 HKD to get in and you can bet small amounts or just enjoy a beer or two and watch the "circus" (sorry race lovers for this expression).

Far East trip. What a great night out,we were entertained by our local agents and had a great night, we did win on the horses which made in better.If you visit Hong Kong ,it is really worth a visit,but it's only Wednesday night and worth booking a meal there, your hotel will be able to arrange it.

Amazing Experience!. Great place to go on a Wednesday night especially as a tourist. Does not feel like you are at the races at all. From the first race to the last its a real party vibe, Dj's or bands on stage in the public area, cheap drinks and everyone is there to have fun. Only $5 Hong Kong entry which is cheap for a night out, catch the happy valley tram straight there from town. Will Not Disappoint!

Brilliant evening out!!. This is such a fun evening out at the races! Lots of beer and wine available as well as a few fast food restaurants to grab a burger and chips from.It's a really sociable place, and everyone is there to have a good time. Definitely take some money to place bets. I'm not big on betting so I only put small amounts on, but it makes the races so much more exciting!It was a little chilly in the evening so definitely wrap up warm around this time of year.I'm really pleased we decided to go to Happy Valley. I'll go again next time I'm in Hong Kong!

Racing in Hong Kong. I have always heard that Happy Valley is one of the most exciting horse race locations in the world and let me tell you, it didnt disappoint.The grandstand looks almost like a 10 storey building and as it is house right on the track, every seat has a great view and vantage point.I booked through Splendid Tours who did a great job and I would recommend them. The tour may not be that cheap at about AUD100 but that included transport to and from, a buffet meal plus as many drinks as you would like (beer, wine etc) plus a great seat. It also included tuition as to how to bet there which you will need. Then the fun starts and trust me, it is so much fun.Do it!!!
Madness every Wednesday. A lot of fun and watching the horses race is only a tiny part of it. Order pitches of beer and immerse yourself in the surrounding entertainment.
Not a Happy visit. I'm not a racing fan but had to give it a whirl. Food in the public enclosure is awful and smokers everywhere. Left early!

Great night out!!. We went on a Wednesday night and had a brilliant time. No need to know anything about the horses in advance - there are plenty of free papers around with hints and tips. The staff are very used to tourists and experts at checking they are placing the bets you wanted. We sat in the beer garden section for most of the night, placing low value bets, drinking cold beers and people watching. A great evening out which I would highly recommend to anyone in the area on a Wednesday. We paid for the tourist pass but really I wouldn't bother. We may have missed something but we couldn't see what extra you got for it. You can sit in the end section but when we got there most of the seats there were taken. Other than that I don't see any benifit - the end section is also further from the bars and food stalls.

A must do when in HK. The best night we had in Hong Kong was spent at Happy Valley. This isn't the usual horse racing we have experienced before. It was a party atmosphere. Music playing, bands, lots of people and what a fabulous atmosphere. It is very easily located on HK Island. We caught the Double Tram right to the track and what a great atmosphere that was also. Totally crowded with every one going to the track. Its is incredible cheap to get in and you can even use your Oyster card. Betting isn't hard to get the hang of and drink and food is cheap. Beer is sold on plastic jugs. The location is incredible with so many high rise buildings overlook the track. For a fabulous experience even if you don't follow the horses, don't go past a great night, cheap and great atmosphere at Happy Valley.

Cheap, Awesome, Fun. for just HKD10, you can access the grounds of Happy Valley on Wednesdays. It is now so rare to see a race held in the middle of the city, surrounded by high-rises. Go around around 8 pm, when the younger office-worker crowd from these offices come to party out. Go earlier if you want shorter lines to bet on horses though as there will only mostly older Chinese gamblers. Food is cheap. Beer is cheap.

Can't bring myself to enjoy this display of animal abuse. While the racecourse is a popular place for a night of entertainment, it's oft overlooked how damaging this sport is for the horses themselves. Horse racing is inhumane, and no matter how many beer stands are erected, it's simply not fun to watch the mistreatment of sentient creatures. Thumbs down.

Must Do Tourist Attraction. Wednesday Night Races at Happy Valley is one of only a few "Must Do" tourist experiences - the others being the Star Ferry and Tsim Sha Tsui promenade at night (although not for the music and light show). Depending upon the time of the year and nightly theme the rowdiness and crowds can vary (opening nights for Oktoberfest are out of control). This is were many expats go to unwound during mid-week and in some ways you may even forget you are in an Asian city. The Tai Hing skyline offers the best sports stadium backdrop in the world - on par with baseball stadiums in Pittsburgh and San Francisco. Entry is $10HKD - use an Octopus card - and beers start at $40HKD. Food is also reasonably priced by Hong Kong standards. The entrance is one the southwest corner - and if you want to complete the Hong Kong experience, pick up a tram near Times Square and ride to the racecourse in style.

Horses for courses. There cannot be a more stunning race track in the world. Happy Valley is surrounded by many of Hong Kong's 7000 skyscrapers. The Chinese love their gambling so the atmosphere is electric!
So fun!. What a great way to spend a Wednesday evening. For HKD10, you are admitted into the race course. Minimum bet is HKD10 and there are seven races. What a deal!

Amazing night out. We went on a Grayline tour to Happy Valley and had the best night out. We were picked up by coach and taken straight there. We had our own function room, about 30 people all up and our own tab facilities. We also had our own balcony to watch each race. The race caller was English which helped. On this tour there was a continuous buffet with great food, sweets were amazing. Drinks were also free flowing, good Sav Blanc and my husband had a choice of a few different beers. After the 5th race we were taken downstairs (optional) to go to the marshalling yard and then watched the race in front of the winning post. We then visited the souvenir desk to purchase momentos - hats, ties etc. the trip does leave before the last race but we elected to stay, keep drinking and watched the last race home. You then have to find your own way home but the mtr is right there. We were placed on a table with two English couples and had the best night. Recommend spending the money and doing it in style, you won't forget it!

Great night out; wonderful atmosphere. A visit to Hong Kong isn't complete without a visit to Happy Valley. Races are held every Wednesday evening; entrance fee is HK$10. The public viewing area goes right up to the fence so you can get very close up to the action.Easy to find and very centrally located. The racecourse is surrounded by the high rise buildings which in the evening provides a spectacular backdrop.The atmosphere is incredible and you don't need to be a racing fan to enjoy the experience.Great fun and well worth a visit.

Great Fun, Wonderful Atmosphere. We spent an evening at Happy Valley on my husband's birthday. We just got the HKD$10 tickets (about 80p) and saved the rest of our money betting on the horses and on rubbish beer! Don't expect anything fancy in the cheap bit, but there's pretty cheap beer and you can stand right at the fence when the horses come past. I'm not a big gambler, but the atmosphere and also figuring out what on earth a Quinella bet is make this such a great evening out. Races start at about 7:30 and go on until about 11 most Wednesday nights through the winter.

An evening at the races. Within an hour of arriving at our hotel we headed off in a taxi to the racecourse - stunning location, great atmosphere and admission to the public area of the track cost about £1 - I ma not a racing fan but the evening out was worth it - a must in my opinion!

Great Night of Fun. Arrived in Hong Kong from a flight to NY and needed to go out (it was only 7pm and I needed to force myself to stay awake a few more hours). There is an admission fee (I think $20 HKD) and the minimum bet on any horse/race is $10 HKD. My friends and I stood right at the fence watching the horses run by and indulged in big cups of beer and snacks. We spent about 2 hours and maybe $10 USD. We wound up winning $0, but walked away with a lifetime of fun memories and excitement.I think the track is only open on Wednesdays and the weekend, so it's best to check before heading over. Really fun atmosphere and a great way to spend an evening with friends.

Fabulous Place. What a way to spend a couple of hours on a wednesday evening (from 7.30pm) does not matter whether you like racing or not this is an amazing location with a skyscraper backdrop. Real cheap to get in (£1) many bars and a stage with entertainment and of course regular races. Bets are easy and available fro HK$20 so not going to break the bank.

Great night at the races. We had a great night out at the races in December. It's free in on big race nights and the booze is much cheaper than central HK. There was live music and the place was hopping with people. Def worth a trip!
Surreal experience in the middle of a city. Well worth a trip if you like the races, it's quite a rowdy place with lots of drinking but a fun evening if you have time while in Hong Kong.
Happy Wednesday. Great night at the racecourse. Only HK$10 entry fee and then a very enjoyable night of races. Very reasonably priced food and beer.

Another world in your backyard. Happy Valley has to be one of the most enigmatic race courses in the world. Its located in the middle of town, easy and quick (depending on traffic) to get to by public transport or taxi, and extremely pretty especially with its night racing. If you are a visitor to HK you can buy a tourist members badge (take your passport as proof) from the local "tab" or at the bottom of the members stand on course and also pre-book seats and a meal on the terrace near the winning post. Check the web sites for this and Sha Tin and book in advance is my tip. Also get a lesson on filling in the tote tickets, its different to Australia but easy to learn once you are shown. An absolute must for the racing enthusiast.

A must!. If you are in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night Happy Valley is the place to be even if you are not usually a race goer. It is great fun and casual so don't worry if you have not packed your best racing outfit. It is easy to get to and not expensive.

An evening of fun and excitement. Happy Valley racecourse is a must for us each time we visit Hong Kong [if the racing is on naturally!]. Its setting is magical - the course is surrounded by skyscrapers and at night could rival Disney - the atmosphere is great, and the evening is one not to be missed. The area is small enough that you can get close and watch the horses parade before the race ['that's the one I'm going to back, I'm sure it just winked at me!'], and then you can move across and be on the rails for the actual events.and see the whole thing both actually and on the big screen showing the parts of the track that you cannot see. Mind you it is almost as much fun to watch the people watching the races!!! It is very cheap to get in - unless you want to get up into the boxes [which I dont recommend, the fun is on the ground!], and bets can be small. You can get both food and drink - we've never tried the former we're always too busy, but we do buy pitchers of lager to share - often necessary because of the amount of encouragement shouted to your runner!! We wouldn't miss it - it is an evening of fun and excitement - we've never come away richer [perhaps that horse just had a twitch!!] but that's not why we go.Do watch out for the fact that the area surrounding the area is more or less gridlocked before an event so allow plenty of time to get there and get in, and it isn't always easy to get away after the event - the trams do line up outside the course and it is worth thinking of taking one of them - just to get away from the area if they are not going your way!

Prosperous Place after a fire. The present Happy Valley Race Course was built after the disasterous fire which claimed over 600 lives in the year 1918. The racing track is narrow.The maximum no. of starter in each race is limited to 12 as compared to 14 in Shatin. Most of the night races are held here. People coming to this race course may not come for betting. They come to join the party held in the Beer Garden. Many F & B outlets are opened to public as well as to members and their guests. There is a Horse Racing Museum open for Racing love fans to re-call their memory. Edward CHAN inHongkong

Not impressed. We were looking forward to the Happy Valley "Happy Wednesdays" but we just couldn't get into the spirit of things. The place was absolutely heaving, packed with large groups of ex-pats chugging down Carlsberg and chowing down on hot dogs. Despite the huge crowds, live entertainment and horse racing the atmosphere was hollow and we were itching to leave after 45 minutes.The course itself is lovely, tucked right in the middle of a collection of skyscrapers which loom over the track. The beer was dire and we didn't try the food. Maybe if we'd come as a large group rather than just the two of us we may have had more fun.

Great night at the races. Had such a great night at Happy Valley. Got a cab from our hotel in Mongkok to the racecourse which cost about £10 and then got a tourist ticket from the membership enclosure for about £10. The tourist ticket gets you right next to the paddock so you can see the horses close up. There is plenty to eat and drink there and overall a great atmosphere. The betting slips are a little different to ours, more like a lottery ticket, but the staff are helpful and will explain. Well worth going. The first race was about 7pm but would advise to get there early as the traffic gets very busy in that area.

Wednesday Night at the Horse Races. Another great adventure in Hong Kong. Attending the Wednesday night races at Happy Valley is people watching at its best. The atmosphere is like a carnival with many people coming here to let off some stream after long hours at work. There is gambling on the various races (many taking gambling very serious with $millions of dollars on the line), lots of beer by the glass or 2 litre jugs, various foods (some of the longest hot dogs I have ever seen). The viewing and excitement is along the track (there are stand up tables connected to the fence). After each race there is a crew fixing the grass track divots caused by the horses.

Happy Valley Racecourse - Can't wait to go back. If you enjoy horse racing then you must go to Happy Valley Racecourse in Hong Kong. It's one of the most famous racing venues in the world. Easy to get to if your on Hong Kong Island side. If you are travelling from Kowloon I would suggest arranging transport from your Hotel to ensure you do have transport to and from. The atmosphere and overall scenery is fantastic. Beer was very cheap too. Unless you are extremely difficult to please, you shouldn't be disappointed at all. it's a great night out.

Worth the visit. Visited for a Wednesday race, the experience is without compare. Follow the arrows for the public entrance and pay 10HKD. There are numerous public transit options including the MTR, Tram, and buses. Prices are typically inflated although not to an egregious degree, the atmosphere is electric, between expats out for a few drinks, serious local betters, tourists, and die-hard fans, all manner of people are there. I would highly recommend visiting for a pint and taking in a few races.

Great night out, . Even if you are not a racing fan, the atmosphere , location and actionable a great night, the tour is good value, meal is not flash but than adequate , guides are very helpful, negatives: for the racing fan there is no tour of the HKJC museum , and the souvenir shop is lacking in good branded items, couldn't even buy a HKJC cap !! Or a tie with logo
Good Night But!!!. Was Better when we went last year as was not so busy and not full of Pretentious Expat Bankers. Well worth a visit.

A great experience, especially if dining. Attended a business function so can't comment on value, but food was fantastic, atmosphere great and the surrounding of the racecourse are just amazing. Not a bad place to have a flutter either
Unmissable!. Terrific atmosphere with frenetic betting, music, beer and brilliantly-lit racecourse. Went on our first evening in HK and loved every minute.

Fun evening out. Def need to give this place a visit whether you gamble or not just for the pure madness of a racecourse in the city. Entrance about a £1 ($10HK), beer reasonable, good atmosphere. Great for people snd City scape watching too.

Happy Wednesday Night Racing. It was 80p to get in, beer was cheap, racing good and the atmosphere amazing! Race Card was free and really easy to understand even if you aren't a normal race-goer. The location is very accessible from Wan Chai where we were staying - about a 10/15min walk. First race is usually around 7.15 and last 11ish. Was a really fun evening

Missed the night races a nice area. We went to the racecourse when Sha Tin had their racing on so in Happy Valley the big TV screens were on so you could still bet and watch the racing. It's a nice area around Happy Valley just to have a walk round and watch the sport that is being played.

An exciting evening out. We paid 10 HK dollars entrance and then paid extra to get seats in the stands. Programmes are provided in both Chinese and English and the staff help out to complete betting slips when needed. The evening we attended, there were 8 races with live music in between. There are plenty of places to buy food and drinks. The race meeting finished at 11.00 p.m. and trams were waiting outside to transport people home or to their hotels.

such great fun! - a fantastic night out on Wednesday!. go go go! My word this place is so incredibly under rated its not even funny. Watch the races as live bands play and with a massive beer garden you'll have so much to keep you entertained. and then a short little walk will take you to lang kwai fong so all in all you're in for a great night out!

Fantastic experience. You can't leave HK without going to the races. This is on Wednesday evening, and the atmosphere and the crowd is really happening. You can bet small (I bet around HK$50 per bet) but I see people taking out thousands on the wagers. Didn't win anything, but overall it was a real HK experience. Highly recommended!

Wednesday night at the races!. An awesome night out in the middle of the week! A fantastic location in the middle of this bustling city, inexpensive entry fee (use your Octopus card!) and a fun crowd. And you might win a little too!

Great Fun. Wednesday night is race night in HK. No problems finding the way as it seemed half the city was walking to Happy Valley.Walk up past the stadium grandstands to the public entrance and for just HK$10 you’re in. This gives you access to most of the trackside enclosure, even all the way to the parade ring.Betting is all TOTE style = no bookies, they have information desks where staff were explaining how to bet and the different bet types on offer.There were 12 races the night we were there so every 30 minutes – plenty of chances to win or lose.Busy when we arrived, it got progressivily busier as the evening went on, so if you want a seat in the stand you need to park yourself early and keep a spot.Food here is burger joint standard and the bars are all about pitchers of beer. Most of the people seemed more interested in each other and drinking than the racing.It was Oktoberfest season – so lots of German beers & Sauerkaut plus a not very German band on offer.It’s strange being under huge floodlights partying, whilst all around are tower blocks of hotels and apartments with pepple getting on with their normal evenings.We thoroughly enjoyed the evening and I recommend it - treat this as a must do if you are in HK midweek.

One of Hong Kong's famous thing to do. Horse racing is one of HK's famous sports and activities in the community. Though horse racing is not unique in this world but to HK it could be said as a tradition here. In order countries horse racing is more like a sports but in HK its a gamble. To HKer, horse racing day is a day for them to relief their stresses from work, people enjoying the moment to call out the horse number they bet on, you can only see this in the course. Entry fee is free! Test your luck by making some bet!Racing season is from Sep to Jul next year and summer break in Aug. Two races per week and Happy Valley race day always on Wednesday night. Yep! HK has two race courses where the other one locates at Shatin.As a local HKer, I do encourage visitors to see this place and try their luck see if they can win a free dinner... or a free trip! Good Luck!(Note: age under 18 is not allow to enter so if you have kids you'd better settle them down)
great fun. you can go for very cheap and enjoy the hustle and bustle and excitement of the races or dine expensively and see the elite of hong kong

Race night in Hong Kong. The Happy Valley race track is definitely not to be missed, if you are fortunate enough to be in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night. The locals definitely like their betting and gambling, this is serious stuff. Surrounded by high rise buildings, the atmosphere is absolutely amazing. Betting is not expensive either, so it's a fun evening that doesn't cost much.

Go there on a racing day!!. Walk in is free on racing day (ask the staff about the time for free entry), enjoy a beer, feel the atmosphere, it's quite fun to hang out there with friends! Even on a hot summer day!
THE place to be on wednesday night in HK!!!!. The atmosphere is incredible. Let's bet for 1 euro (minimal) and enjoy your night with a good beer and a hot dog.

Super fun experience in the heart of the city. It just happened to be Oktoberfest and on this Wednesday, we immersed ourselves with the locals and expats to enjoy beer and horse racing in the Bier Garten right by the track. Everyone knows the backdrop of this race course is phenomenal (you definitely won't forget you're in Hong Kong), the grand stand is a work of art, and the crowds' passion is contagious. If you take the Happy Valley trams, you can get off right at the public entrance; however, you may also walk from Times Square (about a 10-15 minute walk) or Wanchai. I have tried the tourist admission before and it was definitely a better experience (as in more abundant restrooms, food choices, etc.), however since we were meeting with some locals, we just went straight authentic this time. We got there early to get a spot right in front of the billboards by the fences with the shelves to set for our food and drinks on. Getting up close to feel like you can reach the horses when they go by with their trainers is a wonderful feeling! However, if you snooze you definitely have to fight crowds and deal with not being able to secure your beverages or foods in a comfortable manner. There is beverages and foods galore, all for HK $10 - go for the betting or just go to be there! Just remember, later in the night when more foods and beverages are consumed by the crowds, there are not many restrooms available versus the amount of attendees, so get in line early!!I didn't bet, however my fiance did in the beginning; by the 6th race he said that the inside was like a mad house and the lines were crazy, so he just enjoyed the horses racing by. There were 8th races and it can get to be a very late night, so wear good shoes and comfortable clothes; no bulky bags because there is not a lot of space when the crowds start piling up...In general, you have to go and experience Happy Valley when you're in Hong Kong; it's a very unique experience!

Closed at the moment. Disappointed to find that Happy Valley has been closed for some improvements so check before going. I think it will open before the end of the year - but check. Ha Tim is still open and well worth a visit also.

Horse Racing and Good Food. What more can you ask for; taking in live horse racing/betting and being able to indulge in quality Chinese food served to your table! Every Wednesday and Sunday, they have horse racing and you can eat in their Chinese restaurant while watching the races. Great experience!

Very Interesting Race Course. Visiting Happy Valley is quite interesting from the amazing amount of traffic getting there to the excitement of watching the horses race the wrong way (counter clockwise) and the frenetic pace of the betting crowd.A bit difficult to get used to the betting procedure but once you make the mental calculation of HK dollars to U.S. dollars all you have to do is pick the right horse (very difficult for me).A good time was had by all.

Amazing experience. Happy Valley is so surreal. As you enter the arena the 10 story grandstand towers above. Surrounded by buildings it is picture perfect of a night time. Very busy for a Wednesday night. If you visit the Hong Kong Jockey Club with your passport you can purchase a tourist card for about $130HK which is about $23AUS which allows you into the members section which is not as busy as general when wanting to place bets. Placing bets is easy when you get the hang of it. Very similar to filling out tab tickets back home. The crowd is amazing and up roaring every race. My partner and I were dressed up as you would at the races in Australia, suit and tie, dress and heels but people dressed like us were very few and far between. Many is shorts and shirt which was a little disappointing. We managed to score a spot right on the finish line which made the experience 10 times better.

Fantastic Night Out! . A visit to the Happy Valley Race Course is a must whilst in Hong Kong.The atmosphere is amazing with such a diverse crowd all having a fantastic time.Entry is just $10 and each bet is a minimum of $20.They have free booklets which explain all you need to know about how to make a bet. A live band was playing the night we attended as the theme was Oktoberfest. I believe the theme changes each week.The food was lovely and there was also a McDonalds in the stadium. A really fun night and fairly inexpensive. You don't have to bet on every race or even at all! Just enjoy the races and the atmosphere.

Great Atmosphere. Previously I have been to Happy Valley in the corporate boxes, but this time we went to the Beer Garden. It cost HK $10 (80 pence) to get in for a great nights entertainment. Plenty of drink and food outlets, and help is a hand if you want a bet on the horses.They also had live bands on between races, so a great night and a great atmosphere.

Sha Tin is better. Booked via the Sheraton for a Sunday afternoon. Around GBP100.00 for the pm was on the dear side and the food isn't anywhere near so good as at Sha Tin.Well-run trip though and in no way actually bad.

A great night out - what a location!. We opted for the tourist badge, and weren't sure if we made a mistake and should have just had the way cheaper general admission. Once inside, we loved the area that we were in - we had the parade ring on one side and were absolutely bang ion the finishing post. The atmosphere was great, the food looked good (didn't try it) and the betting was easy once I picked up the free guide to completing the slips. All in all, a great night and the venue just can't be beaten.
Great Wednesday night out. If you come to HK you cannot leave without going to Happy Valley races on a Wednesday night!Chilled atmosphere (not like dressing up for Ascot) and fun to be had.

Great bet for a Wednesday night. For HK$10 entry and minimum bets of HK$20, you can't really go wrong. Easy to reach, amazing venue under the floodlights, loads of food options and beer. A HK institution and well worth a visit.
Great night out. the box organised by the golf club was excellent with great views of the track. The in house tote made betting easy!

Inexpensive vibrant night out. Very lively, crowded, good humoured.
Lots of young expats having fun and enjoying a drink and snack food.
Races are short and a bit difficult to watch with so much going on all around.
High spirits, easy to place a bet, more difficult to pick a winner.
Super way to have a night out

A great night awaits.. Even if your not a horse racing person the night and setting in middle of Hong Kong is great. Well worth a visit to just see the action in the middle of Hong kong. Catch a ding dong tram to get there and enjoy the night.
Great night out. Could not believe that this race course right in centre of Hong Kong we had a great night and I even won on a race . Which was easy to place bets they help you at counter great staff

Must do. This is a great way to enjoy an evening in Hong Kong. Horse racing, lots of people, betting and food. If haven't ever been to the races, do it once. You can be right on the track if you want, or go all the way in the stands or get fancy seating inside the restaurant.

Always interesting to Americans as horses race counterclockwise. Bring money and good luck!! Venue is clean and safe. A little hard to get to due to Occupy HK kids but plan accordingly. Many food opportunities - tried several and all were good.
A Colourful Spectacle. Brilliant fun on the first day of the racing season. Great atmosphere, amazing track surrounded by high rise buildings give the place a surreal buzz.
The race is on!. Great course at night, the size of the grandstand is mindblowing, biggest Ive ever seen. quick service for food and drink and bets

Friday networking. perfect place to do some networking on Fridays
More an opportunity to meet people rather than enjoying the race

Fun & Entertaining. Loved the atmosphere, was taken to VIP area and it is nice and comfortable. The buffet is affordable ~$40 CAD and delicious with a variety of options. By the time you place your bet, you have enough time to watch the race and cash out whenever you want. Efficient staff.

Great to see even if there were no actual horses there when I went. We saw the lights on Wednesday night but I was surprised there was no fee to get in. Turns out that they were just showing racing on the big screen. Not sure why as normally meetings are on Wednesday. Anyway...I was able to see the course surrounded by the Hong Kong buildings which is spectacular.

"A Gem in the middle of the city". I have been to many Racecourses and this by far is the biggest, cleanest that I have seen it. It has a tennis course, soccor field and more in the center. Our friend too us here and we were amazed that minutes before we were in between high rises and suddenly this HUGE Racecourse! It was so much fun, a definite must see!

No kids allowed!! Disappointed!!. In Australia we can take kids to the races!! We have a 19 and 14 year old and we were so excited to go to Happy Valley. Got frocked up and ventured in a taxi (20 mins each way) only to be turned away as no kids allowed!! Guttered!! Absolutely ridiculous.

superb view of the course. did my usual male thing while the girl,s did ther thing took the ferry across to mainland and went to h/valley to do some shopping for my friends,if you are into horse racing they have a great souvenier shop on the 2nd floor check o/hours but well worth the trip giddy-up.
So much fun!. Unbelievable experience, beautiful location, thriving atmosphere, food, drinks, live music, and gorgeous weather. Absolutely LOVED it! It is a must for any traveller to HK.
Amazing - horses in the sky. See it - don't miss it. Unbelievable views and the beauty of the race course and enthusiasm of all the punters.

Must do on a Wednesday Night. Have been there a couple of times just because I found the atmosphere there unique.With Hong Kong being really dense everywhere the Racecourse seems to be incredibly big within all these skyscrapers surrounding it.Cheap entrance (with Octopus card or with buying a token right in front of the entrance) and great fun there. Minimum bet is 20 HKD - and I even found a guy who explained aaaaall the different options on how to set your bet. Insider: you're able to go all the way to the top of the building without paying extra (just take the elevator all the way up) - great view and most of the time not a lot of people there.

Great fun - and you can win money!. Each Wednesday evening the centre of Hong Kong (Causeway Bay) becomes packed with the crowds wanting to enjoy Happy Valley. The location is amazing - so much space in the centre of Hong Kong. The stands are easy and cheap and have a great atmosphere - though the food available is poor. My favourite is the Stable End Terrace - where you can get for a reasonable fixed price, all you can eat and drink, with great views over the course. If you are lucky - you might even win!
Ponies. Very fun and cheap start to the night.Go for the general admission and stand by the rail with a beer as the horses sprint past.

Great night out - even if you don't bet!. Everybody seems to go to Happy Valley racecourse - even if you've never bet before it was really easy to place your bets, and watch your horse lose! You could stand or sit, easy to get drinks
Get ready for some racing. Who doesn't like a day at the tracks. You get a good seat and a great way to spend the day. Live winning some money then hitting the shops

Best Race night in the world. having been to most race meetings around the world Happy Valley on a Wednesday is the best fun night out you could possible have. crowded busy and amazing atmosphere with thousands in the beer garden doing what most blokes enjoy beer and gambling. you are close to the action with a parade ring wrapping around the members and public area's and you are right on the track being so close you can hear the thunder of hoofs racing by. if you are going to Hong Kong don't miss a night out at Happy Valley
Great fun. As a fair novice, I found the betting system a little hard to fathom but great fun and a great night. I'd go again if in the area
Good outing. We went for the HK Derby race. Was a good outing to see the locals in all their glory. Will do it again.

Great atmosphere and definitely worth a visit. Went here with a local friend and we had the world of fun, bring a paper to get some betting 'tips' take some time to understand the betting and you can have a lot of fun and it doesn't have to cost a fortune. The locals love their betting and are fanatical, fun to watch them.

fun place. great place to go with friends. It kept raining but the atmosphere was awesome. The options for drinks and food are good. Getting there is not a problem at all as the transport facilities are adequet and efficient.

Great atmosphere. A must do in Hong Kong if you are around on a Wednesday. Great atmosphere and setting. As an overseas visitor you can get in for a modest fee by showing your passport which gives you access to members area. I'm sure this is well documented elsewhere.

Packed with atmosphere. Not just about horses, not just about betting, this is a social cross-section of Hong kongers enjoying themselves mid-week. The place buzzes with conversation, live bands, and bright lights. Seeing this stretch of green nestled in between skyscrapers is a must. For those who do enjoy a flurry, note the betting system is in decimal not fractions which can take a bit of getting used to. It's only $10 to get in and the special race night trams will take you there from central and back (all part of the experience). Note food options are limited with McDonald's, and various Asian snacks that we're never intended to be fast food - eat before you go.
Worth a visit.. Hong Kong locals love their betting, and that is why this place still takes up so much space on this tiny island, take a tram to get here it's worth the journey.
A fun night out!. Good people watching, fun experience, chance to meet lots of locals and ex-pats alike. Enjoy a few drinks, some cheap and delicious food and a flutter on the horses.
Happy Valley Races. This was just unlike anything I've experienced in the UK. A hilarious night - definitely go here if you're in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night!

Must be a smokers paradise. I went to the night races which was pretty busy but not as much as I expected as with most race courses lots of hanging around between races. The locals seem to love two things gambling and smoking. Although outdoors the entire evening I stunk of cigarettes when I got home. The air was so thick with smoke it was like a British pub before the smoking ban. I didn't go back a second time as planned because of the smoke.

Happy Wednesday!. Something to do to check out the expat scene. Expect beers, food and betting. Some people take it very seriously but the average punter is going there to socialise. Informal and a great place to meet people. Tip: Leave before the last race around 10.30pm because getting home becomes a pain.

Trick to the Trade!!!. I visited Hong Kong on business and on a Thursday(rare) evening we came to HVR and I was surprised to know that I could do well here. This was my first race course visit ever and what an exciting time it was. We were over 20 people and enjoyed the adrenalin and nerve, whilst most of us started winning 2nd race onwards. The buffet food is international but didn't taste well to my indian palette though I loved the Hagen daz ice cream as dessert. The race mechanism, horses and jockey all seemed great and I learned the trick of the trade pretty quickly. It's about betting low/high on high risk horses and betting fairly on obvious ones. Try it to know it!!!!

good way to spend Wednesday night in H.K. Even if you are not a betting person a visit to the Happy Valley Racecourse is sure to surprise you. Set amongst the sky-scrappers of Hong Kong this racecourse at night, under the floodlights is truely spectacular. We were able to book a table in one of the jockey club restaurants, so enjoyed a lovely meal ,had a spectacular view and even managed to make a small profit.As a slightly different place to see on a Wednesday night in Hong Kong, make it the Happy Valley Racecourse.

Great Entertainment. Cool and different.Local people enjoys like a football match. They thrill and suffer with the victories and defeats of horses and riders. Different from what we are accustomed to see on racetracks. In the intervals between the races, there is a kind of party, fueled by booze and people dancing as if they were in a true night club. Very fun! Worth knowing.

Amazing Night Out. Do it!! You won't regret it,we went on a Thursday night in June and it was an amazing atmosphere,really packed with an incredible location!!General Admin is only $10HK or u can gain admittance by using your Octopus card,so cheap and easy,minimum bet is also $10HK,overall great atmosphere,experience and night out and u may just back a winner!!

great racecourse in the center of Hong Kong!. We went to the racecourse twice on Wednesday nights. It is one of highlights of our Hong Kong trip! The racecourse is located right in the center of Hong Kong, we took old fashioned tram there from central area and it only costs HK$2.3 which is 30 cents in US$. After the race, we took the same tram back to central again with no waiting time because there are many trams lines up to load people. The course is beautiful with high buildings and mountains as the backdrop, with all the lights and night sky, it is amazingly beautiful. Plenty chairs to sit for free or standing drinking a beer. Few beer stands, price is bit high, but you can bring your own beer or food or whatever in with you, no bag check, no security check!Crowd is interesting to watch also besides betting on horses. Mixed crowd indeed, locals and foreigners, youngsters and elders, all there having good time. It only cost HK$10 to get in to have a great night out in Hong Kong!

FUNNY. I'm not keen of horse races , however I really loved this experience! The racecourse is located in the middle of millions of skyscrapers, the entrance is not expensive and between the competitions we enojoyed some live music and some beers! The atmosphear is really funny!

Go on a Wednesday!. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was a great experience! Very cheap to attend (we went general admission) and you can wear anything there. Horse racing is the only form of gambling in HK and it can get quite busy. The skyline that surrounds the course is great too! Located right in the heart of the city. We caught a cab to and from the venue

Fun place esp. on Wednesday evenings!. Was fun to visit. Tickets are only $10 HKD on Wednesday evenings and free after 9 pm I believe on Wednesdays. Lively atmosphere with drinks and food available inside.
Fun place. We were the only westerners dining in the Jockey Club during a recent race. Loved the entire experience, the great service and the history of the track.

Great atmosphere. I have only seen this on TV, so it was a good opportunity to see it with my eyes. Very convenient transport with the trams stopping right in front of Happy Valley. Make sure you get there early as it gets very crowded after a few races. Lively atmosphere with music and good food.

A Great night out for all!!. The Happy Valley horse races are usually on a Wednesday evening. Even if you don't like horse racing or gambling, the night time floodlit races have a really great atmosphere and can enjoyed by almost everyone.

What a great night out. We love the horses so we have been here a few times. We have done the general admission but also the tourist badge (like a members stand admission) and both are fabulous. We bought some friends this time and they also had a blast. Its a fun carnival atmosphere food is good wine beer and of course the horses and the view You will never see a track like it. A beautiful old track in the middle of all those skyscrapers. Just amazing. Go for fun!

Taylor's Tips for success. Do:1. If you are visiting Hong Kong, bring your passport to the race track and ask around to get a tourist ticket/badge. It will give you access to a section right next to the finish line and a better perspective of the entire place. 2. Check the website before you go to confirm that the races are happening. I happened to go on one of the few "Wednesday" race nights that didn't occur on a Wednesday.3. Dress up a little bit nicer. Wear pants and a collared shirt.Don't:1. Frozen beer. Although the concept of frozen beer is novel, the frozen part on top is just the crappy foam.

Great atmosphere, stunning location. Top quality night out! A MUST DO. Me & my wife attended an evening race afer being recommended so by our friends who said it's not to be missed. We're really into gambling or even Horse racing and were a little dubious at first. How wrong we were, we had one of the best nights our on honeymoon! We opted to go the for the cheaper entrance fee meaning we could stand right in ther thick of the action and the fence. The atmosphere was fantastic, we even had a gamble and won on every race! We don't know a great deal about placing bets but staff were very helpful and the race programme helped us choose which horses to go for. The stadium was brilliant and the backdrop was even better. The track is overlooked by skyscrapers all the way around which made for the atmosphere, especially when lit up at night.We'd say it is a MUST DO in Hong Kong even if you're not into Horse racing or gambling.
Amazing place. A must see place when in Hong Kong breath taking views one of my favourite places in Hong Kong definitely return there
Always a good time.. Spend some leisure time watching the horse racing or during days jog around the track or watch rugby or soccer on the many pitches.
Awesome evening. This was a great evening. Fantastic setting, great atmosphere, lots of beer. And getting so close to the race. Most recommended

A MUST DO when in HK. Went on a wednesday night and it was awesome. Pretty freezing and you dont dress up like you would for races in Australia. I wore jeans, boots and a leather jacket. Similar dress code if you were going out for dinner in winter. The race course is litterly in the middle of the city, so you have these sky scrapers around you while your enjoying yourself at the races. Cost about $1.20 aus to get in (10HK)So efficient with their bars and food there was no wait for drinks and they had live music, dancing and competitions. Putting a bet on was super easy too.The whole grandstand is open to the general public but on your far left the speakers call everything out in chinese/cantoneese (sorry for bad spelling) and the right side where the bands are bars are is all in english. So many expats too so its a great mix of hong kong and western culture.Honestly, it was in my top 5 things i did in HK and ill defiantly go back if im ever in HK again.
Great entertainment value. a great way to spend a Wednesday evening. Inexpensive and a fun way to mix with the locals and see Hong Kong.

Fun night, if crowded. Stayed in Hong Kong with a friend who lives down the road from the rascecourse. It was an excellent evening's entertainment, if a bit crowded and confusing at times. It helps to go with someone who knows what they're doing! Make the most of the offers on beer and enjoy the atmosphere! Good luck betting!

Authentic Hong Kong. This is something everyone travelling to Hong Kong need to see. In the centre of a very busy city a racing ground and a lot of betting. The locals as well as visitors enjoy it a lot!

A good laugh. Brilliant night out, we paid for tourist badge to go in the members area but next time I would just pay the $10 for the beer garden which had a fantastic part atmosphere. All the staff were very friendly and happy to explain how to complete the betting slip. Very easy to get to but a total free for all at the end of the night best leaving before the last race to get a taxi.
Night at the races. Great service and food - we dined in a function room where all the food and drink were included. Even managed to not lose! Fantastic night out.

You either win or loose...... Great night out, very centrally located and have a great beet tent. Tourists can get a members ticket by showing their passport and paying $50 HK . You can eat and bet and have fun and race under the light. The racecourse is very easy accessible by public transport and The Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay is a 5 minute walk.

Fun! Highlight of our trip!. Arrived at 6:30pm - it cost AUS$2 per person to gain entry at the main gates. Locals, expats and tourists all enjoying a night out. Great food options, attendants on hand to assist with placing bets and seating if you get tired. The only downside was all the smokers. Leave by 10.15pm to avoid long taxi queues.

Happy times at Happy Valley. Going to the Happy Valley racecourse by night is an experience not to be missed. Head out on a Wednesday night and settle in amongst 55,000 fellow punters. Expect torso-sized jugs of beer / vodka red bull / Pimms, after-work suits, track suit pants, terry-towelling hats, earnest form-guide swots, chain smokers, some die-hard punters – and plenty of excitement. The racetrack is lit up, and surrounded by high rise apartment buildings. Full review, and other Hong Kong recommendations, at http://feastplaylove.me/2014/05/21/10-things-hong-kong-part-2/

A MUST!. To get close and personal with the horses and meet the jockeys take your passport and go in through the owners and visitors entrance it's about £10 and there is no queuing. The bar and food are basic but all is clean. This entrance gives access to the paddock and course rail by the home straight and finish line which is such a treat. You need your passport to buy the tickets to the club entrance.
Good food. Clean place,good food relaxed atmosphere good prices for food and drinksYou can drink coffee or alcohol and still have good time

Great night out. This is a must for every visitor to Hong Kong.The entrance is very cheap the food and drink is reasonable, but the horses I backed just would not win for me.The Granstand is amazing and the skyscraper across from it give it the perfect backdrop.Its on every Wednesday night.
Such a Buzz!. Great night mixing with the locals...we took our passports and were able to go to the members stand, you can grab a good cheap meal (around AUS $8.00) it was the highlight of the trip!
Wednesday night. Great entertainment, good takeaway food, friendly atmosphere, minimum bet 10 HK$. Tourists can take their passports and get temporay membership. Good fun just in public admission.

Wednesday night race night. If you're in Hong Kong during racing season, it is worthwhile getting yourself to the Happy Valley race course on a Wednesday evening. Races start around 7pm, and are every 30 minutes, continuing to around 10pm. It is an extremely popular venue with the HK crowd and becomes packed on a wednesday evenings, with many beer tents lined up, sometimes live music bands and of course people trying to put their bets on the horses. It's a very festive venue, and watching the horse racing happening under lights at night, surrounded by high rise buildings is certainly a unique experience.

Good fun. Go here if you can! We went to the beergarden, where you can find relatively cheap beer while enjoying the races. Betting seems complicated but it's actually quite simple. Just fill out the small papers, hand them in at the counter and if you win, collect your money. You can inspect the horses before they run and it's fun to watch the experienced locals (with lots of newspapers and guidebooks) take this very seriously and really study the horses before they place their bets. The whole stadium is impressive, it is quite big bustling with people. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly and I think this is suitable for the whole family.

Cheap, fun & exciting!. Races every Wednesday, starting around 6PM 'till 11PM, in season (see webpage for current schedule). 10 HKD entrence, dont buy tourist-pass, you want to go with the local crowd! Bets are minimum 20 HKD but can be spread across horses.

Its addictive. We have been in Hong Kong for 5 months now.. and been to the Wednesday races atleast 4-5 times & we aren't done yet. The mood is so lively, upbeat, the music is great & the food is perfect.The best way to enjoy the races is to actually bet (its very simple - you become a member - takes less than 5 mins) & you will not even know when you start taking it seriously. We did it a couple of times & now we are addicted. There is complete information about the jockeys, horses et al.One of the hidden facts about the race course is that has a jogging track open to the public.

Awesome setting. The setting will awe you, a race track bordered by the HK sky scrapers. You need HKD10 coins to get in through the entrance or a nice lady will give you them. The staff are really friendly even though many don't speak English - I wrongly queried my winnings and they were so polite explaining how it worked. Many drink stalls selling beer and wine, but I wouldn't eat here myself. We bought something from a Chinese food place on the second floor and dumped it as did another of my friends.

First time there!. The atmosphere is so electrifying, even if you're not a horse-racing fan! The food is cheap wit good choices and my favourite pastime of people watching was sated watching the full gamit of emotions and fortunes were won and lost! It was only HK$10 to enter too! A great night and will definitely return!

Good night out. This isn't necessarily our thing when at home but we enjoyed the experience and had a few flutters and even a win! Betting is straightforward and the atmosphere and people watching is interesting. We're travelling as backpackers so didn't put any big stakes down but won a few quid still. You can get food at the track and buy booze but if you're saving money take your own. We ended up going two weeks in a row once we'd got into looking at the form of the riders and all that stuff.

When you just want a good excuse to drink beer.... Come to Happy Valley! The name says it all. It's a great place to hang out with friends, whether you're betting on the horses or not. You can get big beers and just chat, laugh, and feel the excitement of the race and all the bets involved!

Bad indulges. On Wednesday when the bets are on, one can see lots of Chinese comparing their tickets to the results in Aberdeen center. Even in offices they would stop work and watch the television sets for results. I think the casinos are bad enough, one does not need any betting from the racecourse.

Must Do. When in Hong Kong do what the locals do have a day or night at the races,we had a tour organised with Splendid Tours which picked us up took us to the races had a table in 1 of the private boxes with full buffet meal and all you can drink $30 betting voucher and expert advise from the tour leader Shu what a night don't miss it if you are staying in Hong Kong.
Great Raceway. For the 10HKD entry fee it makes for a very cheap enjoyable night out, the food available was good and the drinks were cheap great racecourse
Happy Valley. Cheap and cheerful, see the locals gambling and have a flutter yourself. Very cheap to get in, usually Wednesdays, gets very busy but a great night out.

Great evening. A great evening, lots of seating and cheap as to get in. Food was average and drinks were expensive. The staff were great and patient. Betting was made easy by the staff explaining the procedures. Thanks well worth a visit.

Just Brilliant!. This racecourse is really just brilliant. It's a showcase for what HK is all about, fast and furious and oh so much fun! Unreal atmosphere and so cheap to entre with cheap drinks too.

Wednesday night races. I went to the races with my three sisters, it is certainly not the dressed up affair that we have in Australia, but we had a great time there. If you are an international traveler you can take your passport with you and get entry into the members stand. It is not expensive and well worth it!

Don't bother with the tourist badge. Went there for Happy Wednesday. Great night but annoyed we bothered getting the Tourist badge. We went to Sha Tin races the weekend before and that was worth the extra cost - got access to a large members area, extra restaurants etc. At HV there was no real benefit - we ended up spending most of the time in the general admission area anyway which had a better selection of food and drinks, more places to sit/stand.

Awesome setting and good fun!. The setting is amazing and the stands are great for people watching. Admission is very reasonable ($10) and there was a good view of the racecourse from the stands. Whilst not on all year I don't think, when it is, we would recommend going on Wednesday evenings. We would definitely go again.

Great Night Out. Even if you don't like racing add this to your must do list in Hong Kong. I love racing my wife at best tolerates it but she had a ball and in fact rates it as the best night of our holiday. Great location in the city and fun party atmosphere with plenty of food and drink options.My tip is put away your pre conceived ideas and just go. You will love it.

Brilliant Night out. Good place to go with a group of friends. Can use the Octopus Card to get in. Really good atmosphere. We stood by the edge of the track which made the races feel more exciting. We had dinner before, but can easily get a range of food from stalls. All very impressive and exciting. I don't know anything about horse racing, but will definitely go again when I visit. Buses and trams stop nearby.

Go even if you don't care about horses. I was lucky enough to be in Hong Kong on Wednesday night, which is when the races run. It was a 10-15 minute walk from the metro station, but was relatively easy to find (follow some signs at first, and then eventually just follow the crowd). I went by myself but I could see how if you go with friends, you could stay all night! If you walk all around to the "public" entrance (it's the one with all the turnstyles) it is only $10 HKD - less than $2 United States. You have to put a coin in yourself, but there are official employees standing there who will give you change if you don't have a $10 coin. You'll see everyone from old Chinese men gambling to young expats dressed to the nines, to couples dating to good friends hanging out. I didn't pay for the "tourist packages" that are advertised, but I squeezed into a great standing spot right by the fence and the winners circle. I watched 2 races and then walked around for a bit. Great people watching, lots of food and drink available. It's pretty neat to think that this is a major equine location, so it's an insight into something new, even if you'll never watch another horse race again! Also, it's right in the middle of the city, so the Hong Kong skyline is gorgeous around you. All in all, it was a fun night. I had been to Hong Kong before so this was a nice "extra" rather than running around checking off tourist destinations off a list! There is also a free Jockey Museum (before the turnstyles - you have to exit to get to them if you are already inside, although I think if you have paid to access the Members Clubhouses, etc., you can get to it without accessing) and I stopped in there before they closed at 9pm.

Worlds Best Racecourse?. I love this place and it must be good to rival, or maybe surpass, York.It's absolutely huge, has an amazing atmosphere and top class racing. Only Chester comes even close in terms of a city racecourse but the high rise backdrop means HV is truly unique.The crowds are big and loud, the staff very helpful and the facilities first class. We paid for a tourist ticket at £10 but, next time, will just pay the general entry as this area seems to have the best atmosphere.If your in HK on a Wednesday and like racing - go!!
