fun fun fun. my first time to a racecourse and it was a lot of fun... a good mix of people... cheap beer and visually awesome... cheap entry too

Happy Valley. This is truly an emerald jewel in the heart of Hong Kong. Lots of fun and a cheap night out. Didn't win a race, but had a beer, sat outside and enjoyed the live band between races.Left before the last race, apparently a good idea! Worth a visit and it's right in the middle of everything, and is surrounded by tall buildings - quite stunning at night.

Exciting evening. Thoroughly enjoyed an evening at the races. The location is stunning, it was as cheap as chips to get in, the staff were very helpful, plenty of beer and food. Would advise leaving before the last race as it gets very busy and you may struggle to get a taxi.

must go on a wednesday! great night out. This is a must for any viSit to HK. It is absolutely brilliant, the whole evening is about drinking, betting and watching the Live band play, the horse racing is there too of course but with that much going on its easy to forget. Use the $10 entrance as everybody does and it's where the main areas are. No need to pay more for the toffs areas. The racecourse is 15 minute walk from the MTR so allow that time to walk there. Also, take a pen! Most people go out for a few beers after so be prepared for a heavy night drinking, we got back to the hotel at 630am!

Great Vibe. Nice beer on a Sunday morning, which ended up being more than a beer, and a entertaining horse race. Food here was really good and really cheap. Great vibe, lots of fun, a little bit of gambling doesnt hurt!

a superb night out. Do not miss this treasure. The value for money, plus the absolute experience of racing under floodlights with the background of skyscrapers and the magnificent main stand make this one of the gems of any visit to Hong Kong.
Wednesday Night Racing. Well worth a visit but arrange access to the members area otherwise a private box through local clubs.

Iconic must do. The Chinese are renowned gamblers, but in Hong Kong you can only legally bet via the Tote on the Happy Valley horse races. Wednesday night racing is therefore something of an iconic event in which Hong Kong's gambling-mad populace bet around HK$80 million on each of the night's 8 races. We booked a package in advance at £74 a head which included access to the visitors boxes in the main stand, a generous buffet dinner with unlimited alcohol, great views of all the races, paddock access, and private betting stations. We had a great evening with friends, won some, lost some, and were only down HK$244 (£20) on the night. Great fun and if you come to Hong Kong on a Wednesday or a Saturday, you really can't miss it.

Plan ahead. Spectacular setting. If you are doing the tourist badge option I would suggest booking a table for dinner in the members area if you want a real night out thing. If you are happy in the members just in a stand (good view of finish) with totes and hot lap food then you won't need to. There is a pretty good vibe outside members area. There was a good party atmosphere amongst the punters in the bars and stands with lots of expats & tourists seeming to enjoy plenty of beers.
Night at the races. If you like to gamble on horses you will love a night meeting at HVRC very popular with locals and very spectacular views around the race course . Truly unique experience.

Brilliant evening. Having lived in Hong Kong and never been to the races at Happy valley we thought we would give it a go this trip. What a great experience HH$10 to get in and the yer off....we went into the beer garden which was a similar feeling to the sevens, beer tent and food stalls all over. We may have been lucky as it was the Easter event so live band between the races. You can be right up against the race track on the railings or in the stands it's up to you. Betting is easy and the helpful staff show you what to do if you are uncertain. All in all a fantastic experience right in the centre of Hong Kong I would strongly recommend to anyone ..... Go you'll enjoy it and if you win there is no better feeling. Will go again for sure

Give it a try. 10HK dollars to get into the racecourse, a good experience and anther cheap night out. Food and drink available. Not used to horse racing but our 10HK dollars on a race and won 100HK dollars good couple of hours out
off to the races. great fun even for non-experts: fabulous atmosphere. Apparently a huge amount of money passes every week here. Good restaurant if you have someone who is a member.

Race to Happy Valley. Whether you pay the $1 general admission fee or sit in one of the hospitality boxes you are sure to have a great time.Wednesday is race night at Happy Valley. Floodlit racing in the middle of the city with a backdrop of high rise apartment building make for a very different experience.
Great fun. Must do in Hong Kong; great fun and very easily accessible. You don't have to bet much; $50-80 would cover drinks and betting on every race for 2!
Horse Races is a must see in HKG. On Wednesdays Evening go there to bet on the horses, enjoy the nice atmosphere and have food and drinks with international crowds

Not to be missed for Race Lovers. Had a great night here. Went to the members area which anyone can do.There were free drinks all night all in ready supply (beer and wine only I think). Cost was about $75 Australian or $500 HKD each.There was a fantastic buffet on offer with barbequeing of food. Love that smell.Terrific view of the race track.The only down side is that people are allowed to smoke at the tables which I prefer wasn't permitted. Luckily not many smokers that night.Also, it is very difficult to get there at that time of the day as the races start at 6pm which is peak hour on the trains and roads. We caught the MRT and walked a fair way. Might have been a better way though - just not sure.This was a highlight of our trip to Hong Kong. A great night out.

Ticker tape reception!. We went on race night and enjoyed cold beer and curry! We only stayed for 4 races and chose to stand. After a race we looked up at the big stand and saw thousands of torn up tickets floating down like ticker tape. Quite spectacular to see.
interesting. My bf and i had many funny things here. if u want to relax , go here and enjoin. Your feeling will become better

A fabulous evening out. Probably the most unusual racecourse in the world and not to be missed weather your a horse racing fan or not. The atmosphere is electric, bright and noisey and in the most unbelivable setting in the middle of the city on Hong Kong Island. Well worth the $10 HK addmission fee (80p sterling). Plenty of food and drink available. I would suggest the Wednesday evening meeting for the best atmosphere

LOVED IT!. We went here with friends and made an evening of it, our visit fell on the same weekend as Octoberfest so there was themed entertainment, food and drinks on all night, the racing is excellent with great views of the course, it's easy to get carried away with the bets! i'd recommend going with an allowance and leaving your wallet at home!

amazing experience. Not a big gambler or horse racing fan but even so this is a great night out. Normally every Wednesday night through the season.Costs very little to get in and the beers are subsidised. Stand on the beer garden lawn and watch the night races against the backdrop of the floodlights and some iconic HK skylines. Put some bets on to make it more interesting. A really good night out with a nice atmosphere.

Not a sure bet!. We elected to go to the Wednesday Night Race evening on a night that there were no horses! They hadn't returned from the Arab States apparently!Went to the restaurant and prepaid for a meal which we had heard was a gastronomical delight but at best found it to be an self service buffet with a limited range of western food choices. Bit of a nightmare finding a ding ding tram back to the city, as we completed a circle around the racecourse. We should have gone back to the terminus.Bit of a disappointment really!
A must do. Great setting , great atmosphereA vibrant event with a real buzzRacing doesn't getter better than this !

A great hong kong institution. . One of the must-do experiences in hong kong. Great fun for a different evening out. We visited with a tour group, and enjoyed the general atmosphere more than anything else at the happy valley racecourse.

Highlight of trip ... must do. Our hotel was just over the road from course we're not racing fans but decided to take a look. It would be easy for any traveller to access by the fabulous subway ... although its a short walk from station its well signposted alternatively you could take a taxi ride.Travellers with passport can acess members stand. ... However we enjoyed mixing in with the locals and other tourists in the stands. it was 10 dollars to get in and bets start at 20 dollars .... the staff are helpful so its easy to out a bet on. The stadium is awesome ... a green jewel surrounded by shiny tour blocks. ... atmosphere is electric .... jugs of ale and delicious local snacks on sale.A fantastic evening .....

My Best Night in HK. In the time I was lucky enough to live in HK, I did as much as I could in that amazing city. Of all the things I did, the most fun I had was at Happy Valley. It's free to watch, though betting is fun and the jackpots are quite generous. There are multiple races and a tram goes right to the track, making it easy to get to. There is really good food there as well and surprisingly affordable. Great for all. I've heard that tourists can show their passport to get into the VIP lounge (Can't confirm this but I've heard it several times)

Big Games. It is one of the most spectacular race courses of the world, but unlike European race courses that are sports venues this is mainly a huge gambling ground with big money changing hand every half an hour. Must be seen once, and I believe foreigners can buy admission to the Members Stand by showing passport.
VIP Area. I was lucky eough to be invited to the Members / VIP lounge and viewing area; spectacular race night with champagne and snacks to die for. just go if you can!

Racing under the stars. I visited with a Grays online tour. Pick up at our hotel transport to and from the course, buffet dinner and drinks and some betting money. All races viewed from the terrace outside the function room and a betting facility 10 metres from your table.
Fun night. It was a beautiful evening and a lot,of fun. A nice view of the city, The horses and grass track are beautiful. If you choose to bet, you can make minimal bets.

A must see cultural phenomenon. I went to the race track not expecting very much. I'm not really into betting and not really into horses but some colleagues were going so I went to join them. Was I ever surprised at what I found. Smack in the middle of busy Hong Kong is an incredible race track with live music, entertainment, and refreshments aplenty [if you know what I mean]. Young people, old people, locals and tourists, all well represented. The sheer energy of the crowd when the horses are running and the horses themselves are really something to experience. The best part is that it's really not expensive. I believe the entry fee was the equivalent of two US dollars and betting is really optional.
Get into the action!. Even if you don't bet, going to the Happy Valley Racecourse is a very exciting experience. Even better: general admission will leave you straight to the track. So exciting!

Great night out. Visited on the 12/03/2014 and went in the public entrance (Gate G) which cost under £1. There's very much a party type atmosphere and there was a good mix of locals and people from pretty much all over the world. The grandstand was huge, and that combined with the back drop, was probably worth the visit alone. There were quality beers to choose from, with a pint costing about £3 and food prices about half what you'd pay in Southern England. Lots of helpful staff on hand to help fill out betting slips and you can buy an English language race book from the Customer Service desk on the ground floor for about £1.50. There were 8 races on the card and they ran between 19:00 - 23:00 - a mixture of Class 3's and 4's. Would definitely recommend to all: male, female, young, old, race goers or party animals!

Happy Valley. Went to Happy Valley Night Races with a Gray Line tour. Really pleased we used a tour as traffic is a nightmare. Tour takes you to Members Enclosure which includes a generous buffet. Betting is easy as there is a "tote" in the members enclosure. We were taken down to the paddock and finish line. We left before the last race because of the traffic issues but no-one minded. Would highly recommend doing an organised tour to go to night meeting.

Must visit. Our hostel owner at the Rainbow Lodge took us and some other travellers to the racecourse when we were in Hong Kong. We did not know anything about it before going and I can honestly say it was one if not the best experiences we had in HK even if I did not win anything on my bets. It such an amazing atmosphere in the arena and it is like a party. When the horses are racing the place explodes in cheers both happy and angry. The races are only on Wednesdays as I understood it and I would say that your visit to HK is not complete without a few bets on the racecourse.

Great night at the races. Both me and my wife had never been to the races before. The tourist entrance fee is 10 HKD each which is nothing. The stadium is amazing and the atmosphere was electric. Loads to eat and drink at cheaper prices than anywhere else we found. Great night out and a must if your visiting Hong Kong.

A Must do. Our family had a great night out.It is very easy to purchase the tickets we all got the tourist badges and it was wonderful to get right up & close to the jockeys.There was a large crowd there the night we were there, so get there early, locals put their paper on the seat to reserve it. A band played between races and local food and beer is sold everywhere, not badly priced. The gift shop had some interesting items, worth a look. Good value night out with an outstanding view and wonderful atmosphere. A Must do

AND NOW THEIR RACING !!!. Even if you know nothing about horse racing, like me, an evening at happy valley was far better than I expected . Great meal, happy crowd ,good fun atmosphere ,no need to gamble just watch !!!
Fun Wednesday night out!. Went for dinner nearby (there is little food available at races) then stopped by for a few hours. It was great how close to the track and the action you can get.
Box at the finish.... Is where to be with an old school friend and delicious food and good company! Be there sometime in your life!
Excellent. I got to enter the race on WED, was amazing experience, i entered for HKD10 by Octopus card. the place was great comparing to the experience..

Fantastic Experience - a must to visit!. I headed round to the general public entrance on my own from Crowne Plaza hotel so about a 10 minute walk, I got there to find out it only cost $10 (around 70p GBP) - bargain!What a great experience! Once inside you mix with the locals and the ex-pats and everyone is very friendly with no signs of trouble.Beer and wine is available to buy at reasonable prices along with snacks from local stalls.The place itself is incredible - a racecourse in the city centre surrounded by high-rise buildings and mountains - its quite a spectacular location!Even if you aren't interested in horse racing it makes for a great place for people watching and just watching how things go in Hong Kong.If you are in Hong Kong it should be on the 'must visit' list.

Happy Valley Racetrack. Fabulous experience! The meal was an extraordinary buffet with choices of food from China, North America, Malaysian and others. the dining room is cosy and there are numerous people to help you understand how the betting works. I loved going out on the private balcony to watch the race. In this guided visit, we also had the privilege of going down to the paddocks. The horses are so much more impressive close up. The view of the skyscrapers behind the track is awesome.

Do you want to feel like a local. Would you love to feel like a local then take the time to take in a race meeting at the Happy Valley Racecourse? Get among the atmosphere , the locals and the jetsetters. Make sure you check online for the times of the race meetings as they are only on certain days of the week.

Addictive. I've never gambled before and safe to say you could tell but it was strangely addictive when I won on the first horse I bet on came in first, some my friends were banging o it big bets and also winning , the atmosphere was electric and after the hassle and bustle of HK it was good to have the break and win some cash.

Entertaining. Happy Valley Racecourse is a great place to go with friends. Location is easy to find and quick to get in, you can even use your octopus card to get in. It is spacious inside but there are so many people it may not seem that way. You can get right up to the gate to watch the horses race. Unless you have a wicked fast shutter speed, I recommend taking a video instead of a picture. Great atmosphere; although expensive, there's food, drinks, music, cool people, what more could you ask for. There are always events with entertainers, little contests/games, you can do a little betting. It's a fun night out in a cool setting. If you have time, I recommend to check it out.
Fun night out. Good fun night out with loads of atmosphere in a unique setting. Was impressed how close you could get to the action. A visit here is certainly worth it.

Good all round entertainment.. This is a well run event. We had a great view from the Gallery Restaurant. Easy to put on bets and very helpful staff for those who are first timers at the Valley. You need to book at one of the restaurants. We went to the Gallery. You will need to give your credit card on booking so make sure you turn up!Food is OK. Buffet starters and dessert but set main which you order and collect when your buzzer sounds at the table. The only down side is that if you want anything different for a main there are additional charges. You can go to the buffet and dessert counter as many times as you like. If we went again we would stick to the pizza , which is huge, and the desserts and starter counter.Take you passport if you want to get into the members stand as a guest. Make sure you leave well before the last race as the police close off part of the road. Queue up at the taxi rank outside the main public gate.

Fun night at happy valley. Great. Night out. We took our passports to a betting shop and brought a visitors pass. Great value. Gave access to most of course but realy if you just want a fun night out only need to buy ticket at gate. General entrance and go with the fun crowd. Band playing between races. Plenty of beer for sale and easy betting. It's realy just a great fun Wednesday night out that's cheep and cheerful. Easy to get to. Just hope on a tram going to happy valley and get off with everybody else and follow the crowd. Same getting back. If you are staying in Kowloon just get the underground or Starr ferry to Central and hope on a tram. Easy as.betting in hong king dollars is fun and unless you are a serious punter won't cost you an arm and leg. Just stick to the favourites and have fun.

One Fun Night Out!. We did this night out a little better!I stayed at the Excelsior Hotel and booked this night out with 5 associates.While we could have walked to the track, for $900 HKD (roughly $125 Canadian) we were treated to Coach trip and sat in the Hong Kong Jockey Clubs private members box.We enjoyed a sumptuous buffet, beer and wine included, and the most incredible view of the track. Our special guide coached us in the subtleties of Hong Kong betting and helped explain the racing form. The highlight of the night was a trip to the paddock area for the 5th race and seats right at the rail finish line.The view is amazing. To have a grass racetrack right smack in the middle of a huge city and surrounded by 100 story buildings!The staff were polite and informative and while our betting did not fill our pockets it was great to know that the proceeds basically all go to charity.What a great way to spend a Wednesday night out!

Great night out. We do not follow horse racing in the UK but even so we thoroughly enjoyed this night out in Hong Kong. Recommend going with the crowds for general entrance and you can then watch the horses parading around the ring, watch the races from the rails or sit in the stands and cheer on your horse. A large screen enables you to follow the race around the track. I would recommend getting the useful English programme at the track as this gave a comprehensive guide to all the horses, the jockeys and tips on their current form. Eight races over the evening and the time just flew by. Definitely a fun and enjoyable evening.
Fun night out. Fun night and great atmosphere, only paid the basic entry of HK10 and that's all that's neededEasy to place bets and managed to make money too!!

Wednesday night was fun. Had a great time. The races were fun. I did a tourist ticket. Which gets you into a few members areas. Was next to were the horse parade ring is and the winners circle. So right there at the finish line. Good food for around 45hkdBeer around $45hkdPitcher $170hkdThey had magic show and band when we were there and Anson Chan was a great magician.
amazing ambience. Situated in the middle of Hong Kong give this Race Course a unique atmosphere. This is worthwhile watching especially on Wednesdays. Don´t be afraid of the traffic.

Great Night Out. Despite reading reviews saying there is no advantage to the 'tourist entry ticket' we felt safer on a first visit doing this - what a pair of idiots, all the facilities were in the 'cheap' section, - absolutely no need to pay the extra - Pay 10 HK dollars, not 100.Commentary is in Chinese BUT toward the middle of the stand it is in English, well worth finding this bit if English is your language.We are regular racegoers in the UK so felt at home with horses/betting etc. Soon got the hang of the betting slips - despite nearly wagering £140 on first bet due to ticking a wrong box! The staff are very helpful and friendly.In the stands people put newspapers over chairs to save them - worth doing if there early enough. A wide variety of food and drink is available. All reasonably priced.Music and various entertainers are a norm.Beware at the end there is no immediate public transport (or taxi). We walked back to our hotel near Causeway (the nearest station) in about 15 minutes.A really good night out at a very impressive racecourse.
Great evening!. Lots of fun and set in a great location with a city backdrop. Food was not good but the entertainment and vibe were perfect.
Great race experience. Great experience, definitely worth the trip. Beautiful setting in the city. I believe it is also usually very inexpensive.

Terrific atmosphere. I do not bet on horses and know nothing about horse racing but this is a must to visit. It cost the equivalent of 80 pence for entrance. There were food and drink stalls with good quality products at very reasonable prices. There was live music during the evening and the atmosphere was electric at times. The night was full of excitement and I'd rate it as a real experience, definitely recommended.
A waste of your time if in HK. Absolutely overrated - is packed, massive and nothing special about it. Ascot has nothing (nothing!) to envy.

Must see for any racing fan.. The setting among the high rise apartments is amazing.I am a regular at British racecourses but couldn't get to grips with how to fill in the betting slips. I managed win, place and forecast (Quinella) with a very helpful lady at the betting counter. I went in on a guest member for HK$130 (need a passport). The members area was a bit easier and seats were available. The regular area was very crowded(HK$10) with 10 or more queuing at every tote desk.Went back on the tram,great value at $2.30.

The Best Race track ever!. If you want excitement and fun then this will be a great place to go since there was live bands, beers to drink and bets were $10 only! The best part is that we all went out with the guys at Urban Pack which makes it a more interesting night :)

Race night could be great fun. I never thought I'd visit a horse race track, but obviously in HK I did. Listed as one of the "must dos" in one of the fellow hostelers guide book, think it was lonely planet, I joined their crew and went for race night at the track.Race night actually attracts quite a crowd and one would just wonder how many are there for the races and how many are there for the more social event so to say. But it is anyway great fun for the rookie, maybe if you're into horse racing the experience is another one, but for the backpacker who thought he'd never go this was actually great fun!

what a kick. Not familiar with horse racing at all, we decided to have it a try. This was exciting, especially the entourage around it, the people betting, the excitement during a race watching people win and lose their money! great place to go

Happy punters!. Fantastic local atmosphere - totally different to races in Australia, cheap entry and cheap food and drinks. Singing and dancing competitions added to the fun... no need to bet to enjoy the experience.

Don't miss a night here. We went to the races on Boxing Day, (night time) absolutely the best and cheapest night out, great fun and excitement. 10hkd to get in.... Bargain. We had a small bet on each race and had great fun, cheering on the horses. Added excitement of some live music and dancing. If you're in HK you really have to make time to come here, the atmosphere, views and fun are unbeatable.

Racing for one pound!. The races in Hong Kong are great fun and a very cheap night out! The entrance fee was a mere 10 Hong Kong dollars (a pound!) and for that you get to sit or stand in the beer garden along the tattersalls.Great fun and if you're lucky on the gee gees you might even come out with a profit!

happy racing!!. Went to happy valley in January for the second time.It is an amazing atmosphere and view of the city.It is a 5-10 min walk from causeway bay station.It cost 10 HKG dollars to to get in .$ 1.25 aus..For this is you get an amazing color race book with all the details of the horses including photos..They have a beer garden with lots of beers and wine from all over the world and also traditional and western food.some times they have a band play in between races.They have lots of assistance to help you fill in the betting cards.It is on Wednesday nights and lots of tourist go and have a party.Beers are about $4 for 500 ml. kids are not allowed in until 18, so its not like Australia were kids are encouraged to go.
Good fun evening. The evening meeting we went to was well organised and the meal we had in our box was very good. A memorable evening's racing.
Great night out. Worth doing once if you have a free Wednesday night although some Tuesdays a couple of times a year also.measy to get to, great atmosphere, easy to bet and fun to watch

Cheap and Fun. Took the train over to the New Territories district, far far away from where our hotel was in Central (by Hon Kong standards half an hour). We went on a Sunday, and had a local show us around. Great beer and cheap food. My husband and I don't gamble but that didnt get in the way of having a wonderful time :)

Fun night. Three of us went over for the big meeting at Sha Tin on the Sunday. Wednesday at Happy Valley is more of a social night for us. Cheap as anything to get in using your Octopus card. Good choice of beers and food.

Check the racing schedule beforehand. As Hong Kong has two racecourses, one in Shatin and the other Happy Valley. Races usually held on Wednesday night here and sometimes Sunday afternoon. During August it is off-season so there will be no race. Bring a pen and try your luck to bet by filling the bet tickets in the concourse, or you can buy a cash coupon at the counter then use it at the electronic terminals around the concourse to make bets.

Go on Wenesday Night. Get to the Wednesday night races and enjoy the atmosphere, the size of the course and the way the surrounding buildings impose on the course. Even if you don't gamble it’s just a great place to soak up and have fun. It is very popular and very crowded, but where isn’t in HK.

Not So "Happy Valley" For Us!. As we were staying opposite the Happy Valley Racecourse and we were staying on a Wednesday we thought we had to visit it on their Wednesday night race meet. We actually went inside the day before as there is a running track you can use.We had seen that it was only about a £1 (UK) to get into the racecourse but there was also a “Tourist Ticket” for about £10 which meant you could access other parts of the racecourse areas. We spoke on two occasions to box office staff beforehand when we were given the impression that we could access many more areas with the Tourist Ticket. We therefore went ahead and bought them on admission after again asking more questions about access. Also we were told 3 different prices.When we got to the lift we asked one of the girl stewards which areas we could access with our tickets and she said “the second floor”. Fine. We went to the second floor, going past numerous stewards and found seats outside near the finishing line. Great we thought. Husband went out to buy some drinks, again going past stewards both in and out and he was allowed back to the seats without any problem. We then decided to go down to the main area to see what it was like. Husband bought some food from there, he went back up to our seats, again past stewards who did not query him going where we had been sitting, whilst I queued for some Chinese food inside – which was absolutely delicious; best and cheapest takeaway I’ve ever had. When I went to go back to where my husband was I was told I couldn’t go through. Took me a bit by surprise as no one had stopped us when we had been going in and out previously. Thought there must have been a language problem and I had misunderstood. When I got to where we had been sitting someone else was in the seats where we had sat and our possessions had been removed to the next seat. No problem I thought! The man looked at us very aggressively and I stared back at him wondering what it was all about. Turned out the area was for season ticket holders, which of course we didn’t know. A steward came over and said we had to move. I complained and said we had bought the tickets asking lots of questions beforehand as to where we could go and we had gone in and out on numerous occasions. She came back and told us firstly that we had to move and then if we wanted to pay more we could stay in the seats as the people whose seats they were weren’t attending that day. I said no and that the box office (and their website) had misrepresented the extent of where we could go and if I were to move I would want a full refund. Senior steward came over and said we could have a refund and escorted us out of the seats as if we were some sort of criminals (might add I’m a small grey haired 64 year old!) and gave us a refund. We noticed there were other people, who like us, hadn’t appreciated that it was very limited where you could go on the tourist ticket as they were being turned away from areas..Moral of this story is DON’T BOTHER BUYING THE TOURIST TICKET. Just go for the basic entrance price.Just as a PS. We chose the first two winners but didn’t know how to bet so didn’t win any money! We went back to our room overlooking the racecourse and watched it from there as we had a good view.
Big Race Track. Big race track and this is where you see all walks of people walking in and out. An eye opener for sure even if you do not gamble.

Great night out. $10HK to get in the gate and $20HK to get seats on the second floor outside overlooking the track. Races on time all the time. Great view and so much fun. Cheap taxi fare from the Sheraton - $70HK.
I WON. Didn't win much but loved the atmosphere! got some nice snacks and a beer, a great way to spend a Sunday morning in Hong Kong
Great experience. Fabulous place to get a feel of the countryside right in the middle of a bustling metropolis! Food is terrific too!

Must do Weds night. We watched the Wednesday night races from the Stable Bend Terrace, which had a delicious BBQ and open bar (beer and wine). I had never been to a horse race before and had never bet, but the betting counter staff were very helpful and nice. Bets are different than in US racing. Easiest bet is to pick one horse to "place."Beautiful track and the city backdrop is awesome. One of the highlights from our trip!

Raced Night. This is now the 2nd time to have been lucky enough to visit and races aid we have found it to be a very enjoyable evening .The first time was the adrenalin lounge 1 drink only but food included in price lovely place if you want to get dressed for the occasion very enjoyable .2nd time Stable bend terrace more casuals and relaxed but all food and drink inclusive well all wine beer and orange juice and waitresses are filling your glass's constantly .food extremely good on both occasions .So it really depends on what you prefer from your night .The organisation on both occasions was very good so I'm sure whatever you decide it will be a good night . There are more choices but I can only comment on what we have experienced but I'm sure you will enjoy whatever you decide .

Must do for a Wednesday Night in Hong Kong. If you are in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night - cancel everything else, and do this!No need to book or buy tickets in advance, just take one of the trams or bus #1 to Happy Valley. Follow the crowds and either use your Octopus card to pay the entrance fee, or show your passport to get free entrance for tourists.Think of this as a massive outdoor bar (drinks and food available) with horses. Place your bets at the window, there are guides who will help you fill out the little forms. Then yell like crazy as your horse gallops past. Check out the horses as they walk around pre-race in the Owners' Enclosure. Soak in the atmosphere and wonder who those people are that live in the tall residential blocks overlooking the racetrack, and wonder if they ever get tired of this scene... definitely a memorable experience in Hong Kong!

How to lose your children's inheritance in one very pleasant evening :-). I had visitors over so took them to Happy Valley Race Course on a Wednesday night to watch some of the races, and soak up the atmosphere. In the general enclosure, under the floodlights, the place buzzes with atmosphere. Put HK$20 on the horse that takes your fancy (choose by the colour of the jockey’s top, the number of the horse, or if you’re really keen, the horse’s “form”) and get all excited as your horse races to the finish-line – usually last in my experience, but hey-ho. And all this for just HK$10 (US$1.25) entrance fee! There’s beer available and quite an array of food snacks – even pretty good for veggies – and it’s just a really nice evening out. Stay the whole evening, or just watch a couple of races and enjoy a beer or 2 – it’s your choice. But it’s certainly something you shouldn’t miss if you’re visiting HK over a Wednesday evening (note, the races aren’t on in the summertime though because of the heat).

happy times. first time to happy valley at night - memorible trip on tram to coursebacked winners - great night good food - only problem was trying to work out the betting tickets - but lots of help from guides
Fun!. It was a bit hard to get to and from, but it was great fun! The great part is you can stand right at the track if you want to, or sit in the stands.

The Apex of racecourses. This is a must see for every racing fan that visits Hong Kong. The night racing is fantastic just to experience the ambiance. The Jockey Club on top floor is the best and the food is wonderful. It is a buffet and your drinks are included.The service is good and the clientele might be somewhat stuffy. The entry on this floor is expensive, $133 US each and must be pre-booked. Jackets and ties are required. It is a wonderful and unique experience in racing.

Good fun on a Wed. night. In the middle of Hong Kong surrounded by apartment buildings, lit up and full of people. Lot of help around for the first timers. There are plenty of seating and you can wander the grounds as well. Good fun.

A great night out in Hong Kong. What an amazing venue right in the middle of Hong Kong. We went mid week racing and had a fantastic time. Entry is only 10 HKD and the atmosphere is electric.The race course has stands / boxes to one side and the other side is a fantastic back drop of high rise apartments. Its a wonderful setting.We didn't eat at the race course but had a few pitchers of beer. There were plenty of tents and the cost per pitcher is approx. 160 HKD. Betting was very easy and there are plenty of staff to assist.A great was to spend an evening in Hong Kong and would recommend to anyone visiting HK.

Happy tour. Had a tour to night at Happy Valley race track what a eye opener... had dinner and drinks in stewards lounge 7 stories up all included in the price all well as a few bets for free on the horses. staff were very helpful putting on bets for you coming around to you table. meal was great, money well spent.

If you like a little dabble on the gee gees.. Took a tour to Happy Valley races with Splendid tours. Got looked after like VIPs. Wonderful experience. Food and unlimited drinks( no spirits) available and excellent English speaking tour guides to see that a good time is had.

Excellent way to spend a Wednesday. In case you're in HK on a Wednesday in the race season you owe yourself to spend part of Wednesday at the races. I went for the cheapest entry which at 10 HKD is ridiculously cheap and gives access to what I'm sure is the most fun section - and there is seats as well.Standing right next to the track you as close to the action as you'll ever get, there's loads of places selling beer and lots of entertainment during races.I didn't know what to expect, but it really feels like a place where loads of people (expats, tourist ...) go out on a Wednesday.Lots of fun.

Very Good. There is a tour you can take thru Gray Line and it costs roughly $120 Australian to attend, it is called the International section in which you attend. Included is your travel, entrance fee, buffet dinner and all of the wine or beer you can drink. Well worth going, very comfortable, would have been nice for me to pick at least one winner! The view is incredible, you are on the 6th floor looking down over the winners post, A must see.

Fun night out. This was our second visit to Happy Valley and, once again, it wa a fun night. We are not race goers (or gamblers) but thoroughly enjoyed our 100 HKD flutter on each race. The race course itself is situated right in the middle of Hong Kong, surrounded by tall buildings. We purchased our tourist tickets from the local betting office (there are many all over Hong Kong) and it was well worth the small entrance fee to be have access to the members' stand. Happy Valley races are held each Wednesday night during race season and is certainly a great night out.
Very much fun.. It is open and running on Wednesday night. We went with a group of friends and had a box in the Jockey Club. We had a nice dinner there also

Good Vibe. This place is fun. Kind of hard to get to from my hotel which was all the way in Tst, but was worth it. I didn't win anything, but had a great time with my wife here. Enjoyed some beer and some insight from a few experts on the spot ( wise old Chinese man haha) The place was full of ex-pats. Really exciting, was something different in our visit. Recommended !!
Absolute must while you're in HK. True HK experience this! Wednesdays are all about Wan Chai - have a flutter on the races before letting yourself unwind on Lockhart Rd for wan chai wednesdays!

Had a good night at the track. ....didn't win a single thing, but had a great time. Great atmosphere. Lots of excitement. Plenty of Westerners....if you need to see any more. :-) Had dinner at one of the restaurants and enjoyed the night.

Happy Racing in Hong Kong. Had a terrific night! Even came out front by the grand sum of HK$78. Seriously the bets are so low in AUD$ that it doesn't matter that you don't have a clue whether the horse will win or not. There is good commentary by some 'experts' that give you a bit of an insight. We did the tour that included member's stand and dinner and it was worth every cent. Food was plentiful, very tasty and included beer and wine which was constantly topped up, plus it was easy to put a bet on and we also went down and had a chance to see the horses up close.
Great party!. Had a great time here. Many ex-pats from all over the world. Oh, there's a race too? Just adds to the excitement. Fun, after-hours meeting place.

What a night. I am finally able to make it to this in town race course for the Wednesday night races. And what a fun experience it was!Getting to the course was easy - you can take the MTR to Times Square and once you are outside there are fairly obvious signs to the track. It is about a 10 min walk - you can also just get a cab ride which we did after with no problem. This essentially allows you access to most areas of the course including the parade area and the standing space right by the finish line. It's easy to get the pass - just go into the lodge box entrance (not the main gate at the end) and you will see a sign for "tourist passes" The staff behind the window will check your passport (to make sure you have HK stamp) and then give you a small tag to attach to your shirt or pants once you have paid the fee. Inside the course you can get the racing forms and booklets. Placing bets was easy, although some of the options are different. In addition we discovered after a few races that it seems to be easier to win, so make sure you keep all of your tickets and bring them back to the window to double check. The serious fans watches the races, reviewed the horses and made a few bets, while the rest of us enjoyed a few beers, met some interesting people and enjoyed the great night view. I would highly recommend adding this to your HK plans - I'm just sorry it took me several trips to get out there!
A Must Visit!. We loved it... we dont normally go to the races but visiting Happy Valley was something else, inbelievable sporting atmosphere!

Great Buzz. To get to HV jump on one of the Trams which carry HV as their destination point. It's certainly an experience getting the Tram; crowded, small and noisy they may be, but a really fun experience.When you get to the HV terminus, follow the road around in the direction you were travelling and then cross the road. Follow the path for around 150 metres and you will end up at a large, brightly lit entrance. There are ladies there waiting to help you buy the tickets at 10 dollars a pop - around 85p for my UK friends!On entry, it is all laid out for you immediately. Food and drink stands are immediately followed by betting tip teams who will hand you an English language race guide and quickly run you through the betting system, which is fairly logical. A quick tip to my UK compatriots who are used to Each Way betting - at HV to do an EW bet you need to do two separate bets, one for a win and the other for a place. They aren't done under the same bet as they are at home, as I embarrassingly found to my cost when questioning, ever so politely, the lower than anticipated payout when my placed bet horse won the 7th race. DOH! After that just grab a beer, place your bets and enjoy a raucous, fun, buzzing night out. Highly recommended.

Brilliant. My wife insisted on going and she was right. We had an outstanding time here. This place is spectacular. You can eat and drink, and they have shops and restaurants and even a live band that sings between races. They had 8 races and we stayed right until the end of the last one. The thrill was amazing. The prices are great for the fun that will provide. My wife even did a little betting and won. It was a great way to spend our afternoon and you mustn’t miss it if you visit Honk-Kong. Brilliant!
Good Fun. Lots of people, for a bit more space and a better view go the second floor and buy a ticket ($20 HK) to the verandah seating.

Big Night Out. The setting of the race track itself is well worth the visit to see. Surrounded by high rise buildings. The crowd builds very quickly but everything seems to run smoothly despite the number of people. We had a delicious pork knuckle from one of the catering marquees and there are lots of beer outlets to choose from. Not sure how everyone gets out of there at the end of the night- we left after the 5th race.

A Hong Kong must.. We just went by tram and wandered into the public area, it was very busy because it was an Octoberfest special, great atmosphere and everyone very jovial. Lots of help available with filling out the race cards, I did mine wrong and the guy behind the counter filled out another one, misread my form and put "to win" instead of "place", never mind as my horse won! It was so crowded I thought we wouldnt actually get to see the horses but if you follow signs to the parade ring you can actually get to see them and eventually we did in fact get quite near the race track itself. What a spectacular place and very easy to reach by tram if you are on a budget. Awful queues for the ladies though!

Great night out. A racecourse surrounded by the sky rises in the city. Packed, great atmosphere and a really fun way to spend a few hours and place a few bets, ask for some help from the expats there and place £1-2 bets on the races.

fun..great evening on Wednesday. I have been to many tracks and Happy Valley is a wonderfulvenue. The food is very good and the setting is special. Whenyou are watching from the Jockey Club the horses looksmall and it's hard to see who's leading, but the excitementgenerated is thrilling.

Something different on Wednesday nights!. Went privately to the Members enclosure. Enjoyed a cheap snack meal with wine and seats lined up with the winning post. Easy to have a bet but an English language form guide was harder to get. Thoroughly enjoyable evening . If you want to spend more money, there are a variety of packages available.

Outstanding. Never been to the Races before, what a way to start. Paid for a tour and although a bit expensive, on reflection the experience was worth it. Pice of tour included access to a members stand and a buffet dinner with free beer and wine. Eventually figured out how to place a bet - but success for me was not to be tonight, my wife had 2 wins so all was not lost.

Entertaining night out. Go trackside where the beer tents are and you'll have a great night out. Plenty of help on hand when placing a bet from as little as $10. We also went right to the top of the seating area and had a fantastic view of the track and surrounding area but it was a lot more fun at the bottom plus there was a huge wait for the lifts. The end of the evening is a bit busy with everyone leaving trying to get taxis so would recommend leaving before the last race starts so you get a head start on the taxis!

Great experience. What a marvellous experience it is to go to the races at Happy Valley in Hong Kong. Admittance is cheap, transport to and from is easy. It is a great setting with all the buildings around and a large crowd made the day a very memorable for my Chinese wife who attended for the first time, especially as she was able to win a small amount with her $10 wagers. A must see for everyone who visits Hong Kong.

Great night out - fun filled and exciting. What a brilliant venue! We did this as a package deal and from the collection point in Kowloon to the return home it was fantastic. Food and drinks a plenty and the quality was amazing. Easy to bet - they show you how if your not experienced. . I do not have any complaints about the whole night . With the tour you get to go down to the starting line and see the horses up close and personal. Highly recommend for anyone even if they don't like horse racing

Soo Busy and Full of Tourists. Octoberfest was on and it was jam packed full of people, if you go up to the first level their is a nice bar where you can get a bit of breathing space and watch the race from the balcony.

Horseracing in HK, way more exciting than the states. Happy Valley Racecourse is the second best racecourse i have even been to, first is the racecourse in Sha Tin. The difference between the Sha Tin race course and the Happy Valley is the crowd at Happy Valley. As it is located centrally in HK, this course is more exciting. Like most racecourse, you can spent so little money and still spent a great deal of time betting on every race. However if you are like me, I tend to go for the trifactors but never had success winning in HK. Needless to say, the whole experience was still great. PS...this is a great place for people watching!

Best night out in Hong Kong. What a fantastic venue!Easy to get to, easy to bet, easy to get drinks and food. I did not have one complaint about this venue and had a fantastic time.Highly recommend for anyone even if they don't like horse racing

Great fun - especially if you win!. Took the tram from Central, which seemed to take forever, and for HK$10 we were thrust into a sea of ex-pats having a good time. Beer was cheap, ( didn't try the food) and the overall atmosphere was terrific. We had wondered about doing the full-on excursion trip with entry into the Members etc, but our little dip-in and dip-out was all we really needed. We saw three races, had one bet (and won) and decided to leave before the hordes. Good decision on all counts, I reckon. By the way, the ex-pats said Happy Valley's more for the ex-pats, while Sha Tin at the weekend is more for the locals. I suppose it all depends which type of people you want to watch drinking, eating, betting and generally having a good time.

Good fun friendly atmosphere. Must try. A visit to happy valley racecourse is a must try for all young and old. The atmosphere is something to soak in with the locals, the tourists, the expats, and the beers and live band. Can't miss the races too! Good way to spend an ordinary weds night in HK.

A must in Hong Kong. On Wednesday evening, take the tram over to Happy Valley. Entry is HK$10, grab an attractively priced beer from a tent and enjoy the races. Trackside standing offers great proximity to the action, and the cheering crowds get you in the mood. Neighboring highrises provide a great backdrop to the floodlighted track. A fun, inexpensive evening out.

A sporting funday.. A good way to spend an afternoon relaxing in comfortable surroundings while watch all sorts of energetic sportsman playing a range of sports while also watching recorded horse races on a large screen.

Fun & Atmospheric. Not a gmabler or a horse race lover but went with family party and found it great fun!.You can use your Oyster card (HK travel card) to pay to get in at a whopping £1 entry fee! Fantastic venue and a bet will be from as low as £1. 8 races over the evening and plenty of beer / refreshment kiosks.Well worth the visit.

Fun night out!. I went for the Wednesday night races. I just went to the main entrance and it only $10 (Hong Kong dollars) to get in. you can sit in the regular bleachers, stand by the track rail, or if you have your passport go to another section that caters more to the tourist. I didn't stay for all the races just the first 5, but it was worth making time to visit.
Great way to spend a Tuesday night!. It is the scene - young, old, great way to spend a week night - amazing race track in the middl,e of the city.

works night out. Brilliant - spent the night in the open air beer garden, were treated to 8 races, good beer by the pint or pitcher, food is a bit hit and miss - but on a warm clear Wednesday there s no better place to spend a few hours - a must visit Tip when the races finish - pop over to the Happy Valley Bar and Grill or The Jockey for a night cap and 20 mins later much easier to get a cab or tram back in to Central

Horses !!. I just love that place, i use to visit every Wednesday .. just for fun !! I use to take Tram from house or at times walk away all the way from home to racecourse with no fear. Its amazing too see houses running down and people betting on it. It not only means the richer, you will see all category of people, watching the race,, having beer (not me) and taking pictures and what not !!
Very typical to Hong Kong, fun!. This is something very typical for Hong Kong, and its easy going! and Im always amazed about how much money is involved in betting!

Avid Gambler or not this is a fun time. Even if you pay your HK$10 to get into the stands or you are in a private box this is always a fun night out. Starts at 7.15 and the last of the races is around 11pm. Watch out for the crowds in getting there and leaving. Easy to find out how to place bets as everyone is always helpful to a beginner. Races are on Wednesday nights and they are seasonal only.

Gambling and Drinking. Imagine drinking beer and watching horses race in the middle of the city. Apartment blocks surrounding the race course. Pretty cool experience to have, dies away quickly once you have gone a few times. have fun!!
Amazing site.. Even if you're a punter, it is worth travelling to Happy Valley on the tram and enjoy the great atmosphere. Very cheap to get in and the racing is a great spectacle.

Wedding venue. Chinese wedding are so boring that when it comes to a venue, it's always an issue in Hong Kong but the Happy Valley Jockey Club has one of the best in the city mixing both Western and Chinese cuisine in a unique environment: a racecourse!
Fun... This is a very affordable (if you are not betting big) night out with friends. I have never been to a racecourse where you can almost touch the horses as they run by.
Fun Fun Fun. For real Hong Kong fun and a night of cheap entertainment and a totally local experience give this a shot on Tuesday nights.

A Race night to remember. Nothing to dislike at a night at the Races in Hong Kong , even if your not a gambling person , just to soak up the atmosphere , the light , and the racing , is something not to be missed , it may even send you home with a smile .

Best Wedneaday Night In The World. The place to go if you love racing or just like the party atmosphere. For the horse lovers out there it can not be missed.It seems everyone in Hong Kong stops in to the Valley after work on a Wednesday. Night racing is something not to be missed. Cheap beer and food, and high standard of racing makes for a memorable night.

Totally a fun place to be on a Wednesday evening. Horse racing in the valley has evolved into a social event where people come to play hard. Aside from the hardcore betting that goes on throughout the evening, the younger hip crowds come to drink and socialize and sometimes even bet on catchy name. Food and beer on offer is inexpensive but of good quality. The crowd is fun and lively. All this for a nominal HKD10 entrance fee. Believe me when I say that some of the hottest people in the city come here just to see and be seen.The final races of the 2012-2013 season culminated with 26,000 people in attendance at the Happy Valley night race season finale.There was a record breaking turnover of almost HKD94 billion, up 10 percent over the previous racing year, and higher than previous best during the 1996-1997 pre-handover racing season.To get to the races which start at around 7pm and go on all the way till past 10pm; take an eastbound tram marked "Happy Valley". Fare is HKD2.30. Get off at the terminus, and walk about 300 meters to the entrance gate. Pay HKD10 and your in the thick of the action!

Classic East meets West experience. I was in Hong Kong for a conference and was taking out by some international colleagues to a one of the boxes above the main grandstand. We were treated to good bar service and a decent buffet. However, my takeaways were the heavy Australian accent of the announcer who was calling the race and the feeling the roar of the crowd - making it in my eyes an authentic spectacle - but also the electronic gaming desks, where young hosts/hostesses helped punters use this giant ipad like contraption to review the horses, jockeys and trainers to assist with your betting. A very entertaining evening!

Fantastic experience. You must visit this racecourse, even if like me you are not into horse racing. Great atmosphere, beautiful horses, great beers and food carts and a nice evening out with the rich people of the Hong Kong. Quite easy to place the bets. Really enjoyed the experience!

A night out at Happy Valley Race course. Brilliant, atmosphere inside and out.. We ate in one of the restaurants and the food was fabulous. In between courses we went outside to watch the races. Downside side was that it was really difficult to get a taxi afterwards, but I suppose that's everywhere when there's thousands of people trying to get home at the same time. Well worth a visit if you have a night free.
Great night out. A great place to visit for horse racing. Be sure to show your passport for special VIP tickets and race-side seating!

Must experience in Hong Kong. Happy Valley Race Course near Causeway Bay in Hong Kong is a must see attraction for tourist. Here you see locals, expats and tourists together in one place to enjoy the excitement of horse racing at its best. Money smells in this place and it transfers fast. You will truly experience one of the lifestyle of the Hong Kong people.

Go even if you don't like horse racing. Probably one of the best backdrops for a racecourse in the world and worth the entrance fee (HKD10) alone. Races from September to July normally on Wednesday evening 3 times out of 4, but days do change so best to check before going. One source is the South China Morning Post which provides a racing supplement on race days and normally helps to narrow the choice of picking a winner from the normal start of 12 horses. Entrance fee gets you in to the beer garden which on most nights is very lively with a great atmosphere and alternate entertainment in between the races. Beer and food are fairly priced and normally the cost of your evening is how much you want to gamble. Other alternatives available through the HK Jockey Club which provides food and drink packages for around HKD500 which again are fair value and in venues which provide less hustle and bustle than the beer garden. However, my preference is the atmosphere of the Beer Garden having a few beers with friends. Top jockeys are Douglas White, Brett Prebble and Mark Chadwick. Top trainers at HV are CH Yip and C.Fownes, but to be honest favorite number, colours or names work just as well work.Good luck !!

not for children but fun. the whole athmosphere, the people on their night out, the betting, the litle england left in Hong Kong part of thing. the crowd, the excitement. i did not go for the betting, was staying in the nice Holiday Inn hotel overlooking the track, but i went for the people, to look and see. like with a cricket match, the whole thing you cannot explain. when have time Go there, spend a day at the races

Great night out. Great night out and a must visit if you are going to Hong Kong. There are a few different choices for enjoying your evenings racing, the Stable Bend Terrace, with it's BBQ food and bottomless beer for £50.00 was a great night out, but so was The Gallery on the second occasion we visited the racecourse two weeks later.

Very local and much much........ Get there during Wednesday night or Saturday afternoon. Check the racing schedule before your visit as it may a bit change sometime. No racing day and night during summer break.

Wednesday night are awesome. Great Wednesday night out with amazing backdrop of the Hong Kong City Skyline.
Great mixture of expats, locals and tourists mingle in the famous beer garden, sipping a cold one, placing a bet and enjoying the atmosphere.
Great for all ages and a very inexpensive night out, a must in Hong Kong.
Checkout Happy Wednesdays Happey Valley on Facebook.
Enjoy
Great Fun. We went on a Wednesday night to Happy Valley Racecourse. Use you Octopus card for entry and buy drinks. We had a fun night.

Nice!. My first time to watch horse racing, it was nice but expect so much crowd as there's a lot of people watching and gamble so its very hot but its raining when were there so glad that we got a good seat to watch the race, there's kind of like beer festival also inside that you can buy clod beer while watching.
Great evenings entertainment. Food wasn't too great but the enthusiasm of the staff made up for it. Fun especially is there is a crowd of you.
Exciting. A real fun thing to do in HK.......Watch the locals concentrate on the races and watch the expats flirt....It's the best place to meet someone in HK.
First Class Entertainment. When visiting Hong Kong a visit to Happy Valley is a must!We did the Racing Tour Package with buffet and wine...It was terrific

Wednesday night is race night!. If you are there on a Wednesday evening, go! It cost $10HK to get in which is ridiculously cheap and you get a great nights entertainment. Even if you don't bet, you will enjoy the spectacle. It is a safe environment and if you don't have your binoculars (!), don't worry as the giant screen shows all the detail
Night at the races. Booked a tour for the races which included a buffet and drinks with access to a balcony for viewing the races. Very sad that 3 horses died during the event.

The best races you will ever go to. The night races at Happy Valley are a must. Such a party atmosphere. Foreign visitors can get a pass into the Members (must bring your passport along) and wander between The Beer Garden in the public area and the much better situated Members Area.

Worth a visit!. We went on a Thursday night. It's my understanding that typically the races are on Wednesday during the week. There are weekend races as well. Check the website for information on races. The atmosphere was fun. The crowds are a mix of serious gamblers and people there just to have fun. We bought the basic 10 dollar tickets (hk dollar). We arrived 15 min before the start of the races and had our choice of seats. If you go after the start of the races, you'll have a hard time finding seats. Inside the stadium there is a beer garden, McDonalds, and a few other food stands. I saw people bringing in their own food, which is a good idea if you're into healthy foods. In between the races there was live music. Overall it was a neat experience. Great for people-watching and fun. I highly recommend a visit!

Simply.....a great and unique night out!. What a fantastic night out! Thoroughly recommend this as a great way to spend a summer night in HK. Admission cost is cheap, there"s food, beer, music, entertainment and also....horse racing!

Great, free entertainment. We were lucky enough to be hosted by a friend living in HK who is part of a syndicate that owns a couple of horses so we were invited up to the owners floor for the evening. However we could see everything that was going on in the main concourse and it looked great fun. Our friend advised that standard entry is free, the beer is heavily discounted and there is usually free entertainment - we could see the concert shown on the big screen in between the races. Minimum bet is HKD10 (less than £1) so within most people's budget.Another friend (much younger) who lives in HK confirmed it was the place to go on a Weds evening before hitting Wan Chai or Lan Quai Fon later in the evening. The facility is really well maintained and would recommend as a fun night out for anyone in HK on a Weds night.

What a great way to spend an evening. The restaurant had a great view of the racecourse and you could go outside to watch the racing. The format is a buffet style for appetizer and dessert with a choice among different entrees.

Give the tourist badge a miss. Massive, 11 levels of rooms, mostly appear to be owners rooms and member lounges. Tried to book the tour with the buffet and unlimited drinks from our hotel and were very disappointed it was already booked out. Paid $100 HKD for tourist badge which really didn't let you in to many areas, ended up down outside in the general public near the beer tents, entry here is only $1 HKD and I wouldn't waste your money on the tourist badge. Electric crowd, live music, great night out in Hong Kong.

Packed, but exciting Wednesday Night Races. I've been to the Wednesday Night Races several times. Every time it has been packed to the gills. There are rarely any open seats or even open standing counters. This makes it fairly uncomfortable to go watch the races, eat or drink. This is the only reason I give it 4 rather than 5 stars. Otherwise, the races are great (favorites rarely win), the concessions are excellent (as far as concessions go), and it seems to be THE place to see and be seen on Wednesday Nights. Great for people watching.

You can go right up to the track and see the horses prior to running. There is such a neat mix of people. This was really a lot of fun. Betting is easy and automated - They let you see the horses up close before each race. Live music... Lot's of money and glitz... I ran into a couple US supermodels getting out of a huge stretch limo... Exotic cars - decent food...This was really a fun time.

Social point in HK for Expat. An attraction really not to miss in HK! Even if you dont like is a different experience, very interesting and a social point for all expat in HK. And it cost only 1 HKD to get in! No excuses!

Happy at the valley .. Our hotel was right next to the course .We were there for rugby reasons (the British Lions ) and to explore the city rather than horse racing but it seemed a Wednesday night Happy Valley experience had to be taken .This is one of the great world sporting venues even for non followers of racing like ourselves . Plenty of beer on offer and even gambling novices can part with a few dollars for the experience of seeing your horse fail miserably !The course is also open in the day with sports fields and jogging tracks although once around the track in 90 degree heat and nearly 100 % humidity is enough for both man and beast . Most surreal experience was watching London Scottish playing rugby against a Hong Kong side while jogging , hopefully they replaced the fluid they must have lost during the match in the usual rugby post match tradition.

Great night's racing. Recently, spent a Wednesday evening at Happy Valley on a tour I had booked through the Qantas website. We had a great night on this tour - great buffet dinner, beer/wine all inclusive. We were taken down to the finishing post and close to the horses. Would definitely recommend doing this even if you are not a racegoer.

Wednesday Night, the Night. One must experience the atmosphere of the Happy Valley Racecourse when there is a meeting, regardless if you love racing or not. To experience a race course in front of you and then your eye looks steaderly upwards to witness the skyscaper backdrop must be one of the sights of Hong Kong. If you want a quiter version, then walk around the race track during any day to take the air and have the fitness fanactics run pass you with beads of sweat dripping from them, but they enjoy that!

great night out for a beer and a bet. # 1 tip ... dont forget your passport if you are a tourist!we bought entry to the members area for HKD 100. however we are not really given a map or guidance on where we can go and where we can't, so we kinda stumbled into various areas and got told you can't come in. With the member's entry, there's really not a lot of extra area you can get into compared to the public entry. The biggest negative is that there is no 'bar' in the member area. The bars are in the public area, and the atmosphere is much better. The only reason you will spend the extra HKD 90 for the member area is that you can stand right in front of the finishing line, and get a lot more up close to the horses (and jockeys). However, if you are just there for a (few) beer and a (few) bet, then just spend the HKD 10 and have a great time!

Wednesday night tradition!. Came here with some locals on a Wednesday night. What an experience! It's truly a fun place to hangout, have a few beers, place a few bets and have a blast with your friends!
Loved it. This was a fab night out with family, cheap, interesting, entertaining and lots of fun would def recommend it to anyone

Indeed very interesting. I am not a horse fan, but I must admit, it's entertaining and interesting. What I was most astonished is how fast these horses are. Unbelievable. Try to have dinner there, you can place your bets in essence while you are eating.
HK at play once a week... Every Wednesday evening. No place like it...HKD 10 to get in and then you loose all your cash on the races...fantastic fun and atmosphere. Incredible location.

A must visit. Entrance fee is HKD10 through the main gate and for the VIP seats, non-members have to pay HKD100 (this doesn't come with a drink, etc.). Food and drinks are sold within the compound and there's also alcohol for booze lovers - beer and wine. This place has a really good vibe to it - people milling about, catching up with drinks and food in between the races. There are a few races per night, at certain intervals, so don't worry even if you go a little later as you'll surely be able to catch a race or two (and place bets if you so wish). Definitely a must visit when in Hong Kong.
Way to go!!!!!!. Spectacular view from grandstands and magnificent site. Well look after by the staff at the course. Very patient with visitors and treated really well
A must to have a true HK experience. Every Wednesday night there is a pop party in town and that is the races. We went for the cheap, general admission tickets rather than the boxes. So glad we did.

Great night. We booked a tour to the races with the HK tourism office that was down at the star ferry. It was a all you can eat and drink night with a betting voucher. The location was just fantastic and being picked up and dropped back off at our hotel was great It is about $108 AU each but was a must do for uws.

A fun weds night. A very unique race course in the middle of one of the busiest districts in HK. A must if you happen to be visiting Weds night. The staff is friendly and patient in placing your bet. lots of fun.

Great Wednesday night out!. We went here on a trip to Hong Kong in April 2012.We aren't ones to usually attend the races but had a great night out.We were completely overdressed (most people go here from work or were relaxed tourists).We liked that you could have a very cheap bet just for fun and how tight the track was so you could see a lot if the race.Worth doing.

great wednesday night out. for 10HKDs you can have a great wednesday at the races in HK. You get closer to the horses tthan anywhere else i know of when standing at the rails. There is a great atmoshere and often theme nights so it can be really good fun

Great Fun. I had seen the Happy Valley Racecourse on TV many times as I grew up, so Wednesday night at the races was always going to be a must-see. As we had friends also staying in Hong Kong, we decided to book the same Viator tour as they did, what a good choice. It does seem a little expensive as the racetrack is close to the ferry terminal on Hong Kong Island and the basic entrance fee is quite small. But for the £60 or so, you get coach transport to and from Kowloon right to the front door of the Hong Kong Jockey Club entrance. From here we were whisked up to a dining room high up in the main stand with an outside viewing terrace. Here unlimited drinks, wine beer or soft drinks were served before a superb hot buffet with a fantastic choice of hot and cold, vegetable and meat dishes were offered. A wonderful selection of sweets and gateaux were also available.The price also included betting vouchers for 3 races, we also had bets on the other races, both of us had winners and came away with a modest profit.For the 5th race we were walked down to the parade enclosure to watch the horses and jockeys close up, as they left the paddock for the race track we were escorted over to the finishing post to watch the race.This was an excellent night, it was great fun and the food was only surpassed by the electric atmosphere. A must-do for anyone in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night.

Better than UK courses. Great night out. A tourist pass was very cheap and gave access to the the parade ring and winning post. There was a live band between races and in my opinion better than any courses I have been to in the Uk.

good place to be with friends - and beer.. I go here quite regularly when I have guests in Hong Kong. I am fortunate to live on the island side so I can get the tram directly and this is also a typical Hong Kong activity you must not miss - so long as you aren't in too much of a hurry!We usually go in a group and get jugs of beer to share, quite reasonably priced for a touristy/expat venue. You can use your octopus card to enter, it costs ten dollars.

What an atmosphere. You must visit this racecourse. Best accessed by tram as the public enterance on the far side is not really that close to a train station, this place cannot be beaten for excitement, people (and horse) watching and atmosphere. The info desks under the grandstand will help you place a bet and the food is great for a large venue like this. Go on a Wednesday night as you can get right up to the guardrail on the track to see the thoroughbreds go thundering by. We walked for over an hour to get here from Causeway metro station but it was worth it.
Great fun. Its a nice place to gather with friends, bet for fun, have beer and then party at Wan Chai where ladies drink for free on Wednesday nights.
racecourse. Had a great night there. Paid hk$100 for tourist seating and able to stroll around. Accommodation just over the road. Also the 4 cemeteries opposite are worth a visit if you like history.
A must on a Wednesday evening. Good place to go for a beer and chill with friends when the races are on on a Wednesday evening. Definitely a must when in HK

must see. its a must see esp when the hong kong 7 gets going but beware the tickets for hong kong 7 are sold, believe it or not to full capacity six months in advance!!!!boy its crowded but the experience is unforgettable. lovely place to just walk around too.

Win a little lose a lot. Great event on wednesday, we went around 9pm, when the entry was free for all. The staff very helpful on how to place a bet, and the races were exciting. amazing place, big splat of green in an otherwise space hungry city. DO it if you are there on a wednesday

HK Jockey Club is iconic. The revenue that the HK Royal Jockey Club generates is incredible. Races on Wednesdays and Saturdays attract the locals for the entire racing session. The Shatin racetrack is on alternate Wednesdays, and Saturday races are always in Happy Valley. It is quite a place for tourists to see the hugh amount of bet on each race.
A Great Wednesday Night Out. My wife got a little bored, for me, I had a great time. Jugs of beer, people watching, horse racing with an amazing view all round.

Racing!. If you are into gambling or racing then the place is so worth it. If not, don't bother. The last few seconds before the finish line are always an adrenaline rush! The place is big enough n offers a lot of eating n alcohol options within. The bidding process is convenient and friendly. If you are not on a budget trip to HK, then losing 50HKD is worth the experience, for who knows you might end up making some too.

Top Night Out. Great night out on a Wednesday evening if you here - as a tourist and it also being a wet rainy night we chose to go for the $100 tourist badge which gives entry to the members enclosure and the parade ring and finish line and for what equates to £10 English money this is a great price for a night at the races. We also had the chance to visit on the Saturday afternoon meet which was great as there were almost 55,000 people there and the atmosphere is electric and if you choose general admission it is only $10 about 90p so who can go to the races for that in the UK and have the wonderful atmosphere of Happy Valley along with the fantastic view which is on offer. -

A must for any traveller. What a great night out! I can't believe I have been to Hong Kong 8 times and had never been to Happy Valley! Its a great night out whether you're into racing or not. To sit in the stands and see the horses race around the track with the skyscrapers in the background is a sight to behold! Happy Valley attracts locals, ex-pats and tourists and is entertaining and a must-do when you're in Hong Kong.

Happy days at Happy Valley. Went on a package tour with Splendid tours. Fantastic night. Pick up from Hotel, entry to members area, $30.00 betting voucher, Buffet dinner and complementary drinks. Highly recommend Splendid tours.
races on wednesdays. go to the racecourse wednesday evenings. use the public visitors entrance, the entry is only 10$. enjoy the races (every 30 min) and gamble a little...

HK Institution. Betting for money is not allowed in Hong Kong - unless it's organized by the HK Jockey club. Wednesday nights the race is on in Happy Valley and you should go and have a look. You will see lots of passion, very educated people who know their horses, jockeys and trainers. Best to go in a group. Traveler Tip:If you have anybody in HK who is passionate about the race,meets to try and join them! It's will give you an insider view.
Happyvalley. Amazing night! So cheap to get it, amazing atmosphere, lots of bars and places to grab food without huge queues, live music, views of hong kong skyline lit up at night, Fab!

POPULAR RACECOURSE. You can view this from the BIgBus Tour. if visiting Hong Kong first time you must take this tour by day and night. On board commentary. Don't forget to take headsets and raincoat when you get on board. Fabulous tour to do for getting to know Hong Kong.

A Hong Kong Essential - Must See. Is Happy Valley my new favorite place on earth? I wonder. I mean, for years, it was the Sierra Nevada mountains, then later, the Mission Ranch Restaurant in Carmel, California, but now I have to think it over. And I don't know a thing about horse racing. For a year I lived a half mile from Del Mar and never went. Truth is, I was in HK on business and thought of John LeCarre's cold war novel The Honorable Schoolboy, the story takes place in Hong Kong and one of the main characters spends a lot of time at Happy Valley. And It just happened to be a "Happy Wednesday" when they run the horses and I took a cab to the track, along with some co-workers who were willing to indulge me for a while. They ended up like the place as much as I did. As an American used to violent live sporting events in the USA, I thought to brace myself. The last time I went to a SF Giants game I practically had to fight a guy.
