But once I got to Happy Valley, I found it unlike anything I've experienced in the USA, and it was probably the turning point at which I began to fall in love with Hong Kong. I've now been to HK six times and have managed to visit the track on every trip. I love going there. I don't care if I lose money, I'm grateful to be alive and sitting in the stands. I love being at fun events with happy people, and I dislike violence, so HV is a good place. But there's much more to it.The track is gorgeous in every regard, it is amazingly beautiful. It's surrounded by skyscrapers, but is an oasis of greenery and gorgeous lighting. The place is immaculate and well run, and there's an absence of aggression and rowdiness. There's not a golf course in the world that compares to this gorgeous setting, and everyone, including the staff is happy to be there.There's a kind of beer garden trackside, below the stands, where you'll see a range of business types in suits and locals in casual clothes, just enjoying themselves as the horses run by, but again, no aggression, just nice people there to unwind. No bums, no thugs, no tattooed boneheads, it's un-American !!! The grandstands are multi-level, with basic seats and betting places, hamburgers, Chinese food, restrooms, etc. You enter this section from the street and admission is the equivalent of $1.50 US. You can take an elevator to the top level, with bird's-eye view of the entire track circuit. Or you can stop mid-level where there's a restaurant. There are many other sections and levels of the grandstands, it's quite extensive, some of which reserved for members of the Hong Kong Jockey Club, and some of which are accessible to non-members having dinner in the various restaurants in the stands. I'll let you know about the club seats after I win the lottery.The announcers speak in English and Chinese. These guys are so smooth, so mellow, they could make Julio Iglesias sound like Janis Joplin. It's all part of what makes Happy Valley a civilized, fun, positive, life-celebrating, intelligence and accomplishment-celebrating experience. Though it's not snobby, not at all.How to get there:-Take the MTR to Causeway Bay and take the Happy Valley exit(exit A), though you'll walk a long distance.-Take a cab right to the track. Cabs in HK are cheap and the drivers could win Daytona. Great way to go.-Take the "tram" (those funky narrow double-deck British looking electric buses) to the track. Cheap and fun.-DS

Great Racing. One of the great race tracks of the world. Fairly easy to get to in this compact city. Lots of history and Hong Kong Football Club located near by. Able to walk or jog on a path inside the race track. Can be hot if out in the sun.

A must for visitors to HK. I've been to "Happy Wednesday's" a few times and enjoyed each time. It's easier to get to than Sha Tin racecourse which is on the mainland. Recommend that you get someone to help with the betting if it's your first time as it can be quite confusing! Although once you have the hang of it the machines are easy to use.

Great Night at the Races. This how horse racing should be done! The Wednesday night meet at Happy Valley shows race clubs how to do horse racing well. Firstly it is so cheap. 10$ HK to get in, 2.30$ HK to get there.Beers cheaper than in most bars, food at reasonable costs. even McDonalds at normal costs.Races that happen every 30 mins! and entertainment in between each race. The night we went there was a very good band and a couple of very good magicians.The track is close to where you watch the event, in a stand, by the track or where the fun is in the Beer Garden. A brilliant TV screen, information all over the place so newbies quickly work out where to go or have a bet. Signs in English for the tourist!We also thought that the rule that you have to be 18 to come on to the course is very sensible. Race courses with the emphasis on gambling and drinking should not be a place for chn! All in all it is a great nights entertainment even if you do not bet! This is probably why they are so successful. Australia has millions of gamblers but except for a few very special dates, i.e the Cup or a day when Black Caviare was racing nobody turns up trackside. If racing in Australia was a bit more like this then people actually may go along and watch!This was the most enjoyable night and entertainment we experienced in a week in HK.

give it a try. even if you are not sure you like racing . just go for the athmosphere and the crowns and the experance. you will like. place a bet watch on the giant screen. as your horse comes in . betting is easy and the bars are open.
A Hong Kong must do. A Great evening out , enjoy the racing and lose money whilst having a fun time with enthusiastic gambling Hong Kongers.
Amazing sight, and free. Go when there isnt a race on, and marvel at the buildings around the racecourse. It's really spectacular. A good freebie if you are staying in the area.

Just Walk in. We caught the tram from Wan Chai to Happy Valley, as it wasn't a race day we could just walk in and look around for free. Was a peaceful oasis of locals participating in lots of sports which we could just wander through, it was interesting and very relaxing way to pass an hour or two.

What a great wednesday night at the races. Went here with friends on a wednesday night. Great beer tents and atmosphere. Had a few flutters on the horses, won nothing, however, the atmosphere, people and beer made up for it. The crowd is great, with a good mix of expats and locals making for a great evening. The course itself is amazing, and the location is spectacular. A must.

$10 entrance gets fun times!. A great place to go on a Wed evening in nice weather to enjoy the horse races, beer tents and atmosphere. And if you are a gambler, you can scratch that itch too. Though, it's worthwhile just as a spectator as well. You can get up close to the horses as well.The food is not fantastic, so it is sometimes better to eat before you go unless you prefer McD's, sausages or other unhealthy food.

Hopefully "Happy" If you back a winner. Any visitor to HK should experience the night meeting on a Wednesday at Happy Valley. The course is situated near Causeway Bay and can be accessed from the MTR at Causeway Bay,although it is a bit of a walk as you have to walk the whole length of the straight to get into the public area ($10hk)...First timers, I recommend a cab, and then walk back to the MTR as after the races you can leave via the members enclosure which seems to make it a bit easier. A visitor can buy a members ticket on presentation of your passport at the member's entrance for $100 but don't bother...There is a beer-garden in the piblic area and they have entertainment all night between races...Adequate fast food options are also available..Betting is easy if you keep it simple...most operators speak English and you can easliy place bets example "next Race..No.3 win $100" or Quinella box 4,5,10 for $50....never say please as you may finish up on Place or place quinella.....of course should you want a place bet or place Quinella that's a different story.Good luck with finding a winner.

Lots of fun at the race track. Went to the race track by tram from our hotel at Causeway Bay for the Wednesday night race. Was not able to get into the member area because of the dress code, no jeans. So paid 10hkd per person for entrance to public area. Lots of going on there, a band playing between races, wine tasting (special event on that day), beer and food stalls. Amazing sight of a race course in the valley surrounded by all the really tall high rises on the hill. Bet 100hkd on long shot and lost. But it was great fun.

Wednesday night racing at the Valley is a must-do for overseas visitors. Great party atmosphere, cheap beer and you don't have to bet big to enjoy a really fun night out. Check the racing calendar but most Wednesday night races are held at Happy valley.

Beautiful and exciting experience for amateurs. The entrance for tourists is located in Section G, the entry fee is only 10 HKD. The races start at approximately 7:15 pm and will run every 30 minutes. Food and drink are affordable, fast food is also available.
Happy Wednesday!!!!. It is a absolute must to do on a Wednesday. We got the Tourist pass for $100 HK. I dont think it was worth it. We werent allowed in many more places than the traditional $10 HK.

An excellent evening in the middle of the city.. I do not got to horse racing, I do not gamble on horses but I visit the horse racing at Happy Valley on Hong Kong island every time I visit the city during the season as it is an excellent night out. It is so user friendly easy to get to and there is always a buzzing crowd a trip to Hong Kong is not complete without an evening at the races!

Best night out big thanks to Viator Tours for organising so well. So pleased we included a trip to the races on our recent visit. We booked a package with Viator Tours to keep it all simple to organise and would highly recommend them. Picked up from the lobby of The Excelsior (which in itself was a good place for a drink) taken in a small group by mini coach to the Jockey Club enclosure where we were welcomed with a drink and shown to a table right by the window overlooking the course. Fantastic views. Nothing was too much trouble, the betting was explained, we had $30 each to bet included in the tour cost, we could see the racing from the large outside balcony or on the TV screens and all was made so easy and enjoyable. The buffet food was excellent and much better than we expected. Available throughout the evening so nothing felt rushed or limited. Endless wine was also included which was perfectly acceptable, chocolates, coffee, tea, really anything you wanted. They took us down to the parade ring during the evening, we saw the horses up close and then watched the race right by the ring at the finishing line .... no crowd, all looked after and personally escorted, really felt like a special night out. Even if you've never been to the races make sure you visit Happy Valley on a Wed or Sunday you'll really enjoy the night. And if you don't want any hassle we'd highly recommend booking with Viator. They took care of everything, we met some lovely people in our small group and the evening felt top class and not at all like a 'package'.
cheap night out. a race course in the middle of the city!!! great experience. plenty of food and drink options, theres a museum on site and its very inexpensive

Great. I didn't actually see any races there, but managed to peek through the fence and see the racecourse. This gave a good idea of what a race would look, feel and sound like - hundreds of dead keen Hong Kong people screaming and watching.

Love love loved our visit to the night races. My husband and I were lucky enough to have a friend in the racing industry in Australia who was able to get us tickets to the member's area. What a blast....these guys really take their racing and betting seriously!At first we were a bit confused about how to bet but there are instruction booklets and you soon get a hang of it. This event was one of the highlights of our HK trip....and we are not racing/betting people at all!

WIN WIN WIN. Every Wednesday there is horse racing game happening here. As a traveller, you must check this out. There will be mix asian and western crowd. You can buy beer inside. Recommend take off at MTR station causeway bay, and walk there. No taxi because the traffic will be blocked during those hours.

Great day out. My boyfriend and I stayed in Hong Kong in November 2012 and were told to visit Happy Valley on a race day, and we are so glad we did. The weather was lovely and the atmosphere was buzzing. Taxi didn't cost us too much but we were staying a little out of the way. I would certainly recommend a visit to this racecourse, it was a very enjoyable day.

start to a good night out. this place is the meeting spot for most expats on a wedensday night go any given week and there are expats everywhere mixing with the young locals and the serios punters up towards the finish post. get your self in to the beer garden for a tiny fee, there you can buy jugs of beer at reasonable prices and bet to your harts content.

The place to go for horse racing. This place has a much better atmosphere than Shatin and is easy to get to being in the heart of the city surrounded by hills and apartment blocks. There are the world's only multi-storey stables to look at too. Get there by tram.

Easy to access. It was fun betting on the horses, and drinking beer, It was Octofest, in November. There are many food booths to choose from, and choice of seats are numerous, and it only cost $10 HKD's to get in.

Brilliant evening's racing. A group of us spent a super Wednesday evening at the races. We were lucky enough to eat in one of the private restaurants on the course. Plenty of help from the staff to help us place bets, and loads and loads of fun.

A piece of greenery in the middle of high rises!. It is somewhat bizarre to come upon this piece of greenery especially as it is surrounded by tall buildings and cemeteries. However it serves a great purpose as it it is also a running track and other sporting activities and brings a meeting place in the middle of all the concrete.

It is just fascinating.... Chinese love to gamble .... The atmosphere is indescribable, so if you get the opportunity to attend the Races, even if you are not a race fan, go...It is unlike any race course anywhere in the West

Superb Track.. A top weeknight out in Hong Kong.Races from 7pm till 11 and they pack them in with an eight race card. Bands were playing, plenty of beer and wine tents and a lovely race track to boot. Great way to gear up for a night out in Wanchai or Central....

Great night out. For anyone interested in horse racing a trip to Happy Valley racecourse on a Wednesday night is a must do experience when in HK. Big crowds with a great atmosphere and they cater for all nationalties. Be sure to read the how to bet info if intending on betting as it is quite different to Australian betting,no bookies either just the tote

Must do event in H-K. Was invited so had the pleasure to be in a skybox with fantastic views including a nice buffet and more then excellent service from betting staff.What an amazing experience in fantastic new and modern accomodation , clean and everything super well organized.Something you must experience as tourist , check of there is a horse race planned and go and enjoy the fun and gamble a little bit too , staff is more then happy to help you.
An experience!. I am not a betting person, but we went along to experience the night-time racing, have a few beers and some fast food.

Good entertaiment!!. We live in Hong Kong and we go here when we have visitors to have a good time. It is so cheap and lots of fun. The price is ten hkd per person. If u don't know how to bet on the horses u can get help from the staff. It is very fun to gather some friend and bet a little bit of money or a lot. I mean the most fun thing is to look at those people who screams and shout as it was life or death. You can grab some food on mc Donald's or you can try the street food. You can buy a beer jug to share. They have live music in between the races. If u go here you will have a great time:)
Night at the Races. Truly amazing race track with huge grandstands, exellent facilities. Must be one of the largest tracks in the world.

Great night out. Great night even if you don't like the races. Take your passport to the members and you can get in there as an overseas visitor - about 100 HK dollars. Best place to get a beer is in the public enclosure in front of the track. Then take it back to the members for the best view.
Entertaining evening. Great place to mingle with others in HK. Enjoyed the outdoors and watching the horses. Never been to a race before and, though we didn't win, definitely had fun!
wednesday night is race night. you must go to the races every wednesday night it is an experience to be amongst ths locals and watch them bet, it is an experience well worth doing

Amazing experience not to be missed. HsppyValley rscacecourse was the first race trackin Hong Kong. It holds night racing most Wednesday nights & even if you are not a betting fan, GO! Its not expensive, transport is very good, and the atmosphere....well I go horse racing all over the world and this is an experience not to be missed, the HK tourist board will book it all, but you can do it independantly. Dont be put off by the throng of the crowd, just enjoy a fantastic evening, cold beer, food and amazing racing in a fantastic city

One of a kind location, and cheap. If you are in Hong Kong on a wednesday during the racing season (not summer), this is a great evening out. It takes more time, but its so easy to take any tram that terminates at Happy Valley (written in english on the front of the tram) and pick another one up for the trip back. Couldn't be easier - the terminus is across the street from the track - and its less than $1 US round trip. Add another $1 us for entry fee and you have a unique Hong Kong experience for next to nothing (assuming you don't bet or drink...)If you are not familiar with how the horse races work, you can come late and leave early, and you don't have to bet. if you do, the minimum is about $2.50 US a bet, but since there is only 10 races or so, you won't go broke.There is an option to sign in as a tourist (bring your passport) and get access to the members lounge (about $12 US), which sounds better than it turns out because all the seats are reserved and the area is dominated by semi-intense local bettors. I had a lot more fun down by the trackside beer garden with all the international expats. Theres also different levels of food available, from Mc Donalds on up, so something for everyone.

Happy Horsing!. Great set up to view and bet at the races in Happy Valley. Attached bar and resto do a great job of helping people enjoy the race, great views of the race course and good food...lovely time

LOVE IT!. It was our first stop in Hong Kong and one of our favorites. Wednesday night is so much fun, it has a huge drunken young expat scene down by the track on the ground floor you can just start chatting up all the people and drink with them and bet and talk and scream for "Daddy's Overdraft" or Drink no more" or whatever your favorite horse is called. Loved it, had a great night, met some cool people, broke even.
Nice atmosphere. Visited wednesdayevening. Good place to have a beer outside and watch the races. Ofcourse possibilities to gamble and get involved.

Great entertainment. We went to The Gallery restaurant on a Wedsnesday racing night at Happy Valley. What a great way to spend an evening. The restaurant had a great view of the racecourse and you could go outside to watch the racing. The format is a buffet style for appetizer and dessert with a choice among different entrees. The food choices were really good and the buzz and activity in the restaurant added to the excitement of the racing?If you are not familiar with the betting process, the staff is really helpful in getting you started and keeping you on track. Great evening.

The way to spend a Sunday. If you do not mind loosing a few HK Dollars, then it is nice way to spend a Sunday.Watching the way people are dressed, eatin Strawberries and drinking ice cold Champage in compagnie with a gorgeous girl,That is life.

Beer and Bets!. Happy Valley is a great experience if you want to see horse racing and gambling at it's Chinese best! They serve beer and food and therefore you can have a fun night out.For me as a not so experienced horse racing gambler the bets are confusing so it's always best to go with a seasoned professional who can explain all the different types of bets.You can't beat the rush of following the horses you have selected to win though so it's well worth the trip!

Unforgettable Experience. I wanted to visit Happy Valley for years, and finally made it there in January 2013! Smaller than Sha Tin (New Territories), but a lot more energy! The expat. area is a cross between a race track and a carnival. DJs, beer tents, kebab stands, a totally different race track experience. The track itself is beautiful, all turf races and there are information booths to assist you if its your first time placing bets in a Hong Kong racetrack. All in all, one of my best Hong Kong experiences. Plan your trip so that you are in Hong Kong on a Wednesday. An evening at Happy Valley is an absolute must experience!

So much fun!. Despite spending my youth around horses, I had never set foot in a racecourse before Happy Valleyl. What an experience it was! Amazing energy, happy people, good food and beer and of course the excitement of maybe betting a little - I never even tried to win, but rather bet on the horse with the coolest name. Never won, surprisingly, but had a damn good time!
Wed Race it's a must. Nice atmosphere for have a drink and some fun with friend... it's very popular and you can bet if you like it!
A good evening. Went here during our trip to Hong Kong, paid the extra to get in to the members enclosure as a tourist. Thoroughly enjoyed the evening

Great fun and excellent entertainment. This was a treat for my husband as he likes racing. I have never been to the races before - but this was an excellent evening out as there is so much more going on beside the horses/riders. There was music and competitions and the races, loads of food stalls and it was so easy to bet - even though we do not speak chinese. There was always someone to help us. We only won a very tiny sum (less than 25p) but it was such fun trying to work out the form and placing the bet and the races are so quick you don't have to wait long to see if you were right - most of the time we were not ... but it didn't matter. I enjoyed the atmoshpere.

A must for any Sports Fan. Make the effort on a Wednesday night, catch a tram or a Taxi, to Happy Valley, pop your $10 coin in the turnstile or swipe your octopuss card and enter a wonderful sporting arena. I have enjoyed thouroughbred racing in Australia for over 30 years and was not going to let this opportunity slide during my recent brief trip to Hong Kong. Regrettably kids are not permitted into the racetrack.I had planned to pay the extra $100HKD to enter the members concourse but I was more than happy enjoying the atmosphere of the public area. A broad spectrum of punters in attendance, numerous food and "beer" options (I am not entirely sure if there was anything other than beer available) There was a Heinekin tent, Stella Artois tent, San Miguel tent etc.... High Granstands and scryscrapers envelope this short lush track which sees the field of horses pass the main straight and finishing post twice in even the shortest of races giving the crowd plenty of opportunity to view and cheer on their selected pony. The mounting yard is enormous and accessible in terms of opprtunity to view the horses as they enter the arena. I could not find a betting ring with private bookies anywhere. All bets are placed with a central betting authority with numerous booths around the public area. The betting slips and race info screeens are easy to follow if you know a bit about horse racing. If you don't, there are attendants hovering around the the betting booths carrying clipboards assisting tourists to complete their betting slips. DJ's play tunes between races which are generally 20-25 minutes apart unless there is a protest. A protest will see the race meet stop until the stewards adjudicate. Head to the Devil's Advocate in Wan Chai for a pint on your way home.

Fab. What a great night. I don't know anything about racing and was lathe to go after a busy day sight seeing. It's full of people from all walks and the informal dress code makes it so appealing. It's easy to get to and cheap to go in. I used my octopus card for entry. I didn't know how to complete the betting slip, but just ask anyone and they'll help you. I won about 100 HK dollars and although its not a lot the buzz was great. It's a must do attraction.

Must do. This is a must-do experience in HK. The atmosphere is electric and it costs next to nothing. About £1 to get in and the minimum bet is the same. Unfortunately this year when we were there it was pouring. But you just can't dislike this place. A racecourse set in the middle of skyscrapers, what more can one want. Just to watch the locals is amazing - they don't even watch the races, their noses are buried in the racing papers for some tips on the next winner. If you want to do it properly, take the tram there - just leave plenty of time as they can be busy, but worth the wait.

Could be better. Great night out but we were caught out when they stopped taking card payments with 4 races to go. We used th Adrenalin bar where for a fee you get. Very comfortable table outside , and an uncrowned bar and buffet that served very good Italian food. Well worth spending the extra.

Take the tram. Even if you're not going to the races or even interested in the horses, take the Happy Valley tram. It does a circle around the race course. The terminal (layover point) is half way round and it's worth walking around the nearby streets.

Suprisingly Great Night out!. On our recent trip to Hong Kong, at my partner's special request, I organised for us to spend an evening at the Happy Valley races. I booked the tour for this through Viator which offered cheaper prices than those offered by our travel agent. I am not very interested in racing but my partner is a keen punter so I went with very low expectations. To my suprise, we had a really terrific evening. We were taken by bus to the race course and then escorted to an eighth floor box by the tour guide. We were assigned a table and introduced to our fellow guests, all of whom also came from Australia, but who had been travelling throughout Asia and had plenty of interesting things to share with us about their travels. The evening included a buffet dinner which was of very good standard, with a wide variety of both Western and Asian choices. Drinks were also included and were offered frequently by the very attentive staff. The tour also included a HK$30 betting voucher and race guides which gave all the information needed to place bets. The dining room opened on to a large balcony from which all the races could be viewed. Around half way during the meeting, our guide escorted us downstairs into a track side area where we could view the horses parading before the race. This was located close to the finishing post and we could watch this race from there and really be close to all the excitement! Overall, it was an excellent evening - good food and drink, great company and the opportunity to spend time at a very uniquely located race course. The only bad thing about the night was that the Aussie jockeys let us down badly, with only one win for the night!

Fun fill day at Race. see if you can crash the <Membership only Club House--do not tell them I say so! Great food and best service. Check out local neighborhood of Happy Valley with good local bakeries and dining spots. Just a glance of middle class life in Hong Kong. Don't be shock by the expensive real estate prices--it is the NORM.
International Class Racecourse. It is a nice racecourse with the nice view from the restaurants. The chinese restaurant also accept public reservation but of course HKJC members with priority.

Do it!. Cheap, fun way to experience a HK institution. Grab a beer and get some advice from the very helpful English-speaking attendants on how to place a bet. Pay $10 to go into the general admission area or take your passport and pay $100 to get into the members enclosure. We took a taxi over from Kowloon which was inexpensive There is a $10 extra charge for the harbour tunnel. On the way back getting a taxi took a little while and when we did the driver added $65 for the tunnel! I challenged it and told him we were only paying $10 which he reluctantly accepted. Not sure whether that was a one-off or a regular scam so be cautious!
Great atmosphere. A must in Hong Kong, well worth a taxi ride to the race course, cheap to get in, great atmosphere and the course is right in them middle of the high rise.

Great atmosphere. I really enjoyed just wandering around the track, as an isolation from the craziness that is HK. People exercising in this public space makes it a nice place to spend a while without spending any money!
The real Hong Kong. See people at their most natural here. Somehow, every punter, wherever from, feels connected to the other and the atmosphere is electric.

Wednesday night at the track. the track is a fun outing. mainlanders have sullied the experience a little but overall, the happy valley racecourse is well set up and has a very good selection of food and viewing. one of the few courses you can still hunker up to the rail and watch the horses run by. Great Wednesday night event.

Fabulous night out. Wonderful night out. Exciting, friendly and full of atmosphere. Locals really happy to help out. Can't recommend food, but probably OK if you know what you are ordering! Buy your beer by the jug, much cheaper. Hope you back more winners than us, but If not just enjoy it.

Great moment!!!. We live just on the edge of Happy Vally racecourses and we still go there once a month. The ambiance is electric, it is very easy to bet (very small and huge amounts of money), you can seat or stand up close to the racecourse. You have many food shops (even a macdonald!) et many beverages and beer (not very expansive) stands!!! It's a wonderful place to go with friends to have a drink, very convenient to enter, you have to pay 10HKD at the entrance with your octopus or by cash.Except for the off season, you have racecourses almost every wednesday.It is an Institution managed by Hong Kong Jockey Club.Don't miss this event!!

Such a fun evening!. Even without knowing anything about horseracing we had so much fun. There are beer tents and food to eat while you are there. Live music and lots of laughs. Don't bother paying the extra money becasue you just end up sitting up really high. Go for the public entrance and wander around. It is fantastic!
Good evening out.. Good evening out fascinating even for non gamblers. very inexpensive, get a two litre jug of lager and a burger for under ten pounds. Bet from one pound up.

HK Institution. This place is worth seeing if you want some insight into HK society. It's full of restaurants, and there's quite a buzz on race-night. At night, under the spotlights, it's a great sight to behold.
No Children. Very nice but not for familly no children below 18 yes 18. The place was so nice for the race and very funny. Attention pas d enfants de moins de 18 ans dommage si bien comme endroit.
Crowded!. Bypassed it but did not go in and from what we can see, the people of Hong Kong love their races!! Happy Valley is always packed and a good experience for tourists.

Good racing... But a bit cheap. Clearly the buzz of the races, surrounded by the glittering lights of Happy Valley's buildings and hotels, makes this a must see. Having a small flutter is a easily accessible thrill, with many stewards on hand to explain the betting slips to novices, and 'hot picks' and odds being highly visible. However, the hoardes of seasoned old men, spitting on the stand and queue-jumpers, limited food options and flat beer from plastic jugs makes this one of the least classy race meets you'll come across. Cheap, mostly cheerful and the chance to win... Enjoy!!

Unique racing experience. I visited Happy Valley for the Jockeys challenge meeting at the beginning of December. Like most Happy Valley races this is a Wednesday evening meeting under the floodlights. I paid the 100HK$ to go in members (available to tourists if you show your passport) but the general entry of 10HK$ also gives access to excellent viewing areas.In my experience Happy Valley is a unique racing environment. The track is closely surrounded by high rise blocks, the stands are built very high, but because they are close to the track this simultaneously creates the feeling of a major but very intimate racecourse with a stunning cityscape background. In short it's a lot of fun.The Jockeys challenge is a bit of harmless fun where the locals get to see some top European riders up close and the tourists get to see how good the locals (and locally based Aussies) are.For the record, the beer was cold, the hot chicken legs were fantastic and I had a great night on the punting (Thanks Christophe LeMaire and Zac Purton) but tried not to let this colour my review too much.

Go into the members section!. Check the internet for races, or if you are lucky you will see signs around Central station (on Hong Kong Island) for any upcoming races (every Friday?).Entry is 10HKD for the general admissions area, but if you have been in HK for less than 21 days you can get into the members section. Bring your passport along, go to gate E (members entry) and line up for your ticket. Cost is between 100 and 150 HKD depending on the race, and it allows you entry to levels 1 and 2, in and around the finish line and mounting yards, as well as into the public arena. Great experience if you get to a night meeting!

The Racing. I specifically travelled to Hong Kong for the International races and my first xperience was Happy Valley for the Jockeys Challenge meeting. This was just an entree to Sha Tin for International Race Day. Both were the experience of a lifetime for a Racing entusiast !

Great Night Out in Hong Kong. We visited in December and had a great evening, it is really cheap and cheerful to get in and with all the floodlights it feels like it is the middle of the day, we enjoyed our evening and left before the last race to ensure we got a taxi but would recommend it as a good night out.
Wednesdays. The only legal form of gambling in hong kong is on the horses. The ambiance on race day is quite extraordinary. make sure you go on a raceday. you wont regret it.
Happy Valley. Go every year and it never disappoints, the chinese certainly know how to run things, cheap to get in, no queues reasonably priced drinks - great company. Trains run frequently.

Historic and Iconic Venue.. I have been to the Happy Valley Racecourse twice now and love it. Unfortunately I have not been able to enjoy a race meeting but I will at some point.Enjoy the free museum although they are iffy about photos and eating etc...Once you have finished looking around, go up to the 3rd floor and go outside into the course. I'm not even a Horse Racing man but it's well worth a look.

OMG - What a night out. You MUST experience this night out and for 10hk$ (Less than £1) the atmosphere is electric. This was the last night of the German beer festival and we met some fantastic people including a family of American tourists which made the night memorable. Easily found and even the Tram goes to the Happy Valley terminal just two minutes walk from the race course.

Magical Night Racing. Surrounded by high rise apartments HV is like a diamond glowing in the night. The private boxes are excellent value with a sumptuous buffet and the racing is close as the course is not too large.
Visitors can gain attendance to reserved areas with production of passport.

Interesting time - booking with the Jockey Club seems to offer the best options. We went to Happy Valley twice. Once as an international visitor, showing our passports and the second, booking directly with the Hong Kong Jockey Club. The visitor option costs $100HK and gives you access to the lower level members area. It is very congested and can be hard to find a place to sit, particularly if you want to eat. The second occasion we booked directly with the HKJC and paid $210HK. This gave us a pre-booked seat, over looking the racecourse, access to buffet and unlimited soft drink, tea and coffee.The accommodation was better and each table had its own TV monitor to watch the race. Overall it offered the best value.

Outstanding night at the races. Whether a race fan or not this is must do, atmosphere is great. Beer tents line the racecourse and it is quite quick and easy to get served unlike some Aussie racetracks.Definitely don't have to be a race fan to enjoy the night. Make sure you try the chicken kebabs though they were outstanding!Not on the MTR line which is a pain but trams go to nearby stations.
40th Birthday celebration!. We had a VIP package for about £50 pp which was a buffet adn wine/drinks all evening. fabulous place to go racing!!Staff very helpful and what a view!

Fun night out. Cheap public access, turn up and pay 10hkd at the turnstile. Beer and food available inside in atmospheric short course. Worthwhile visit to see local passion. Traffic snarled up getting there and getting back. We walked back into town to catch a diverted bus that avoided race traffic leaving

A Fun Night Out With The Ponies. Happy Valley is the place to be on Wednesday nights in Hong Kong. A fun place to be with an electric atmosphere for a little gambling or just to watch the races. An inexpensive night out and a very unique experience - a must do if you're ever in Hong Kong.

After Happy Valley Try These. Lots of people have written about their night out at the Happy Vallet racetrack in downtown Hong Kong, just near Wanchai/Causeway Bay.Yoiu can take an organised tour (about $US120) booked through Viator or the HK Tourist Board, or make your own way there (perhaps on the Happy Valley tram which drops you outside of the door.The organised tour will pick you up at a Tsim Sha Tsui hotel (the YMCA in Salisbury Road) or on ther island at the Excelsior Hotel at Causeway Bay, The cost includes a guide, transport, admiussion, racebook, buffet meal, a $HK30 betting credit, free flowing drinks, and a stroll down to ground level at the mounting yard. All very painless, but you do have to wait until after the second last (of ten) races before you can head home if your want to ride back in the bus.Or find your own way there - it's quite easy and inexpensive (take your passport) and you will get some good deals at the members' Entrance.

Cheap fun night out. We went to the races and had a great night. As advised we took our Passports and got into Members stand. We had Roast Duck and rice for $35 HK and it was very tasty and filling. We had good seats in the stand right in front of the finish line. The paddock was fun with a live banRecommend it highly as a fun, different, cheap night out. Easy to get to on DingDing tram and back to Hotel in Taxi.Also fun to walk around in the morning, lots of locals training, walking and doing Tai Chi.

Gambling & Fun. During my semester abroad I was almost every second or third week at Happy Valley! It's absolutely fun to gamble.There are about 10 races per evening. Each races starts at quarter to and quarter past. Between the races you can gamble :) For risk-avoiding people: Bets start at 20HKD (2€). Therefore you have "no" risk and the races are much more exciting.Beer very cheap. 0.5 liters for 35 HKD (comparison: 0.25-0.33 in random bars in Wan Chai or Lam Kwai Fong 50-80 HKD!)
Huge and clean!. we managed to take a look at the racecourse, and it is beautiful! the horses were remarkable creatures too! worth a look see if staying in the area

Get yer' Bet on!. Really one of the funnest times we had in HK... Wednesday nights! Don't miss it. The programs are extremely well layed out, lots of information. Easy to place bets and just the atmosphere is so electric, you don't have to bet to have fun. Grab a beer, stand by the side of the track, watch the horses run by.
Excellent business lunch. The atmosphere is formal but nice. Professional service and food was very tasty. Price is reasonable considering quality
For Horse Lovers A Must. Hong Kong locals love their betting. Greatly organized. Amazing horses and races. Worth a visit even if you dont bet.
check before you go. check before you go , we went to find the course was closed , so do look on line first , take your passport and this will get you a better seat and upgrade to the members areas

An oasis. Our hotel room overlooked Happy Valley and being fans of horse racing, it made a great view to look at each morning. The centre of the track is open to the public each day as it contains sports fields and a running track. So of course we had to run around it each day and take in the size of the stands - huge! We also went to the races one night. We thought about it too late and all the dining and seating packages were sold out, so we had to make do with the ‘beer garden’ right beside the track. It was great being so close to the track but it got a little squishy at times. Therefore, I highly recommend pre-booking in one of the restaurants or at least something in the stand. Would I go here again? Definitely!

Wednesday Night Fun. Happy Valley is Hong Kong's Jockey Club. Most racing is done on Wednesday. Lot's of crowds. Lot's of cheering. Good fun. It was easy to bet, but difficult to win. My horses kept coming in dead last!

See it everyday. Well my hotel room overlooks the Race Course...have to say it was really nothing special at all. Unless you are into horse racing, as apart from that it's just like any other race course

If you love horse racing this must be on your bucket list. As an avid horse racing enthusiast who has sold a horse into Hong Kong, a trip to Happy Valley was always on the bucket list. Coming from South Africa where horse racing attendance has dwindled over time it was fantastic to see so many people actually attend a meeting. I was lucky enough to be entertained in the Stewards/members dining room. What a treat - food was ample and tasty and service (both from the waitrons as well as the staff in the tote) was fantastic. But you are really there for the atmosphere and it was something I have never experenced before - around 40 000 people just for an average race meeting. For those who don't know the course, it is much shorter and tighter than the English, French and American tracks which leads to exciting finishes and nerves of steel from the jockeys. Some great finishes and good riding from the South African jocks made for a memorable night and an event I would like to repeat again
Best racing experience EVER!. Buffet great value for money overlooking the straight. Had so much fun. Best to go in a group of people. Staff friendly and helpful

Happy Valley not so happy anymore... Our last visit to Happy Valley Racecourse was in 2007 where we enjoyed a fantastic evening, great buffet, great service, great location on the 8th floor close to the winning post but what happened....We returned there again two weeks ago and how things have changed. We went on the same tour with the same company reading the same speal on their marketing material. We jumped at the opportunity to go again because of the great times we had had before. We ended up on the 4th floor, close to the bend well away from the finish post. The buffet was 1/4 the size of the last time we went and we had to keep chasing a waiter for a drink. I don't know if this was a one off for renovations or what but if you book, be sure to ask before hand where you will be located. Luckily the company was just as wonderful with strangers having a great time with strangers even though we couldn't understand each other sometimes. It was worth it for the company but I'll ask next time where we will be located before we book.

Happy Valley Racecourse. What a fab evening we had here,not a racing person myself but we went along with our friend,had something to eat there(not much variety) then had a flutter for fun!!! A great evening for something different.

fun. THE hote are nice and taasty better than usa, thos greese one you find evere where
The horse are really beautiful

A Wednesday night must. Arriving after a long travelling day at our Hong Kong hotel at 5pm on a Wednesday, we debated whether a trip to the races was a good idea, but caught the tram and set off. We paid our tram faresmall admittance wth our Octopus card, a particularly good buy if like us youar emore than 65, enjoyed the ambiance and felt that ur holidays had really started. It was well worth the effort. Either a very plush restaurant or basic food stalls are the food options.

drawing in the younger crowd. We bought tickets to the club room called Adrenaline, it aims to draw in a younger crowd into racing and has a nightclub feel to it, they have various events on during race days. We were there for Oktoberfest, with a german food buffet. There are electronic tables to place your bets on and other games throughout the night. The view over Happy Valley is fantastic and the box is set about 100 metres to the left of the finishing post!

A great evening in Hong Kong. Well worth a visit even if gambling is not your thing. The atmosphere is energizing and you can have a lot of fun watching the crowd – a very mixed bunch! The setting is also beautiful with the stunning skyline at the background. Bring your Octopus-card, you can use it to pay for entrance at the public gates. Races are on most Wednesday nights, but check the calendar at http://www.horseracing.com.hk/calendar.htm.
Wedding dinner. Intimate wedding reception. Food was quite tasty from appetizers (basket of yummy bread and butter) to main course and dessert.
race to win. Ambeince is really nice. enrgetic for the richhi rich. We grabeed a sub way sandwich and moved aroun the palce and checked the property prices for skyline apartments
What great fun - especially when you win!. This is a fun evening to rub elbows with the elite of Hong Kong and perhaps win a few HK$. Best way to do this activity is via the Hong Kong Jockey Club.

A must do when staying in HK. Mostly runs on Sundays and Wednesday go there around 6/7 Pm and enjoy the race course and betting on horse. I am not a gambler but it is a fun experience since happy valley is "niched" in the middle of tall buildings and hills of causeway bay.

Happy Valley Evening!. Loved it! The nicest race-course that I've ever visited, it has a cosy atmosphere nestled amongst the tall buildings that surround it. Spectators are able to stand quite close to the track so an excellent view of the horses is assured. Snacks, drinks and toilet facilities are readily available. The admission price is low and it's only a short taxi from central.

One of a kind racing venue.. What a great atmosphere, night racing, surrounded by high rises, get right up next to the track. You can also book a box or a table on the bend. Because of the shorter track the horses are not group 1 standard, but it doesn't matter or spoil the experience. A must if your in Hong Kong on a Wednesday night.

Amazing in the center of Hong Kong. Brilliant got a tip from the Taxi driver that came in at 6:1. Had dinner and drinks at the course with friends. Grub great and as much drink as you want for the cost of your entry ticket.

Horse Racing plus a meat lovers delight buffet. The fun and excitement of horse racing plus plenty of food and unlimited wine and beer. Unlike most buffets this one has a paucity of veg but a plethora of protein: steak, sausage, ribs, roast pork, lamb, chicken and a bit of shrimp. Tables are on a balcony above the race track situated between betting windows and the rail. You are provided with a booklet showing the horses for each race along with history of past performance, monitors show betting statistics and there are people to help you place your bets. Placing $20 bets on each of the eight races gives you the feel of being a big time gambler at a total cost of less than US $25. While there is a charge for entrance and dinner it is a bargain for over three hours of fun.

Amazing Wednesday night watching the Geegee's!. The racecourse is a great night out, with a really fun atmosphere. They had Octoberfest celebrations on too when I went, so not sure if this made it busier than normal, but even with all the people you still had time to get a drink, see the horses before you put your bet on and then get back out for a prime spot over the finish line. The staff were friendly and helpful and helped me fill out my form so that I was putting the bet on as I intended. We payed 100 HK Dollars to be in the members enclosure which I thought was fairly cheap compared to what I have paid in the UK and we got some great views over the finish line as the horses went past, but apparently you can go in to the public section for just 10 HK Dollars. I expected to have to wait ages to get a taxi as everyone floods out at the same time after the last race, however we just walked up a side street across from the race course and had a taxi to whisk us away in just 5 minutes. Brilliant night out, especially when you win as I did. :-)

Giddy Up - and get along. I have been to Golden Wednesday several times now and have never failed to have a fantastic time. The location of this racecourse is off the scale - with all the high-rise buildings standing round the course like spectators with hundreds of eager gambling eyes. The atmosphere is always electric - what with the local obsession with gambling, and the fact that you can get right up along the grass just adds to the fun. HK$10 for admission - so you can spend the rest of your money on the horses.
Happy Valley Racecourse. An awesome venue buzzing with people and excitement. A great place to soak up the culture and a few beers.

Disappointing as no racing. Walked miles to get there, placed our bet and then discovered the reason for the small crowd - we'd made the effort to go, pity the horses hadn't bothered! Turned out the racing on the big screen was being held elsewhere! Obviously live, as betting going on, but a huge disappointment as zilch atmosphere. So double-check it's a race night before going. - we didn't even think of it as we went on a Weds which is supposed to be the big night.

Go for the atmosphere - but public areas can be very crowded. Happy Valley on a Wednesday night in October - is an amazing experience. Even if you don't like horse racing - it only costs $10 to go in the public entrance and you could just watch a couple of races and go out. However if you want a seat - get there early. It helps if you are in a group so that someone can keep your seat for you if you go to the food outlets/bars/loo/or to place a bet. Westerners tend to congegrate near the entrance where there aren't many seats - but there is a beer garden.However it can get very crowded indeed - especially October thru December with queues for drinks and real congestion near the entrance where you can be jostled and if you are claustrophobic and don't like that sort of thing I don't recommend it.If you are not familiar with the tote system of betting - then there are helpful English speaking guides at the information desks who will explain how to do it. If you don't like the sweaty crowds and want a more exclusive experience - then there are various ways of getting a race badge for the members' enclosures - and some boxes will have their own bars and catering. I believe this can be arranged through local tour companies, or travel desks at hotels. However the easiest way to do it - is to go to the members' enclosure with your passport and pay HK$100 for ordinary meetings and HK$150 for special meetings. Check the Jockey Club calendar. There is a dress code for the members' enclosure however - generally no jeans, t-shirts, sports shoes, shorts etc. A collared polo shirt with slacks and shoes (with socks) is fine for men - and generally smart casual attire for women is OK.Watch the totalisator and see how much money is bet on each race. A staggering amount.

Wed night watching the ponies is a MUST!. You can't ask for a better night out on the town. I recommend Adrenaline Club for an exciting night of watching the ponies. CX also has a great club level to enjoy a meal and watch one of the best shows in HK!!

Great Night out. Great experience even for non gamblers like me. Arranged a tour through Viator for approximately $125 AUD per person. The tour company that took us to Happy Valley was Splendid Tours included transfers from Hotel, buffet dinner and drinks buffet including wine, beer and softdrink. Had a fantastic view of the racecourse from the dining room and was given a complimentary $30 HKD gambling voucher. For one of the races was given the opportunity to go down to the track at the finish line. A good night was had by all, strongly recommend!

Restaurant Suite had limited views. The track is great and very nice. An oasis in the City. The suite we booked for work was well down the track so views of the finish line were limited. I found the cashiers very helpful in booking exotic wagers, as I had not done that in Asia previously. I'd go back for sure.
First time at horse races. This was GREAT fun and the horses are beautiful! We really enjoyed an evening out watching the races and enjoying the breezes in the heart of Happy Valley.
Take your passport enjoy the night. Make sure if you are visiting that you take your passport and for 100 HKD you get access to the members are, it is well worth it.
Friendly for new bees. I was completely new with horse races, but friendly staff helped me and explained what to expect and -of course- how to gamble a little money.
Best place on a wed night in Hong Kong. When you come to Hong Kong this is a cant miss place on wed night for racing. There is such energy that you always go away happy.
Fun at the races. My trip to Happy Valley was my first experience of horse racing, and i loved it. The crowds, the excitement ,the horses what a great night out !

Interesting evening out. If you've never been to a racecourse in your life I'd give this a go, but for me, it was full of drunk English and Aussies. The actual track and evening is quite a decent event, but as an English person abroad it made me cringe seeing so many Ex-Pats getting hammered and I didn't stay long before I called it a night.

Interesting. I would advise anyone who is into horseracing to join a tour there as you will be sitting in the members lounge enjoying air conditioning and a nice buffet. Staff there is attentive and patience to all of your questions. I don't gamble, but I have a good time there.

Tourist version. Horse raising is one of the if not the most loved sports in Hong Kong! Hey! Winning money is involved so why not? :)There are races at different days as well as eve's organised. I went on the Wednesday eve one which is most popular and I believe useful for tourists. If you stay in HK for longer time you can also book a table at some of the higher levels of arena combined with betting and the dinner.However if you are in HK for a short visit and you happen to spend Wednesday whilst here, go for the horserace. Cheapest entry is HKD 10 and you get to the first level where the horses are actually running. You can put your bets and if you don't understand much of it, don't worry and ask stuff for advise. They are really helpful and explains how the whole thing is working.It was amazing event with quite a crowd (tourists and local "regular" attendants to see and experience the feeling or just to win some cash. I end up losing, however did not bet much whereas my friend won some money enough to get 2 cocktails for us later.Start your night out in Happy Valley! I wish you to win some money and enjoy the rest of the night out in central (both when chai and lang kwai fon is close by! :)

Great night out. This was my second visit to Hongkong and I was keen to visit the races as we missed it on our last trip. We were going to take a tour to the races but it happened to be fully booked. We were advised it was very easy to do on your own so we gave it a try. You cant miss Happy Valley on race night simply follow the throngs of race goers heading to the Stadium. From Causeway Bay head to the far end of the stadium to the Public entrance, there are multiple turnstiles to enter the stadium and you can use your Octopus card if you have one entrance is very very cheap in comparison to the uk.On entrance you will be met by staff handing out race cards and information, do not feel worried about putting on bets at each of the outside kiosks there are staff helping you complete the forms and explaining the bets. There is a lovely atmosphere in the public area, between each race there was a band playing. Lots of food and beverage outlets including McDonalds to grab a bite to eat. You will get a large mix of tourists and locals many who have come straight from work in their suits to catch the night races.As darkness falls you appreciate the sheer scale of the stadium and all the lights twinkling.If your stuck for something to do in Hong Kong give it a go
Horses in a modernize city. Feel the strange atmosphere in the middle of the stony forest. I'm not gambler but I love animals. Stunning in horse race days, quiet and lay back after race.

exciting. its very exciting when u see the horses race
crowded of local and European which make the environment very lively and fun
donate to horses gamble
theres no tourist vip members section for happy valley racecourse
only a small fee of hkd10 to enjoy such a great night event
recommend buy beers from outside 7eleven before go in
Try your luck on the horses.. The atmosphere is great although it is not close to any of the major MTR stations or bus routes that I could find. You have to walk a little way to get there.
Fun night out.. Amazing to find a race course so near the centre of Hong Kong. Great Buzz only 10 HKD to enter. Betting starts at 20 HKD.

Worth To Visit - Even Though You're Not Horserace Fans. If you want to take a look at the racecoursefield, the cheapest way is to take a tram that goes to Happy Valley that circle round the area to give you a good look. Remember to stay in the upper deck and sit on the right side of the tram. If you want to look from the top, after visiting the Peak, take a bus that goes to Central (upper deck of course!) and you can have a view from the top. If you have time, just leave the tram at the terminal and walk around the residential area and enjoy the food provided by the restaurants/cafe there. You may be surprised on their quality - local taste! Don't go there too early (after 11:00 a.m.). Stay away from racing day if you are not the fans.
Amazing. I you are in HK on Wednesday night do not miss Happy Valley racecourse. A unique atmosphere, realy enjoyable even if you do not want a bet
In the middle of a city. This is bang in the middle of homes etc on your way va bus to ocean park , it's also quite nice to see ,I never went racing ,but if you like racing it would be good
Worth a couple of beers. Great crowd, great ambience. It's easy to let loose. The weather in Hong Kong is humid, so beer and cheering out loud do well to get the heat awway Way to go!

A brilliant use of space. The racecourse is very well maintained. The centre of the racecourse is being used for younger people to be able to play football. The racecourse has always been so efficiently run and is bursting with colour and energy.

Unique atmosphere. Not only a place to watch the race but also to look around and enjoy the feeling of being in a super Asian metropole. Entrance is pretty cheap (10 HKD only) but you can also book a room for special occasions incl. buffet and get an even better view from the other floors.

Great Wednesday night fun. Even if horse racing is not your passion this can be a very cheap night of fun. The beer garden with the locals & ex-pats has lots of atmosphere. If you are a horse racing follower then bring your passport & apply for a pass into the members for the night.

Go if you do not mind crowds.. Wednesday night at Happy Valley Races was an evening out that I had been looking forward to. I knew it was a popular event but I had no idea though just how crowded it would be! Getting there and away again afterwards is also something of a challenge, but if you do not mind crowds or being jostled all evening the atmosphere can be fun. It is something I am glad I have done anyway.

Great Fun. Great fun, lots of different options for seating. Food and bar available. Atmosphere is great with mixed of people from all corners of Hong Kong and beyond. Best to travel by MTR and walk to the racecourse as the roads get very congested on race nights.
Good spot to watch the races. Good for a visit to see the people chattering and cheering as they place a their bets and watch the horse races. Good for just one visit of you are not into horse racing
excellent race course. Most sophisticated high tech, efficient, the nest race course in the world. Many restaurants, all sorts of food, and the race course is beautiful surrounded by TV

Mammoth excitement. The race track buzzes for the weekly meetings (not in summer) and a towering level of anticipation. The ticker tape of the losing tickets from the stands is fun to watch. Great evening out if you don't win, stupendous evening if you do.It can be difficult to get transport to and from as the roads are chocka block. [We usually go to a bar in Happy Valley for 30 mins at the end to either drown our sorrows/forget our losses, or whoop it up. Then the traffic has cleared.]

This is a winner!. It is so easy to get to by local bus and we went here on a Wednesday night -- it was fantastic! It was packed/ noisy and brilliant. You cant go to H/K & not go here. The atmosphere is electric.

Fantastic Fun and a must. Night racing was great. Big crowds and fantastic atmosphere. TiP: Don't bother with visitor tickets to members, stuffy, limited access and seating, no drink areas easily accessible and frankly a ripoff. General admission is perfect and a party atmosphere.

A fun night out !. Despite the glamourous new Shatin Racecourse, Happy Valley maintains its historical charm . A beautiful course surrounded by modern buildings , old cemetaries ( hence the name, Happy Valley?? ) provides an evening of excitement . Good dining facilities as well.

Races in the City. This is a must visit! A Weds evening except I believe Jun/Jul/Aug. we often do the stable bend with the buffet incl. great food with free flowing wine and beers. Fun night if you book for a group of you! Taxi's are hard to get after so sometimes a good idea to leave before the last race.

The best spend of 10 hkd.... A fun night out with friends - spend 10 hong kong dollars and get a front row view of the races, complete with beer and some some-what tasty bar like food. You probably won't win (or it'll be beginner's luck!), but it's a really fun time full of entertainment value.

A bit confusing. We bought the tourist tickets at $100 and it took a while to work out where we were allowed to go with them. At first, it seemed to be a very small area (apart from the general access areas) but then we discovered a larger section so were happy in the end.

Free to get in, cheap food & reasonable alcohol. We went and got into the beer garden.Easy to walk from causeway bay, fully signposted in English.Very easy to place a bet, with very helpful staff to help & advise.Various types of food outlets including Mcdonalds, hotdogs, kebabs etc (not doner kebabs) Beer about £5 a pintWe had a good night, bet only £2 a race and of course lost most of the races.Give it a go - you don't have to go on an organised tour which saves lots of cash which you can then lose on the horses.

Not to be missed. Even for the non race goer this is a must. A very civilised social occasion. Entry is cheap and you'll have a night to remember in the "Beer Garden". Great snacks and plenty of beverages. Taxis are hard to get after the last race. Jump on a tram and head away to an MTR station

Wednesday night fun.. You got restaurants. You got a beer garden. You got friendly staff that will help you to bet and actually win some cash. This is the perfect plan for wednesdays after work. You get to meet people, have some adrenaline and enjoy food and music. Who could ask for more?
A great Hong Kong experience.. We went with a set tour booked with the Hong Kong Jockey Club.It was a wonderful evening from start to finish.

A memorable experience!. Went here with Asian business partners who had a vip lounge. Quite experience, be sure to walk down to track as far as you can to really take in the atmosphere! Plenty of food and drinks around, fun crowd and energetic vibe.
a night to remember. we booked through a travel agent, food and free flowing drinks all night with excellent views from high up, minimum bet 10 HKD so a cheap night.
Only races in Winter. Nothing to see in the Summer time. But during the winter time, it's worth going on Wednesdays and Saturdays for the race
Loved it.. Spend the extra and get the members tourist pass. No need to do one of the organised tours.
Like a huge pub!. Drinks and food... Great atmosphere... Occasional performance... To top it of, gambling!
awesome!. love the cheap beer, ambience and the horses! the locals cheer, so did i! Awesome night out!

A great racing course in Hong Kong. Very spacious, a brilliant night at the races. Good food and wine.
A spectacular event.
Good Racecourse. Happy Valley is a awesome racecourse. Some real good matches around the year. A must visit
Fantastic experience. It was such a nice experience to see the races and the whole event. There's a good atmosphere!
Unique. Cheap, fun, great night out. Wish we had one London.

Poor racing only 12 runners in each race!. Very very nice grandstands!!! Course very small, but nice lighting. The ground floor betting is absolutely small and poor! Even the toilets. Sha tin well well better! Food selection not that good. Plenty of beer tents but wheres the spirits? Live bands not entertaining the crowds. Racing is so poor only 12 runners per race! Anyway its 10hkd to enter

And their off and racing. what a race course, even before you go in the gate, the excitement is hitting you in the face, you can cut the the air with a knife.Although I dont bet, I always go to the races, its one of only a few that you can get to the fence and just about touch the horses

Fun Wednesday night - and free admission. Fllodlit horse racing takes place every Wednesday evening during the season (Oct to June) I was there last week and can recommend a visit. Good atmosphere especially if you are with a group. I paid HK$ 100 (about 8 quid) to gain admission to the members area (you need to take your passport wit you though) where there are good restaurants (need to book tables in advance). However if you just fancy a few beers admission is free to the beer garden which is track-side and where (it seems) most if the tourists / ex-pats hang out.
The best race course I have seen!. Adore the contrast! The stadium right in the middle of a living neighbourhood. Beer is cheap and there are good performance!
Night racing. Wednesday evening races are an interesting experience, no bokkies, just TAB. All the expats meet in the garden
Wednesdays race. Great to have fun with your friends have some beer and have some bet.

Excellent time and beautiful track. The track was in perfect condition, the view was great. We went on a Wednesday and with all the beer tents and live music it was more like a party with races happening every 20 minutes in the background. I would definitely go back.

A Sure Visit. There are two racecourses in Hong Kong with one in Shatin and this one in Hong Kong Island. There are some night races as well as day races but they do close for the summer. For those who have not visited a racecourse before, this is a sure visit spot. Try your luck and who knows, a fortune may be waiting for you!

At the track. We booked our trip through a tour. It cost around $100AUD which included return transfer, entry and buffet dinner and drinks. The racecourse scenery is amazing, nestled amongst the surrounding towers. Our seats were located on the top floor of the grandstand, at the corner of the track past the finishing post. The viewing was great, but it was far too high up to watch the racing. The food was okay, but nothing special. Overall it was a great night.

A great night at the races in HK!. Fantastic atmosphere, cheap to get in, beers and snacks in plentiful supply and even some horse racing! Place a few bets, taking help from the Jockey Club staff who are on hand to help fill in your slip and win or lose you'll be sure to have a great time!

One of the Highlights of our trip!. Happy Valley only just opened for the season at the end of our vacation last fall and we were luck to get in on openning day. We booked a tour package that picked us up outside of our hotel and it was so much fun. On the coach ride over, they explain all the betting to you. When you get there you are taken to the "member" entrance, which is really nice as the lines for the normal entrance were huge. You go up the elevator and you are in your own private A/C dining area for a gourmet buffet meal including all the wine, beer and mixed drinks you want. You have your own private persons to take your bets so you do not have to fight the crowds at the normal counters. You have your own private balcony to watch the race outside. Another highlight was being taken down to track level at the finish line to watch one race. The whole evening was a blast and I would highly recommend it even if you are not gamblers or into horse racing.
If you like horse racing this is the place. Find a Hong Kong friend and ask to be taken to a club floor.

Great entertainment and cheap. Easy to get to, come off the metro/underground at Causway Bay stn (Hong Kong Island). Take a taxi apx HKD $20-30. Entry $10 (£1) gets you right upto win post and parade ring and what an atmosphere even if you dont like racing, had band on when I went, plenty happening, very varied crowd and family friendly.There is also a train station at Happy Valley called happy Valley.dont miss, I believe only on Wed and Saturdays.
Great hike!. You can make it long or short, it up to you. It's a great way to experience HK island and the views are beautiful! Go ahead, do it, get out of the city, it's only 20 mins away.

Must-Do for Visitors and Residents Alike. Nothing is better than spending a Wednesday evening with a couple of friends, a couple of beers, and a few rounds of horse betting at the Happy Valley Racecourse. Can't find this type of atmosphere anywhere else in the world very easily. Best to go in the bleachers (lower area), on a day that's not too warm (perhaps in early spring or late autumn).

Racing Event. Excellent night out, go downstairs for the best atmosphere.Been here several times at corporsate events and with friends for a laugh, had a flutter on the horses, won some, lost some but not a huge gambler so just for fun.

Every Second Wednesday. We planned our stay in Hong Kong so that we could attend one of the Wednesday races. It was well worth it. We are not really into horse racing, but we loved the atmosphere. There are all high rises around the track. The track was lit up like a Xmas tree. On Wednesday's there are lots of ex-pats. We thoroughly enjoyed having a few drinks and a bet. Note, there are English speaking staff available to assist with filling out betting slips.

An amazing experience. What a place! The atmosphere is electric and I had to keep pinching myself as I looked around all the buildings lit up at night and then watched the horses racing. We lost! But go, it's not to be missed.
races. what a really great race cource you will love it here
HappyValley Racecource. Huge experience and lots of fun! Met people from all around the world, and never quite experienced a race track like that before. I even won!

Great Atmosphere. Always wanted to do this and it a lot of fun - Hot May night - just a real buzz we bought $100HK tourist ticket to members which was nothing special - next time I will just go with the locals for $10HKA must do in HK
Great fun!. We stayed in the beer garden area because suits and heels are required up above. It is great atmosphere!

Money, money, money. Being a seasoned horse-race aficionado, I cannot rate highly enough the atmosphere of the night races at Happy Valley race course. The prize money on offer and the total pool gambled is unbelievable. If you arrange it, book dinner at the chinese restaurant where you'll have a bird's eye view of the winning post whilst sitting in air-conditioned luxury. But do venture out to mingle with the masses and have a flutter or two - you just might end up winning your taxi fare home!

i dont do horse racing, but this was amazing!!. beautiful clean stadium, nice cold beer, nice food, great atmospherehorses so close you can touch themcheap entrygreat night out, couldn't believe it took me so long to get here!!amazing night view as well
Busy busy busy. I can't believe how packed the place was.....apparently the course generates a ton of money for the city (makes up for the low income tax in HK and lack of sales tax in HK)

Well worth a visit. Even if you're not a horse racing fan, this is yet another must do in the city that just makes you keep saying "WOW!" A very exciting atmosphere, the odd band between races and great for a bit of people watching, well worth the 80p($10HK) entry fee. The greenest grass you'll ever see!
Worth a visit. Just to see one of the best run, richest race course in the world.nothing compares to the care and money spent to maintain the course

Happy Wednesday!! Such a fun night. I love this place! If you can, go on Wednesday when they have Happy Wednesday...I'm not sure exactly why this day is special, but I know that I enjoyed it a ton. The entire complex is pretty impressive, and you can grab a drink and get a table directly against the fence, which is a lot of fun. I've been to other tracks around the world where you have to pay for this, so it was nice to see that anyone could get up close to the action. The setting itself is spectacular as you are right in the center of of huge cluster of buildings. As the horses come running by, they are backed by the beautiful city lights from the tall buildings- very cool (and makes for some great pictures!)The betting counters are easy to find, and there are staff members milling about the crowd offering betting 'advice' if you're interested. There are a food options, and many drink options.
Racing. The night racing is spectacular. A must visit on a Wednesday Night

love the atmosphere!. anyone who goes to hk on a wed must definitely check out the happy valley racecourse. The atmosphere is electricfying as the horses run their races and of course, there must be tons of beer on the side to make it the perfect moment.do check out the website for the racecourse to determine if there's a race happening that night as not every wed will have a race scheduled

Enjoyable Wed night at the races. Wed night at the races is an institution in Hong Kong and if you enjoy having a few drinks and placing a friendly bet, I definitely recommend visiting Happy Valley Racecourse. Entry is cheap and once you enter the stadium the atmosphere is palpable. You'll find drink stands and food stalls scattered around. Don't expect fine dining here. It's more fast food style. Enjoy!
Wednesday Night Races. Poped to the wednesday night race meeting. First horse race I've seen in the dark, its massively popular too and entrance is very cheap. Worth a visit.
Good for a visit. Enjoyable party like atmosphere at the ground level and some thrilling races, just make sure to place a bet.

10HKD Beer night or rent a box and have the buffet!. Stand down on the ground and drink beer on the cheap and hear the horses hooves as they roar around the track - or rent a box with friends and sit in air con for the evening or outside - the box comes with a buffet dinner - good food and a great thing to do with a group.

Fun way to spend a Wed. night. Evening racing at Happy Valley was a lot of fun. Great venue in the heart of the city - nothing quite like taking in quality horse racing surrounded by high rises and the general bustle of Hong Kong.

A must do. The locals love to gamble which is very restricted by law in Hong Kong.
Tick this box off and you do not need a box upstairs to enjoy. Tourists have options in BBQ balconys but I recommend being trackside surrounded by fast food, beer tents and of course lots of friendly advice on how to bet in different ways.

Only go with as much money as you're happy to lose!. Went in February for an evening meet. Great evening. I didn't realise that whatever bet you put on/however early, you only get the starting gate rate, so take your time and see how the betting goes! Plenty of staff around to help you place a bet. Flat-racing not hurdles, so if you don't know local horse/jockey/trainer just follow the guide in the race meet programme.... or just use a pin! Great atmosphere. Drinks reasonable. Kebabs not much flavour. Position yourself on the first floor front public gallery balcony and just people-watch. Just as much fun as the races!

First visit to the races. We enjoyed a great evening at the races - first ever visit to any racecourse. We took the tram to the racecourse all the way from Central and then entered via the General Entry - a bargain at $10 (HK) . Far from having to stand in a jostling crowd as we had feared, we found seats above the ring where the horses walk round prior to the race. We also had good views of the finish line. There were kiosks with food and drink for sale and the betting was simple - very helpful staff and no queues. We lost of course but I guess choosing winners is a bit more technical than choosing names that appeal!!! Happy Valley is a great evening out.
Good for Running. Great for running, especially for temp and interval workouts. I haven't been to the races yet.

racing in Hong Kong. I am a VRC member and when I travel OS I go to the races as a reciprocal member. I have gone to the races at Happy Valley and Sha Tin and both are a great experience. Sha Tin is a bit better than Happy Valley for food, but Happy Valley better than Sha Tin for location Both are a great day/night out

Great place for corporate entertainment. We hosted a networking reception at Happy Valley Racecourse and everyone agreed that it was a great experience. The setting is quite dramatic - such a vast place in the middle of overcrowded city. The food was delicious, staff extremely helpful and the gambling experience just interesting - not something I would do very often but that probably the main reason why I enjoyed it.
Good Wednesday night out.. Plenty of beer and a great place to watch the ponies! Having a bet is easy and the staff are very helpful. Food not bad either just don't expect a sit down meal.

Night Races. Purchased tickets to Happy Valley from the desk at our hotel. The price of was inclusive of transport to and from the hotel, buffet dinner and unlimited drinks, visit to the saddling enclosure and witnessing a race from the finishing line. We are not regular race goers so we did not take any real notice of conditions etc. that regulars would but it was a fun evening and the night racing was good to see.

It was part of the tour though. Nothing is wrong. Just think that the racecourse needs money which I didn't have. Yet hobnobbing with the locals serious about this stuff and betting serious money too is scary for me. The horses were fine though. The Formula 1 on those times.
